HP:0000532.name: Abnormal chorioretinal morphology
HP:0000532.definition: An abnormality of the choroid and retina.
HP:0000532.name_cn: 异常脉络膜视网膜形态

HP:0000533.name: Chorioretinal atrophy
HP:0000533.definition: Atrophy of the choroid and retinal layers of the fundus.
HP:0000533.definition_cn: 脉络膜及视网膜层萎缩。

HP:0000537.name: Epicanthus inversus
HP:0000537.definition: A fold of skin starting at or just below the medial aspect of the lower lid and arching upward to cover, extend in front of and lateral to the medial canthus.
HP:0000537.definition_cn: 一条皮肤皱襞起始于或略低于下睑内侧，向上弧形延伸，覆盖、延伸至并位于内眦前方及外侧。

HP:0000538.name: Pseudopapilledema
HP:0000538.definition: Apparent optic disc swelling in the absence of increased intracranial pressure.
HP:0000538.definition_cn: 无明显颅内压增高情况下的视盘水肿。

HP:0000539.name: Abnormality of refraction
HP:0000539.definition: An abnormality in the process of focusing of light by the eye in order to produce a sharp image on the retina.
HP:0000539.definition_cn: 眼球屈光系统在聚焦光线以在视网膜上形成清晰影像的过程中出现的异常。

HP:0000540.name: Hypermetropia
HP:0000540.definition: An abnormality of refraction characterized by the ability to see objects in the distance clearly, while objects nearby appear blurry.
HP:0000540.definition_cn: 屈光不正的一种异常表现，其特征为远视力清晰而近视力模糊。

HP:0000541.name: Retinal detachment
HP:0000541.definition: Separation of the inner layers of the retina (neural retina) from the pigment epithelium.
HP:0000541.definition_cn: 视网膜内层（神经视网膜）与色素上皮层的分离。

HP:0000542.name: Impaired ocular adduction
HP:0000542.definition: Reduced ability to move the eye in the direction of the nose.
HP:0000542.definition_cn: 内收眼球运动功能减退。

HP:0000543.name: Optic disc pallor
HP:0000543.definition: A pale yellow discoloration of the optic disc (the area of the optic nerve head in the retina). The optic disc normally has a pinkish hue with a central yellowish depression.
HP:0000543.definition_cn: 视盘（视网膜中视神经头部的区域）呈现淡黄色变色。正常情况下，视盘呈粉红色，中央有黄色凹陷。

HP:0000544.name: External ophthalmoplegia
HP:0000544.definition: Paralysis of the external ocular muscles.

HP:0000545.name: Myopia
HP:0000545.definition: An abnormality of refraction characterized by the ability to see objects nearby clearly, while objects in the distance appear blurry.
HP:0000545.definition_cn: 屈光不正的一种异常表现，其特征为近处物体清晰可见，而远处物体则呈现模糊。

HP:0000546.name: Retinal degeneration
HP:0000546.definition: A nonspecific term denoting degeneration of the retinal pigment epithelium and/or retinal photoreceptor cells.
HP:0000546.definition_cn: 非特异性术语，指视网膜色素上皮和/或视网膜感光细胞的退行性病变。

HP:0000547.name: obsolete Tapetoretinal degeneration
HP:0000547.name_cn: 陈旧性视网膜色素变性

HP:0000549.name: Abnormal conjugate eye movement
HP:0000549.definition: Any deviation from the normal motor coordination of the eyes that allows for bilateral fixation on a single object.
HP:0000549.definition_cn: 任何偏离正常眼球运动协调机制，导致双眼无法同时注视单一目标的现象。

HP:0000550.name: Undetectable electroretinogram
HP:0000550.definition: Lack of any response to stimulation upon electroretinography.
HP:0000550.definition_cn: 视网膜电图检查中刺激无任何反应。

HP:0000551.name: Color vision defect
HP:0000551.definition: An anomaly in the ability to discriminate between or recognize colors.
HP:0000551.definition_cn: 色觉辨别或识别能力异常。

HP:0000552.name: Tritanomaly
HP:0000552.definition: Difficulty distinguishing between yellow and blue, possible related to dysfunction of the S photopigment.
HP:0000552.definition_cn: 难以区分黄色和蓝色，可能与S视色素功能障碍相关。

HP:0000553.name: Abnormal uvea morphology
HP:0000553.definition: An abnormality of the uvea, the vascular layer of the eyeball.
HP:0000553.definition_cn: 葡萄膜异常，即眼球血管层的异常。

HP:0000554.name: Uveitis
HP:0000554.definition: Inflammation of one or all portions of the uveal tract.
HP:0000554.definition_cn: 葡萄膜部分或全部炎症。

HP:0000555.name: Leukocoria
HP:0000555.definition: An abnormal white reflection from the pupil rather than the usual black reflection.
HP:0000555.definition_cn: 瞳孔异常白色反射而非正常黑色反射。

HP:0000556.name: Retinal dystrophy
HP:0000556.definition: Retinal dystrophy is an abnormality of the retina associated with a hereditary process. Retinal dystrophies are defined by their predominantly monogenic inheritance and they are frequently associated with loss or dysfunction of photoreceptor cells as a primary or secondary event.
HP:0000556.definition_cn: 视网膜营养不良是一种与遗传过程相关的视网膜异常。视网膜营养不良主要由单基因遗传定义，并且通常与光感受器细胞的丧失或功能障碍作为原发性或继发性事件相关。

HP:0000557.name: Buphthalmos
HP:0000557.definition: Diffusely large eye (with megalocornea) associated with glaucoma.
HP:0000557.definition_cn: 弥漫性大眼（伴巨角膜）合并青光眼。

HP:0000558.name: Rieger anomaly
HP:0000558.definition: A congenital malformation of the anterior segment characterized by iridicorneal malformation, glaucoma, iris stroma hypoplasia, posterior embryotoxon, and corneal opacities.
HP:0000558.definition_cn: 一种前节先天性畸形，其特征为虹膜角膜畸形、青光眼、虹膜基质发育不全、后胚胎环和角膜混浊。

HP:0000563.name: Keratoconus
HP:0000563.definition: A cone-shaped deformity of the cornea characterized by the presence of corneal distortion secondary to thinning of the apex.
HP:0000563.definition_cn: 圆锥角膜，其特征为角膜顶点变薄导致的继发性角膜变形。

HP:0000564.name: Lacrimal duct atresia
HP:0000564.definition: A developmental disorder of the lacrimal drainage system that most often affects the lacrimal ostium and resulting in non-opening of the nasolacrimal duct. It usually results from a non-canalization of the nasolacrimal duct.
HP:0000564.definition_cn: 泪道系统发育障碍，最常累及泪点，导致鼻泪管未开放。通常由鼻泪管未形成管腔所致。

HP:0000565.name: Esotropia
HP:0000565.definition: A form of strabismus with one or both eyes turned inward ('crossed') to a relatively severe degree, usually defined as 10 diopters or more.
HP:0000565.definition_cn: 一种内斜视（esotropia）形式，表现为单眼或双眼向内偏斜（“交叉”）至相对严重的程度，通常定义为10屈光度（diopters）或以上。

HP:0000567.name: Chorioretinal coloboma
HP:0000567.definition: Absence of a region of the retina, retinal pigment epithelium, and choroid.
HP:0000567.definition_cn: 视网膜、视网膜色素上皮和脉络膜区域缺失。

HP:0000568.name: Microphthalmia
HP:0000568.definition: A developmental anomaly characterized by abnormal smallness of one or both eyes.
HP:0000568.definition_cn: 一种发育异常，其特征为单侧或双侧眼球异常缩小。

HP:0000570.name: Abnormal saccadic eye movements
HP:0000570.definition: An abnormality of eye movement characterized by impairment of fast (saccadic) eye movements.
HP:0000570.definition_cn: 一种眼球运动异常，其特征为快速（扫视性）眼球运动受损。

HP:0000571.name: Hypometric saccades
HP:0000571.definition: Saccadic undershoot, i.e., a saccadic eye movement that has less than the magnitude that would be required to gain fixation of the object.
HP:0000571.definition_cn: 扫视不足，即扫视性眼球运动的幅度小于获取目标物体固视所需的幅度。

HP:0000572.name: Visual loss
HP:0000572.definition: Loss of visual acuity (implying that vision was better at a certain time point in life). Otherwise the term reduced visual acuity should be used (or a subclass of that).
HP:0000572.definition_cn: 视力减退（暗示在生命中的某个时间点视力较好）。否则应使用视力下降这一术语（或其子类）。

HP:0000574.name: Thick eyebrow
HP:0000574.definition: Increased density/number and/or increased diameter of eyebrow hairs.
HP:0000574.definition_cn: 眉毛毛发的密度/数量增加和/或直径增大。

HP:0000575.name: Scotoma
HP:0000575.definition: A regional and pathological increase of the light detection threshold in any region of the visual field surrounded by a field of normal or relatively well-preserved vision.
HP:0000575.definition_cn: 视野中任何区域出现光检测阈值的局部病理性升高，周围环绕着正常或相对保存较好的视野区域。

HP:0000576.name: Centrocecal scotoma
HP:0000576.definition: A scotoma (area of diminished vision within the visual field) located between the central point of fixation and the blind spot with a roughly horizontal oval shape.
HP:0000576.definition_cn: 位于注视中心点与生理盲点之间的视野缺损区域，呈近似水平椭圆形，称为旁中心暗点（scotoma）。

HP:0000577.name: Exotropia
HP:0000577.definition: A form of strabismus with one or both eyes deviated outward.

HP:0000580.name: Pigmentary retinopathy
HP:0000580.definition: An abnormality of the retina characterized by pigment deposition. It is typically associated with migration and proliferation of macrophages or retinal pigment epithelial cells into the retina; melanin from these cells causes the pigmentary changes. Pigmentary retinopathy is a common final pathway of many retinal conditions and is often associated with visual loss.
HP:0000580.definition_cn: 视网膜色素异常，其特征为色素沉积。通常与巨噬细胞或视网膜色素上皮细胞向视网膜内的迁移和增殖相关；这些细胞中的黑色素导致色素改变。色素性视网膜病变是多种视网膜疾病的常见最终途径，常伴随视力丧失。

HP:0000581.name: Blepharophimosis
HP:0000581.definition: A fixed reduction in the vertical distance between the upper and lower eyelids with short palpebral fissures.
HP:0000581.definition_cn: 上睑与下睑之间垂直距离固定性缩短，伴睑裂短小。

HP:0000582.name: Upslanted palpebral fissure
HP:0000582.definition: The palpebral fissure inclination is more than two standard deviations above the mean for age (objective); or, the inclination of the palpebral fissure is greater than typical for age.
HP:0000582.definition_cn: 睑裂倾斜度超过年龄均值两个标准差以上（客观）；或，睑裂倾斜度大于同龄典型值。

HP:0000585.name: Band keratopathy
HP:0000585.definition: An abnormality of the cornea characterized by the deposition of calcium in a band across the central cornea, leading to decreased vision, foreign body sensation, and ocular irritation.
HP:0000585.definition_cn: 角膜钙化带异常，其特征为钙质沉积于角膜中央带状区域，导致视力下降、异物感及眼部刺激症状。

HP:0000586.name: Shallow orbits
HP:0000586.definition: Reduced depth of the orbits associated with prominent-appearing ocular globes.
HP:0000586.definition_cn: 眼眶深度减小伴眼球突出。

HP:0000588.name: Optic disc coloboma
HP:0000588.definition: A cleft of the optic nerve that extends inferiorly.
HP:0000588.definition_cn: 视神经下方延伸的裂隙。

HP:0000589.name: Coloboma
HP:0000589.definition: A developmental defect characterized by a cleft of some portion of the eye or ocular adnexa.
HP:0000589.definition_cn: 一种发育缺陷，其特征为眼部或眼附属器的某部分存在裂隙。

HP:0000590.name: Progressive external ophthalmoplegia
HP:0000590.definition: Initial bilateral ptosis followed by limitation of eye movements in all directions and slowing of saccades.
HP:0000590.definition_cn: 初始双侧上睑下垂，随后出现各方向眼球运动受限及扫视运动减慢。

HP:0000592.name: Blue sclerae
HP:0000592.definition: An abnormal bluish coloration of the sclera.

HP:0000593.name: Abnormal anterior chamber morphology
HP:0000593.definition: Abnormality of the anterior chamber, which is the space in the eye that is behind the cornea and in front of the iris.
HP:0000593.definition_cn: 前房异常，即位于角膜后方和虹膜前方的眼内空间。

HP:0000594.name: Shallow anterior chamber
HP:0000594.definition: Reduced depth of the anterior chamber, i.e., the anteroposterior distance between the cornea and the iris is decreased.
HP:0000594.definition_cn: 前房深度变浅，即角膜与虹膜之间的前后距离缩短。

HP:0000597.name: Ophthalmoparesis
HP:0000597.definition: Ophthalmoplegia is a paralysis or weakness of one or more of the muscles that control eye movement.
HP:0000597.definition_cn: 眼肌麻痹是指控制眼球运动的一块或多块肌肉出现麻痹或无力。

HP:0000599.name: Abnormality of the frontal hairline
HP:0000599.definition: An anomaly in the placement or shape of the hairline (trichion) on the forehead, that is, the border between skin on the forehead that has head hair and that does not.
HP:0000599.definition_cn: 前额发际线（trichion）位置或形态异常，即前额有毛发区域与无毛发区域之间的边界异常。

HP:0000600.name: Abnormality of the pharynx
HP:0000600.definition: An anomaly of the pharynx, i.e., of the tubular structure extending from the base of the skull superiorly to the esophageal inlet inferiorly.
HP:0000600.definition_cn: 咽部异常，即从颅底上方延伸至食管入口下方的管状结构异常。

HP:0000601.name: Hypotelorism
HP:0000601.definition: Interpupillary distance less than 2 SD below the mean (alternatively, the appearance of an decreased interpupillary distance or closely spaced eyes).
HP:0000601.definition_cn: 瞳孔间距低于平均值2个标准差（或表现为瞳孔间距减小或眼距过近）。

HP:0000602.name: Ophthalmoplegia
HP:0000602.definition: Paralysis of one or more extraocular muscles that are responsible for eye movements.
HP:0000602.definition_cn: 单条或多条眼外肌麻痹，影响眼球运动功能。

HP:0000603.name: Central scotoma
HP:0000603.definition: An area of depressed vision located at the point of fixation and that interferes with central vision.
HP:0000603.definition_cn: 位于注视点的视野缺损区域，干扰中心视力。

HP:0000605.name: Supranuclear gaze palsy
HP:0000605.definition: A supranuclear gaze palsy is an inability to look in a particular direction as a result of cerebral impairment. There is a loss of the voluntary aspect of eye movements, but, as the brainstem is still intact, all the reflex conjugate eye movements are normal.
HP:0000605.definition_cn: 核上性凝视麻痹是由于大脑损伤导致的特定方向注视不能。眼球运动的随意性成分丧失，但由于脑干功能完好，所有反射性共轭眼球运动均正常。

HP:0000606.name: Abnormality of the periorbital region
HP:0000606.definition: An abnormality of the region situated around the orbit of the eye.

HP:0000608.name: Macular degeneration
HP:0000608.definition: A nonspecific term denoting degeneration of the retinal pigment epithelium and/or retinal photoreceptor cells of the macula lutea.
HP:0000608.definition_cn: 一个非特异性术语，表示黄斑区视网膜色素上皮和/或视网膜感光细胞的退行性病变。

HP:0000610.name: Abnormal choroid morphology
HP:0000610.definition: Any structural abnormality of the choroid.

HP:0000613.name: Photophobia
HP:0000613.definition: Excessive sensitivity to light with the sensation of discomfort or pain in the eyes due to exposure to bright light.
HP:0000613.definition_cn: Photophobia with associated ocular discomfort or pain upon exposure to bright light.

HP:0000614.name: Abnormal nasolacrimal system morphology
HP:0000614.definition: An abnormality of the nasolacrimal drainage system, which serves as a conduit for tear flow from the external eye to the nasal cavity.
HP:0000614.definition_cn: 鼻泪管引流系统异常，该系统作为泪液从外眼流向鼻腔的通道。

HP:0000616.name: Miosis
HP:0000616.definition_cn: 瞳孔异常（非生理性）收缩。

HP:0000617.name: Abnormality of ocular smooth pursuit
HP:0000617.definition: An abnormality of eye movement characterized by impaired smooth-pursuit eye movements.
HP:0000617.definition_cn: 眼球运动异常，表现为平滑追踪眼球运动受损。

HP:0000618.name: Blindness
HP:0000618.definition: Blindness is the condition of lacking visual perception defined as a profound reduction in visual perception. On the 6m visual acuity scale, blindness is defined as less than 3/60. On the 20ft visual acuity scale, blindness is defined as less than 20/400. On the decimal visual acuity scale, blindness is defined as less than 0.05. Blindness is typically characterized by a visual field of no greater than 10 degrees in radius around central fixation.
HP:0000618.definition_cn: 失明是指视觉感知严重缺失的状态，定义为视觉感知的显著降低。在6米视力表上，失明定义为视力低于3/60。在20英尺视力表上，失明定义为视力低于20/400。在小数视力表上，失明定义为视力低于0.05。失明通常表现为以中央注视点为中心、半径不超过10度的视野范围。

HP:0000619.name: Impaired convergence
HP:0000619.definition: Reduced ability to turn the eyes inward in order to focus on a nearby object.
HP:0000619.definition_cn: 内聚功能减退（Reduced convergence ability）

HP:0000621.name: Entropion
HP:0000621.definition: An abnormal inversion (turning inward) of the eyelid (usually the lower) towards the globe. Entropion is usually acquired as a result of involutional or cicatricial processes but may occasionally be congenital.
HP:0000621.definition_cn: 眼睑（通常为下眼睑）向眼球方向异常内翻。睑内翻通常是由于退行性或瘢痕性病变所致，但偶尔也可能是先天性的。

HP:0000622.name: Blurred vision
HP:0000622.definition: Lack of sharpness of vision resulting in the inability to see fine detail.
HP:0000622.definition_cn: 视觉锐度减退导致无法辨识精细细节。

HP:0000623.name: Supranuclear ophthalmoplegia
HP:0000623.definition: A vertical gaze palsy with inability to direct the gaze of the eyes downwards.
HP:0000623.definition_cn: 垂直凝视麻痹伴眼球向下凝视不能。

HP:0000625.name: Eyelid coloboma
HP:0000625.definition: A short discontinuity of the margin of the lower or upper eyelid.
HP:0000625.definition_cn: 下睑或上睑缘的短暂性不连续。

HP:0000627.name: Posterior embryotoxon
HP:0000627.definition: A posterior embryotoxon is the presence of a prominent and anteriorly displaced line of Schwalbe.
HP:0000627.definition_cn: 后胚胎环是指施瓦贝线显著且前移的一种表现。

HP:0000631.name: Retinal arterial tortuosity
HP:0000631.definition: The presence of an increased number of twists and turns of the retinal artery.
HP:0000631.definition_cn: 视网膜动脉迂曲度增加。

HP:0000633.name: Decreased lacrimation
HP:0000633.definition: Abnormally decreased lacrimation, that is, reduced tear production.
HP:0000633.definition_cn: 泪液分泌异常减少，即泪液生成减少。

HP:0000634.name: Impaired ocular abduction
HP:0000634.definition: An impaired ability of the eye to move in the outward direction (towards the side of the head).
HP:0000634.definition_cn: 眼球外展功能障碍（向头部侧方运动能力受损）。

HP:0000635.name: Blue irides
HP:0000635.definition: A markedly blue coloration of the iris.

HP:0000636.name: Upper eyelid coloboma
HP:0000636.definition: A short discontinuity of the margin of the upper eyelid.

HP:0000637.name: Long palpebral fissure
HP:0000637.definition: Distance between medial and lateral canthi is more than two standard deviations above the mean for age (objective); or, apparently increased length of the palpebral fissures.
HP:0000637.definition_cn: 内眦与外眦之间的距离超过该年龄组平均值的两个标准差（客观）；或，睑裂长度明显增加。

HP:0000639.name: Nystagmus
HP:0000639.definition: Rhythmic, involuntary oscillations of one or both eyes related to abnormality in fixation, conjugate gaze, or vestibular mechanisms.
HP:0000639.definition_cn: 与注视异常、共轭凝视或前庭机制相关的单眼或双眼节律性、不自主振荡。

HP:0000640.name: Gaze-evoked nystagmus
HP:0000640.definition: Nystagmus made apparent by looking to the right or to the left.
HP:0000640.definition_cn: 向右侧或左侧注视时显现的眼震。

HP:0000641.name: Dysmetric saccades
HP:0000641.definition: The controller signal for saccadic eye movements has two components: the pulse that moves the eye rapidly from one point to the next, and the step that holds the eye in the new position. When both the pulse and the step are not the correct size, a dysmetric refixation eye movement results.
HP:0000641.definition_cn: 控制扫视眼动的信号包含两个组成部分：脉冲（pulse）使眼球快速从一个点移动到下一个点，而阶梯（step）则使眼球保持在新的位置。当脉冲和阶梯的幅度均不准确时，会导致度量失调性再注视眼动（dysmetric refixation eye movement）。

HP:0000642.name: Red-green dyschromatopsia
HP:0000642.definition: Difficulty with discriminating red and green hues.

HP:0000643.name: Blepharospasm
HP:0000643.definition: A focal dystonia that affects the muscles of the eyelids and brow, associated with involuntary recurrent spasm of both eyelids.
HP:0000643.definition_cn: 眼睑痉挛（Blepharospasm），一种局灶性肌张力障碍（Focal Dystonia），累及眼睑及眉部肌肉，表现为双侧眼睑不自主反复痉挛。

HP:0000646.name: Amblyopia
HP:0000646.definition: Reduced visual acuity that is uncorrectable by lenses in the absence of detectable anatomic defects in the eye or visual pathways.
HP:0000646.definition_cn: 无法通过镜片矫正的视力减退，且在眼球或视觉通路中未检测到可识别的解剖学缺陷。

HP:0000647.name: Sclerocornea
HP:0000647.definition: A congenital anomaly in which a part or the whole of the cornea acquires the characteristics of sclera, resulting in clouding of the cornea.
HP:0000647.definition_cn: 一种先天性异常，其中部分或全部角膜获得巩膜的特征，导致角膜混浊。

HP:0000648.name: Optic atrophy
HP:0000648.definition: Atrophy of the optic nerve. Optic atrophy results from the death of the retinal ganglion cell axons that comprise the optic nerve and manifesting as a pale optic nerve on fundoscopy.
HP:0000648.definition_cn: 视神经萎缩。视神经萎缩是由于视网膜神经节细胞轴突的死亡所致，这些轴突构成了视神经，并在眼底镜检查中表现为视神经苍白。

HP:0000649.name: Abnormality of visual evoked potentials
HP:0000649.definition: An anomaly of visually evoked potentials (VEP), which are electrical potentials, initiated by brief visual stimuli, which are recorded from the scalp overlying the visual cortex.
HP:0000649.definition_cn: 视觉诱发电位（VEP）异常，即由短暂视觉刺激引发的电位，记录自覆盖视觉皮层的头皮区域。

HP:0000650.name: Abnormal amplitude of pattern reversal visual evoked potentials
HP:0000650.name_cn: 模式反转视觉诱发电位振幅异常

HP:0000651.name: Diplopia
HP:0000651.definition: Diplopia is a condition in which a single object is perceived as two images, it is also known as double vision.
HP:0000651.definition_cn: 复视是一种单眼或双眼将一个物体感知为两个影像的视觉障碍，亦称为双视症。

HP:0000652.name: Lower eyelid coloboma
HP:0000652.definition: A short discontinuity of the margin of the lower eyelid.

HP:0000654.name: Decreased light- and dark-adapted electroretinogram amplitude
HP:0000654.definition: Decreased amplitude of eletrical response upon electroretinography.
HP:0000654.name_cn: 明适应和暗适应视网膜电图振幅降低
HP:0000654.definition_cn: 视网膜电图检查显示电反应幅度降低。

HP:0000655.name: obsolete Vitreoretinal degeneration
HP:0000655.name_cn: 陈旧性玻璃体视网膜变性

HP:0000656.name: Ectropion
HP:0000656.definition: An outward turning (eversion) or rotation of the eyelid margin.
HP:0000656.definition_cn: 眼睑外翻或眼睑缘旋转。

HP:0000657.name: Oculomotor apraxia
HP:0000657.definition: Ocular motor apraxia is a deficiency in voluntary, horizontal, lateral, fast eye movements (saccades) with retention of slow pursuit movements. The inability to follow objects visually is often compensated by head movements. There may be decreased smooth pursuit, and cancelation of the vestibulo-ocular reflex.
HP:0000657.definition_cn: 眼动失用症是一种在自主性、水平性、侧向性、快速眼球运动（扫视）方面的缺陷，同时保留缓慢追踪运动。视觉上无法跟随物体通常通过头部运动来补偿。可能存在平滑追踪运动减弱和前庭-眼反射的取消。

HP:0000659.name: Peters anomaly
HP:0000659.definition: A form of anterior segment dysgenesis in which abnormal cleavage of the anterior chamber occurs. Peters anomaly is characterized by central, paracentral, or complete corneal opacity.
HP:0000659.definition_cn: 一种前节发育异常，表现为前房异常分裂。彼得斯异常的特征是中央、旁中央或完全性角膜混浊。

HP:0000660.name: Lipemia retinalis
HP:0000660.definition: A creamy appearance of the retinal blood vessels that occurs when the concentration of lipids in the blood are extremely increased, with pale pink to milky white retinal vessels and altered pale reflexes from choroidal vasculature.
HP:0000660.definition_cn: 视网膜血管呈现奶油样外观，这是由于血液中脂质浓度极度升高所致，表现为视网膜血管呈淡粉色至乳白色，且脉络膜血管的反射光发生改变，呈现苍白色。

HP:0000662.name: Nyctalopia
HP:0000662.definition: Inability to see well at night or in poor light.
HP:0000662.definition_cn: 夜盲症（Nyctalopia）或暗适应障碍（Dark Adaptation Dysfunction）。

HP:0000664.name: Synophrys
HP:0000664.definition: Meeting of the medial eyebrows in the midline.

HP:0000666.name: Horizontal nystagmus
HP:0000666.definition: Nystagmus consisting of horizontal to-and-fro eye movements.
HP:0000666.definition_cn: 由水平往返眼球运动组成的眼球震颤。

HP:0000667.name: Phthisis bulbi
HP:0000667.definition: Atrophy of the eyeball with blindness and decreased intraocular pressure due to end-stage intraocular disease.
HP:0000667.definition_cn: 眼球萎缩伴失明及眼内压降低，继发于终末期眼内疾病。

HP:0000668.name: Hypodontia
HP:0000668.definition: The absence of five or less teeth from the normal series by a failure to develop.
HP:0000668.definition_cn: 先天性牙列缺失（Hypodontia）表现为正常牙列中五颗或更少牙齿因发育障碍而缺失。

HP:0000670.name: Carious teeth
HP:0000670.definition: Caries is a multifactorial bacterial infection affecting the structure of the tooth. This term has been used to describe the presence of more than expected dental caries.
HP:0000670.definition_cn: 龋齿是一种多因素细菌感染，影响牙齿结构。该术语用于描述超出预期的龋齿存在情况。

HP:0000674.name: Anodontia
HP:0000674.definition: The absence of all teeth from the normal series by a failure to develop.

HP:0000675.name: Macrodontia of permanent maxillary central incisor
HP:0000675.definition: Increased size of the maxillary central secondary incisor tooth.
HP:0000675.name_cn: 恒牙上颌中切牙巨牙症
HP:0000675.definition_cn: 上颌中切牙继发牙体增大。

HP:0000676.name: Abnormality of the incisor
HP:0000676.definition: An abnormality of the Incisor tooth.

HP:0000677.name: Oligodontia
HP:0000677.definition: The absence of six or more teeth from the normal series by a failure to develop.
HP:0000677.definition_cn: 先天性六颗或以上牙齿缺失。

HP:0000678.name: Dental crowding
HP:0000678.definition: Changes in alignment of teeth in the dental arch
HP:0000678.definition_cn: 牙弓内牙齿排列的变化

HP:0000679.name: Taurodontia
HP:0000679.definition: Increased volume of dental pulp of permanent molar characterized by a crown body-root ratio equal or larger than 1:1 or an elongated pulp chambers and apical displacement of the bifurcation or trifurcation of the roots.
HP:0000679.definition_cn: 恒磨牙牙髓体积增大，其特征为冠体-根比例等于或大于1:1，或牙髓腔延长，以及根分叉或三叉的根尖移位。

HP:0000680.name: Delayed eruption of primary teeth
HP:0000680.definition: Delayed tooth eruption affecting the primary dentition.

HP:0000682.name: Abnormal dental enamel morphology
HP:0000682.definition: An abnormality of the dental enamel.

HP:0000683.name: Grayish enamel
HP:0000683.definition: A gray discoloration of the dental enamel.

HP:0000684.name: Delayed eruption of teeth
HP:0000684.definition: Delayed tooth eruption, which can be defined as tooth eruption more than 2 SD beyond the mean eruption age.
HP:0000684.definition_cn: 迟萌牙，可定义为牙齿萌出时间超过平均萌出年龄2个标准差以上。

HP:0000687.name: Widely spaced teeth
HP:0000687.definition: Increased spaces (diastemata) between most of the teeth in the same dental arch.
HP:0000687.definition_cn: 同一牙弓内多数牙齿之间的间隙增大（牙间隙）。

HP:0000689.name: Dental malocclusion
HP:0000689.definition: Dental malocclusion refers to an abnormality of the occlusion, or alignment, of the teeth and the way the upper and lower teeth fit together, resulting in overcrowding of teeth or in abnormal bite patterns.
HP:0000689.definition_cn: 牙列错颌畸形（Dental Malocclusion）是指牙齿咬合关系或排列异常，表现为上下颌牙齿对合方式异常，导致牙列拥挤或咬合模式异常。

HP:0000690.name: Agenesis of maxillary lateral incisor
HP:0000690.definition: Agenesis of one or more maxillary lateral incisor, comprising the maxillary lateral primary incisor and maxillary lateral secondary incisor.
HP:0000690.definition_cn: 单侧或双侧上颌侧切牙缺失，包括上颌乳侧切牙及上颌恒侧切牙。

HP:0000691.name: Microdontia
HP:0000691.definition: Decreased size of the teeth, which can be defined as a mesiodistal tooth diameter (width) more than 2 SD below mean. Alternatively, an apparently decreased maximum width of tooth.
HP:0000691.definition_cn: 牙齿尺寸减小，可定义为近远中牙径（宽度）低于平均值2个标准差以上。或表现为牙齿最大宽度明显减小。

HP:0000692.name: Tooth malposition
HP:0000692.definition: Abnormal alignment, positioning, or spacing of the teeth, i.e., misaligned teeth.
HP:0000692.definition_cn: 牙齿排列异常、位置异常或间隙异常，即错位牙。

HP:0000694.name: Odontodysplasia
HP:0000694.definition: The diagnosis odontodysplasia requires clinical and radiological exams, in which unusually large pulp chambers and large pulp room chambers with thin enamel and dentin are visible. It may affect either a single tooth or several teeth. The term regional odontodysplasia is used if several teeth are affected. It affects the deciduous and permanent dentitions in the maxilla, the mandible or both, although the maxilla is more frequently involved. A type of dental dysplasia occurring in dentinogenesis imperfecta in which the pulp chambers are enlarged and there is a reduced amount of coronal dentin.
HP:0000694.definition_cn: 牙体发育不良的诊断需要临床和放射学检查，其中可见异常增大的牙髓腔和牙髓室，伴有釉质和牙本质变薄。该病可能影响单颗牙齿或多颗牙齿。若多颗牙齿受累，则使用“区域性牙体发育不良”这一术语。该病可累及上颌、下颌或两者的乳牙列和恒牙列，但上颌更为常见。一种发生在牙本质发育不全中的牙体发育不良类型，表现为牙髓腔扩大且冠部牙本质减少。

HP:0000695.name: Natal tooth
HP:0000695.definition: A tooth present at birth or erupting within the first month of life.
HP:0000695.definition_cn: 先天性牙齿或新生儿牙齿。

HP:0000696.name: Delayed eruption of permanent teeth
HP:0000696.definition: Delayed tooth eruption affecting the secondary dentition.
HP:0000696.definition_cn: 影响恒牙列的迟萌牙症。

HP:0000698.name: Conical tooth
HP:0000698.definition: An abnormal conical form of the teeth, that is, a tooth whose sides converge or taper together incisally.
HP:0000698.definition_cn: 牙齿异常锥形形态，即牙齿的侧面向切缘方向逐渐收窄或锥化。

HP:0000699.name: Diastema
HP:0000699.definition: Increased space between two adjacent teeth in the same dental arch.
HP:0000699.definition_cn: Diastema between adjacent teeth within the same dental arch.

HP:0000700.name: Periapical bone loss
HP:0000700.definition: Radiolucency (reflecting a reduction in the bony substance) around the apex (the tip of the dental root).
HP:0000700.definition_cn: 根尖周围透射影（反映骨质减少）。

HP:0000705.name: Amelogenesis imperfecta
HP:0000705.definition: A developmental dysplasia of the dental enamel.

HP:0000706.name: Eruption failure
HP:0000706.definition: A tooth which does not erupt within the teeth eruption timeline and after the loss of eruption potential.
HP:0000706.definition_cn: 一颗未在牙齿萌出时间范围内萌出且丧失萌出潜能的牙齿。

HP:0000707.name: Abnormality of the nervous system
HP:0000707.definition: An abnormality of the nervous system.

HP:0000708.name: Atypical behavior
HP:0000708.definition: Atypical behavior is an abnormality in a person's actions that can be controlled or modulated by the will of the individual. While abnormal behaviors can be difficult to control, they are distinct from other abnormal actions that cannot be affected by the individual's will.
HP:0000708.definition_cn: 非典型行为是指个体行为中的一种异常表现，该行为可通过个体的意志进行控制或调节。尽管异常行为可能难以控制，但它们与那些不受个体意志影响的其他异常行为存在明显区别。

HP:0000709.name: Psychosis
HP:0000709.definition: A condition characterized by changes in personality and thought patterns, often accompanied by hallucinations and delusional beliefs, is known as psychosis.
HP:0000709.definition_cn: 一种以人格和思维模式改变为特征的病症，通常伴随幻觉和妄想信念，被称为精神病（psychosis）。

HP:0000710.name: Hyperorality
HP:0000710.definition: Hyperorality is a condition characterized by an excessive preoccupation with oral sensations and behaviors, such as chewing, sucking, biting, swallowing, and excessive mouthing of objects.
HP:0000710.definition_cn: 口欲过度症是一种以对口腔感觉和行为的过度关注为特征的病症，包括咀嚼、吮吸、咬合、吞咽以及过度将物品放入口中的行为。

HP:0000711.name: Restlessness
HP:0000711.definition: A state of unease is characterized by diffuse motor activity or motion, which is subject to limited control, nonproductive, or disorganized behavior.
HP:0000711.definition_cn: 一种不安状态的特征表现为弥散性运动活动或动作，这些活动或动作受到有限的控制，表现为非生产性或紊乱的行为。

HP:0000712.name: Emotional lability
HP:0000712.definition: Unstable emotional experiences and frequent mood changes; emotions that are easily aroused, intense, and/or disproportionate to events and circumstances.
HP:0000712.definition_cn: 情绪不稳定体验及频繁心境波动；情感易激惹、强烈且/或与事件及情境不相称。

HP:0000713.name: Agitation
HP:0000713.definition: A state of excessive motor activity that is associated with mental distress or a feeling of substantial unease or inner tension. Distinguished from restlessness by the increased level of emotional distress and negative intensity of the experience. Agitation has a significant level of physical activity that is typically threatening to the self or others.
HP:0000713.definition_cn: 一种与精神痛苦或显著不安感及内心紧张相关的过度运动活动状态。与不安（restlessness）相区别的是，其情绪痛苦程度更高且体验的负面强度更大。激越（agitation）通常伴有显著的身体活动，且可能对自身或他人构成威胁。

HP:0000716.name: Depression
HP:0000716.definition: Frequently experiencing feelings of being down, miserable, and/or hopeless; struggling to recover from these moods; having a pessimistic outlook on the future; feeling a pervasive sense of shame; having a low self-worth; experiencing thoughts of suicide and engaging in suicidal behavior.
HP:0000716.definition_cn: 频繁出现情绪低落、痛苦和/或绝望感；难以从这些情绪中恢复；对未来持悲观态度；普遍感到羞耻；自我价值感低下；出现自杀意念并实施自杀行为。

HP:0000717.name: Autism
HP:0000717.definition: Autism is a neurodevelopmental disorder characterized by impaired social interaction and communication, and by restricted and repetitive behavior. Autism begins in childhood. It is marked by the presence of markedly abnormal or impaired development in social interaction and communication and a markedly restricted repertoire of activity and interest. Manifestations of the disorder vary greatly depending on the developmental level and chronological age of the individual (DSM-IV).
HP:0000717.name_cn: 自闭症谱系障碍（Autism Spectrum Disorder, ASD）
HP:0000717.definition_cn: 自闭症是一种神经发育障碍，其特征为社交互动和沟通能力受损，以及受限和重复的行为。自闭症始于儿童期，其标志性表现为社交互动和沟通方面显著异常或受损的发展，以及活动和兴趣范围显著受限。该障碍的表现因个体的发育水平和实际年龄而异（DSM-IV）。

HP:0000718.name: Aggressive behavior
HP:0000718.definition: Behavior or an act aimed at harming a person, animal, or physical property (e.g., acts of physical violence; shouting, swearing, and using harsh language; slashing someone's tires).
HP:0000718.definition_cn: 针对个人、动物或物质财产实施伤害的行为或举动（例如：身体暴力行为；高声喊叫、咒骂及使用粗俗语言；划破他人轮胎）。

HP:0000719.name: Inappropriate behavior
HP:0000719.definition: An explicit or perceived action, demonstration, conduct, or language (verbal and written) that is contrary to generally accepted norms, rules, procedures, or unacceptable within the context in which it is carried out. Inappropriate behaviors could take place in a sexual or social context and could be aggressive, violent, impulsive, intimidating, or threatening in nature.
HP:0000719.definition_cn: 一种明确或感知到的行为、表现、举止或语言（口头和书面），其与普遍接受的规范、规则、程序相悖，或在其实施的背景下被视为不可接受。不当行为可能发生在性或社交情境中，并可能具有攻击性、暴力性、冲动性、恐吓性或威胁性。

HP:0000722.name: Compulsive behaviors
HP:0000722.definition: Behavior that consists of repetitive acts, characterized by the feeling that one \\
HP:0000722.definition_cn: 行为表现为重复性动作，特征为个体感受到一种

HP:0000723.name: Restrictive behavior
HP:0000723.definition: Behavior characterized by an abnormal limitation to a few interests and activities.
HP:0000723.definition_cn: 行为特征表现为对少数兴趣和活动存在异常限制。

HP:0000725.name: Psychotic episodes
HP:0000725.definition: Periods of time during which an individual experiences significant disturbances in their thoughts, perceptions, emotions, and behavior, resulting in a loss of touch with reality. These episodes are hallmark features of psychotic disorders such as schizophrenia, schizoaffective disorder, and certain forms of bipolar disorder.
HP:0000725.definition_cn: 个体在思维、感知、情感和行为方面经历显著紊乱的时期，导致与现实脱节。这些发作是精神障碍的标志性特征，如精神分裂症、分裂情感性障碍以及某些类型的双相情感障碍。

HP:0000726.name: Dementia
HP:0000726.definition: A loss of global cognitive ability of sufficient amount to interfere with normal social or occupational function. Dementia represents a loss of previously present cognitive abilities, generally in adults, and can affect memory, thinking, language, judgment, and behavior.
HP:0000726.definition_cn: 全球认知功能丧失至足以干扰正常社交或职业功能的程度。痴呆症表现为先前存在的认知能力丧失，通常发生于成年人，可影响记忆、思维、语言、判断力和行为。

HP:0000728.name: Impaired ability to form peer relationships
HP:0000728.definition: Difficulty to establish relations with others in a comparable social group (peers) that may be manifested in pehnomena such as not being able to initiative a conversation, understand social cues, or to discuss shared interests. This feature is associated with poor integration within a community or group.
HP:0000728.name_cn: 社交关系形成能力受损
HP:0000728.definition_cn: 在与同等社会群体（同龄人）建立关系方面存在困难，可能表现为无法发起对话、理解社交线索或讨论共同兴趣。这一特征与在社区或群体中的融入不良相关。

HP:0000729.name: Autistic behavior
HP:0000729.definition: Persistent deficits in social interaction and communication and interaction as well as a markedly restricted repertoire of activity and interest as well as repetitive patterns of behavior.
HP:0000729.definition_cn: 社交互动和沟通交流的持续性缺陷，以及活动和兴趣范围的显著受限，以及重复性行为模式。

HP:0000732.name: Inflexible adherence to routines
HP:0000732.definition: A need to strictly adhere to repetitive routines or patterns of behavior which are created by the environment. One becomes upset or distressed when their routines are disrupted or altered.
HP:0000732.definition_cn: 需要严格遵循由环境创建的重复性行为模式或常规。当这些常规被破坏或改变时，个体会感到不安或痛苦。

HP:0000733.name: Motor stereotypy
HP:0000733.definition: Use of the same abnormal action in response to certain triggers or at random. They may be used as a way to regulate one's internal state but must otherwise have no apparent functional purpose.
HP:0000733.definition_cn: 对特定触发因素或随机情况下使用相同的异常行为。这些行为可能被用作调节个体内部状态的一种方式，但在其他情况下必须没有明显的功能性目的。

HP:0000734.name: Disinhibition
HP:0000734.definition: Reduced ability to control, or a failure to resist a temptation, urge, or impulse. Examples include disregard for social conventions, general impulsivity, and poor risk assessment.
HP:0000734.definition_cn: 控制能力减退或无法抵制诱惑、冲动或欲望。具体表现包括忽视社会规范、普遍冲动性以及风险评估能力低下。

HP:0000736.name: Short attention span
HP:0000736.definition: Reduced attention span characterized by distractibility and impulsivity.
HP:0000736.definition_cn: 注意力持续时间缩短，表现为注意力分散和冲动性。

HP:0000737.name: Irritability
HP:0000737.definition: A proneness to anger, i.e., a tendency to become easily bothered or annoyed.
HP:0000737.definition_cn: 易怒倾向，即易受激惹或烦躁的倾向。

HP:0000738.name: Hallucinations
HP:0000738.definition: Perceptions in a conscious and awake state that, in the absence of external stimuli, have qualities of real perception. These perceptions are vivid, substantial, and located in external objective space.
HP:0000738.definition_cn: 在意识清醒状态下，在缺乏外部刺激的情况下，具有真实感知特征的感知。这些感知生动、实质，并定位于外部客观空间。

HP:0000739.name: Anxiety
HP:0000739.definition: Intense feelings of nervousness, tension, or panic often arise in response to interpersonal stresses. There is worry about the negative effects of past unpleasant experiences and future negative possibilities. Individuals may feel fearful, apprehensive, or threatened by uncertainty, and they may also have fears of falling apart or losing control.
HP:0000739.definition_cn: 强烈的紧张、焦虑或恐慌感通常由人际压力引发。患者对过去不愉快经历的负面影响及未来可能发生的负面事件感到担忧。个体可能因不确定性而感到恐惧、忧虑或受到威胁，并可能担心精神崩溃或失去控制。

HP:0000740.name: Episodic paroxysmal anxiety
HP:0000740.definition: Recurrent attacks of severe anxiety, which occur without restriction to any particular situation or set of circumstances, are therefore unpredictable.
HP:0000740.definition_cn: 反复发作的严重焦虑，不受任何特定情境或环境限制，因此具有不可预测性。

HP:0000741.name: Apathy
HP:0000741.definition: Apathy is a quantitative reduction of interest, motivation and the initiation and persistence of goal-directed behavior, where often the accompanying emotions, thoughts, and social interactions are also diminished. The individual is typically non-reactive to provocations, positive or negative, and appears to not care. Distinguished from lethargy which involves lack of physical or mental energy.
HP:0000741.definition_cn: 冷漠是一种兴趣、动机以及目标导向行为的启动和持续性的定量减少，通常伴随的情绪、思维和社交互动也会减弱。个体通常对刺激（无论是正面还是负面）无反应，并表现出漠不关心的态度。与嗜睡不同，嗜睡涉及身体或精神能量的缺乏。

HP:0000742.name: Self-mutilation
HP:0000742.definition: Deliberate harm to one's body resulting in tissue damage, without a conscious intent to die.
HP:0000742.definition_cn: 自伤行为（Self-injury）导致的组织损伤（Tissue Damage），无明确自杀意图（Suicidal Intent）。

HP:0000743.name: Frontal release signs
HP:0000743.definition: Primitive reflexes traditionally held to be a sign of disorders that affect the frontal lobes.
HP:0000743.definition_cn: 原始反射传统上被认为是影响额叶的疾病的体征。

HP:0000744.name: Low frustration tolerance
HP:0000744.definition: The feeling of frustration can be defined as an emotional reaction that occurs when a desired goal is not achieved. Frustration intolerance is defined as an age-inappropriate response to frustration, characterized by crying or temper tantrums in children, or aggressive or other undesirable behaviors.
HP:0000744.definition_cn: 挫败感可定义为当期望目标未能实现时产生的一种情绪反应。挫折耐受不良则定义为对挫折表现出与年龄不相称的反应，其特征为儿童出现哭泣或发脾气，或表现出攻击性及其他不良行为。

HP:0000745.name: Abnormal diminished volition
HP:0000745.definition: A reduction in willful and motivated goal-directed behavior that is considered the determinant of behavior and adaptation that allows individuals to get started, be energized to perform a sustained and directed action.
HP:0000745.definition_cn: 意志性和动机性目标导向行为的减少，被认为是决定行为和适应的关键因素，使个体能够启动、获得能量以执行持续且定向的行动。

HP:0000746.name: Delusion
HP:0000746.definition: A delusion is a fixed false belief held despite evidence to the contrary. The term delusion broadly encompasses all false judgments that possess the following external characteristics to a significant, albeit unspecified, extent: (1) they are held with an exceptional level of conviction, accompanied by an unparalleled subjective certainty; (2) there is an inability to consider alternative experiences or compelling counter-arguments; (3) the content of the belief is impossible.
HP:0000746.definition_cn: 妄想是一种固定的错误信念，尽管存在相反的证据仍坚持不变。该术语广义上涵盖了所有具有以下显著外部特征的错误判断，尽管这些特征的程度未明确界定：（1）持有该信念时具有极高的确信度，伴随无与伦比的主观确定性；（2）无法考虑其他经验或强有力的反驳论点；（3）信念内容在现实中不可能成立。

HP:0000748.name: Inappropriate laughter
HP:0000748.definition: Laughing that may be excessive and/or inappropriate in context (e.g., laughing at a funeral while others are crying).
HP:0000748.definition_cn: 在特定情境下可能过度且/或不合时宜的笑声（例如，在葬礼上他人哭泣时发笑）。

HP:0000750.name: Delayed speech and language development
HP:0000750.definition: A degree of language development that is significantly below the norm for a child of a specified age.
HP:0000750.definition_cn: 语言发育迟缓（Language Developmental Delay）

HP:0000751.name: Personality changes
HP:0000751.definition: An abnormal shift in patterns of thinking, acting, or feeling.
HP:0000751.definition_cn: 思维、行为或情感模式的异常转变。

HP:0000752.name: Hyperactivity
HP:0000752.definition: Hyperactivity is a condition characterized by constant and unusually high levels of activity, even in situations where it is deemed inappropriate.
HP:0000752.definition_cn: 多动症是一种以持续且异常高水平活动为特征的疾病，即使在被认为不适当的情境下也是如此。

HP:0000756.name: Agoraphobia
HP:0000756.definition: A type of anxiety disorder characterized by the avoidance of public places, especially where crowds gather.
HP:0000756.definition_cn: 一种以回避公共场所，特别是人群聚集地为特征的焦虑障碍，称为广场恐惧症（Agoraphobia）。

HP:0000757.name: Lack of insight
HP:0000757.definition: Lack of insight (Anosognosia) is a neurological condition in which an individual is unaware of his or her own neurological deficit or psychiatric condition. Anosognosia can be associated with mental illness, dementia, and structural brain lesions and can affect an individual's conscious awareness of deficits involving judgment, emotions, memory, executive function, language skills, and motor ability.
HP:0000757.definition_cn: 缺乏自知力（病感失认症）是一种神经病学状况，患者无法意识到自身的神经功能缺损或精神疾病状态。病感失认症可能与精神疾病、痴呆症及脑部结构性病变相关，并可影响患者对涉及判断、情绪、记忆、执行功能、语言技能及运动能力等方面缺损的自觉意识。

HP:0000758.name: Abnormal nonverbal communicative behavior
HP:0000758.definition: Abnormalities in eye contact, communicative facial expressions, gesture use, or the use of others' bodies to communicate convey shared meanings within a culture that replace or supplement verbal communication.
HP:0000758.definition_cn: 眼神接触异常、交流性面部表情异常、手势使用异常或利用他人身体进行交流以传达文化中共有的意义，这些行为替代或补充了言语交流。

HP:0000759.name: Abnormal peripheral nervous system morphology
HP:0000759.definition: A structural abnormality of the peripheral nervous system, which is composed of the nerves that lead to or branch off from the central nervous system. This includes the cranial nerves (olfactory and optic nerves are technically part of the central nervous system).
HP:0000759.name_cn: 周围神经系统形态异常
HP:0000759.definition_cn: 周围神经系统结构异常，周围神经系统由从中枢神经系统发出或分支的神经组成，包括脑神经（嗅神经和视神经在技术上属于中枢神经系统的一部分）。

HP:0000762.name: Decreased nerve conduction velocity
HP:0000762.definition: A reduction in the speed at which electrical signals propagate along the axon of a neuron.
HP:0000762.definition_cn: 神经轴突电信号传导速度降低。

HP:0000763.name: Sensory neuropathy
HP:0000763.definition: Peripheral neuropathy affecting the sensory nerves.
HP:0000763.definition_cn: 周围神经病变累及感觉神经。

HP:0000764.name: Peripheral axonal degeneration
HP:0000764.definition_cn: 周围神经轴突进行性退化。

HP:0000765.name: Abnormal thorax morphology
HP:0000765.definition: Any abnormality of the thorax (the region of the body formed by the sternum, the thoracic vertebrae and the ribs).
HP:0000765.definition_cn: 胸廓异常（由胸骨、胸椎和肋骨构成的身体区域）。

HP:0000766.name: Abnormal sternum morphology
HP:0000766.definition: An anomaly of the sternum, also known as the breastbone.
HP:0000766.definition_cn: 胸骨异常，亦称胸骨畸形。

HP:0000767.name: Pectus excavatum
HP:0000767.definition: A defect of the chest wall characterized by a depression of the sternum, giving the chest (\\
HP:0000767.definition_cn: 胸壁缺陷，其特征为胸骨凹陷，导致胸部呈现凹陷状（漏斗胸）。

HP:0000768.name: Pectus carinatum
HP:0000768.definition: A deformity of the chest caused by overgrowth of the ribs and characterized by protrusion of the sternum.
HP:0000768.definition_cn: 胸廓畸形，由肋骨过度生长引起，特征为胸骨前突。

HP:0000771.name: Gynecomastia
HP:0000771.definition: Abnormal development of large mammary glands in males resulting in breast enlargement.
HP:0000771.definition_cn: 男性乳腺发育异常导致乳房增大。

HP:0000774.name: Narrow chest
HP:0000774.definition: Reduced width of the chest from side to side, associated with a reduced distance from the sternal notch to the tip of the shoulder.
HP:0000774.definition_cn: 胸廓横径减小，伴胸骨切迹至肩峰距离缩短。

HP:0000775.name: Abnormality of the diaphragm
HP:0000775.definition: Any abnormality of the diaphragm, the sheet of skeletal muscle that separates the thoracic cavity from the abdominal cavity.
HP:0000775.definition_cn: 膈肌异常，即分隔胸腔与腹腔的骨骼肌片层出现任何异常。

HP:0000776.name: Congenital diaphragmatic hernia
HP:0000776.definition: The presence of a hernia of the diaphragm present at birth.
HP:0000776.definition_cn: 先天性膈疝（Congenital Diaphragmatic Hernia, CDH）

HP:0000777.name: Abnormal thymus morphology
HP:0000777.definition: Abnormality of the thymus, an organ located in the upper anterior portion of the chest cavity just behind the sternum and whose main function is to provide an environment for T lymphocyte maturation.
HP:0000777.definition_cn: 胸腺异常，胸腺位于胸腔前上纵隔，紧贴胸骨后方，其主要功能是为T淋巴细胞成熟提供微环境。

HP:0000782.name: Abnormal scapula morphology
HP:0000782.definition: Any abnormality of the scapula, also known as the shoulder blade.
HP:0000782.definition_cn: 肩胛骨异常，亦称肩胛骨畸形。

HP:0000787.name: Nephrolithiasis
HP:0000787.definition: The presence of calculi (stones) in the kidneys.

HP:0000790.name: Hematuria
HP:0000790.definition: The presence of blood in the urine. Hematuria may be gross hematuria (visible to the naked eye) or microscopic hematuria (detected by dipstick or microscopic examination of the urine).
HP:0000790.definition_cn: 尿液中出现血液。血尿可分为肉眼血尿（肉眼可见）和镜下血尿（通过试纸或尿液显微镜检查检测到）。

HP:0000791.name: Uric acid nephrolithiasis
HP:0000791.definition: The presence of uric acid-containing calculi (stones) in the kidneys.
HP:0000791.definition_cn: 肾脏内存在含尿酸结石。

HP:0000793.name: Membranoproliferative glomerulonephritis
HP:0000793.definition: A type of glomerulonephritis characterized by diffuse mesangial cell proliferation and the thickening of capillary walls due to subendothelial extension of the mesangium. The term membranoproliferative glomerulonephritis is often employed to denote a general pattern of glomerular injury seen in a variety of disease processes that share a common pathogenetic mechanism, rather than to describe a single disease entity
HP:0000793.definition_cn: 一种以弥漫性系膜细胞增殖和由于系膜内皮下延伸导致的毛细血管壁增厚为特征的肾小球肾炎。术语“膜增生性肾小球肾炎”通常用于描述在多种疾病过程中观察到的具有共同发病机制的肾小球损伤的一般模式，而非描述单一疾病实体。

HP:0000794.name: IgA deposition in the glomerulus
HP:0000794.definition: The presence of immunoglobulin A deposits in the glomerulus.
HP:0000794.definition_cn: 肾小球内免疫球蛋白A沉积。

HP:0000795.name: Abnormality of the urethra
HP:0000795.definition: An abnormality of the urethra, i.e., of the tube which connects the urinary bladder to the outside of the body.
HP:0000795.definition_cn: 尿道异常，即连接膀胱与体外的管道结构异常。

HP:0000796.name: Urethral obstruction
HP:0000796.definition: Obstruction of the flow of urine through the urethra.

HP:0000798.name: Oligozoospermia
HP:0000798.definition: Reduced count of spermatozoa in the semen, defined as a sperm count below 20 million per milliliter semen.
HP:0000798.definition_cn: 精液中精子数量减少，定义为每毫升精液中精子计数低于2000万。

HP:0000799.name: Renal steatosis
HP:0000799.definition: Abnormal fat accumulation in the kidneys.

HP:0000802.name: Impotence
HP:0000802.definition: Inability to develop or maintain an erection of the penis.
HP:0000802.name_cn: 勃起功能障碍 (Erectile Dysfunction, ED)
HP:0000802.definition_cn: 勃起功能障碍（Erectile Dysfunction, ED）

HP:0000803.name: Renal cortical cysts
HP:0000803.definition: Cysts of the cortex of the kidney.

HP:0000804.name: Xanthine nephrolithiasis
HP:0000804.definition: The presence of xanthine-containing calculi (stones) in the kidneys.
HP:0000804.definition_cn: 肾脏内存在含黄嘌呤的结石（肾结石）。

HP:0000805.name: Enuresis
HP:0000805.definition: Lack of the ability to control the urinary bladder leading to involuntary urination at an age where control of the bladder should already be possible.
HP:0000805.definition_cn: 膀胱控制功能障碍导致的非自主性排尿，发生于本应具备膀胱控制能力的年龄段。

HP:0000808.name: Penoscrotal hypospadias
HP:0000808.definition: A severe form of hypospadias in which the urethral opening is located at the junction of the penis and scrotum.
HP:0000808.definition_cn: 一种严重的尿道下裂类型，尿道开口位于阴茎与阴囊交界处。

HP:0000809.name: Urinary tract atresia
HP:0000809.definition: Congenital absence of the normal opening of a structure of the urinary tract.
HP:0000809.definition_cn: 先天性泌尿系统结构正常开口缺失。

HP:0000811.name: Abnormal external genitalia morphology
HP:0000811.definition: A structural anomaly of the external genitalia.

HP:0000812.name: Abnormal internal genitalia
HP:0000812.definition: An anomaly of the adnexa, uterus, and vagina (in female) or seminal tract and prostate (in male).
HP:0000812.definition_cn: 附件、子宫和阴道（女性）或精道和前列腺（男性）的异常。

HP:0000813.name: Bicornuate uterus
HP:0000813.definition: The presence of a bicornuate uterus.

HP:0000815.name: Hypergonadotropic hypogonadism
HP:0000815.definition: Reduced function of the gonads (testes in males or ovaries in females) associated with excess pituitary gonadotropin secretion and resulting in delayed sexual development and growth delay.
HP:0000815.name_cn: 高促性腺激素性性腺功能减退症
HP:0000815.definition_cn: 性腺功能减退（男性为睾丸，女性为卵巢）与垂体促性腺激素分泌过多相关，导致性发育迟缓和生长迟缓。

HP:0000816.name: Abnormality of Krebs cycle metabolism
HP:0000816.definition: An abnormality of the tricarboxylic acid cycle.

HP:0000817.name: Reduced eye contact
HP:0000817.definition: A reduced frequency or duration of eye contact.
HP:0000817.definition_cn: 眼接触频率或持续时间减少。

HP:0000818.name: Abnormality of the endocrine system
HP:0000818.definition: An abnormality of the endocrine system.

HP:0000819.name: Diabetes mellitus
HP:0000819.definition: A group of abnormalities characterized by hyperglycemia and glucose intolerance.
HP:0000819.definition_cn: 一组以高血糖症和葡萄糖耐量异常为特征的病理状态。

HP:0000820.name: Abnormality of the thyroid gland
HP:0000820.definition: An abnormality of the thyroid gland.

HP:0000822.name: Hypertension
HP:0000822.definition: The presence of chronic increased pressure in the systemic arterial system.
HP:0000822.definition_cn: 系统性动脉系统内存在慢性压力增高。

HP:0000823.name: Delayed puberty
HP:0000823.definition: Passing the age when puberty normally occurs with no physical or hormonal signs of the onset of puberty.
HP:0000823.definition_cn: 超过正常青春期年龄，但未出现青春期开始的生理或激素体征。

HP:0000824.name: Decreased response to growth hormone stimulation test
HP:0000824.definition: Insufficient responses to growth hormone (GH) provocation tests. GH deficiency is defined as a serum peak GH concentration less than 10 ng/mL on provocation with a combination of at least two separate stimulation tests.
HP:0000824.name_cn: 生长激素刺激试验反应降低
HP:0000824.definition_cn: 生长激素（GH）激发试验反应不足。生长激素缺乏症定义为在至少两种独立的刺激试验联合激发下，血清峰值GH浓度低于10 ng/mL。

HP:0000825.name: Hyperinsulinemic hypoglycemia
HP:0000825.definition: An increased concentration of insulin combined with a decreased concentration of glucose in the blood.
HP:0000825.definition_cn: 血液中胰岛素浓度升高伴随葡萄糖浓度降低。

HP:0000826.name: Precocious puberty
HP:0000826.definition: The onset of secondary sexual characteristics before a normal age. Although it is difficult to define normal age ranges because of the marked variation with which puberty begins in normal children, precocious puberty can be defined as the onset of puberty before the age of 8 years in girls or 9 years in boys.
HP:0000826.definition_cn: 性早熟（Precocious Puberty）是指在正常年龄之前出现第二性征的发育。由于正常儿童青春期开始的年龄存在显著差异，因此难以界定正常年龄范围，但性早熟可定义为女孩在8岁之前或男孩在9岁之前出现青春期发育。

HP:0000828.name: Abnormality of the parathyroid gland
HP:0000828.definition: An abnormality of the parathyroid gland.

HP:0000829.name: Hypoparathyroidism
HP:0000829.definition: A condition caused by a deficiency of parathyroid hormone characterized by hypocalcemia and hyperphosphatemia.
HP:0000829.definition_cn: 一种由甲状旁腺激素缺乏引起的疾病，其特征为低钙血症和高磷血症。

HP:0000830.name: Anterior hypopituitarism
HP:0000830.definition: A condition of reduced function of the anterior pituitary gland characterized by decreased secretion of one or more of the pituitary hormones growth hormone, thyroid-stimulating hormone, adrenocorticotropic hormone, prolactin, luteinizing hormone, and follicle-stimulating hormone.
HP:0000830.definition_cn: 一种前叶垂体功能减退的病症，其特征为一种或多种垂体激素分泌减少，包括生长激素、促甲状腺激素、促肾上腺皮质激素、催乳素、黄体生成素和卵泡刺激素。

HP:0000831.name: Insulin-resistant diabetes mellitus
HP:0000831.definition: A type of diabetes mellitus related not to lack of insulin but rather to lack of response to insulin on the part of the target tissues of insulin such as muscle, fat, and liver cells. This type of diabetes is typically associated with increases both in blood glucose concentrations as well as in fasting and postprandial serum insulin levels.
HP:0000831.definition_cn: 一种与胰岛素缺乏无关的糖尿病类型，而是由于胰岛素靶组织（如肌肉、脂肪和肝细胞）对胰岛素的反应性降低所致。此类糖尿病通常伴随血糖浓度升高以及空腹和餐后血清胰岛素水平增加。

HP:0000832.name: Primary hypothyroidism
HP:0000832.definition: A type of hypothyroidism that results from a defect in the thyroid gland.
HP:0000832.name_cn: 原发性甲状腺功能减退症
HP:0000832.definition_cn: 一种由于甲状腺缺陷导致的甲状腺功能减退症。

HP:0000834.name: Abnormality of the adrenal glands
HP:0000834.definition: Abnormality of the adrenal glands, i.e., of the endocrine glands located at the top of the kindneys.
HP:0000834.definition_cn: 肾上腺异常，即位于肾脏顶部的内分泌腺体异常。

HP:0000835.name: Adrenal hypoplasia
HP:0000835.definition: Developmental hypoplasia of the adrenal glands.

HP:0000836.name: Hyperthyroidism
HP:0000836.definition: An abnormality of thyroid physiology characterized by excessive secretion of the thyroid hormones thyroxine (i.e., T4) and/or 3,3',5-triiodo-L-thyronine zwitterion (i.e., triiodothyronine or T3).
HP:0000836.definition_cn: 甲状腺生理功能异常，其特征为甲状腺激素甲状腺素（即T4）和/或3,3',5-三碘-L-甲状腺原氨酸两性离子（即三碘甲状腺原氨酸或T3）的过度分泌。

HP:0000837.name: Increased circulating gonadotropin level
HP:0000837.definition: Overproduction of gonadotropins (FSH, LH) by the anterior pituitary gland.
HP:0000837.name_cn: 循环中促性腺激素水平升高
HP:0000837.definition_cn: 垂体前叶促性腺激素（FSH、LH）分泌过多。

HP:0000839.name: Pituitary dwarfism
HP:0000839.definition: A type of reduced stature with normal proportions related to dysfunction of the pituitary gland related to either an isolated defect in the secretion of growth hormone or to panhypopituitarism, i.e., a deficit of all the anterior pituitary hormones.
HP:0000839.definition_cn: 一种与垂体功能障碍相关的身材矮小类型，其身体比例正常，可能由于生长激素分泌的孤立缺陷或全垂体功能减退症（即所有前叶垂体激素的缺乏）引起。

HP:0000840.name: Adrenogenital syndrome
HP:0000840.definition: Adrenogenital syndrome is also known as congenital adrenal hyperplasia, which results from disorders of steroid hormone production in the adrenal glands leading to a deficiency of cortisol. The pituitary gland reacts by increased secretion of corticotropin, which in turn causes the adrenal glands to overproduce certain intermediary hormones which have testosterone-like effects.
HP:0000840.definition_cn: 肾上腺生殖综合征，亦称先天性肾上腺皮质增生症，系因肾上腺类固醇激素合成障碍导致皮质醇缺乏所致。垂体对此反应为促肾上腺皮质激素分泌增加，进而促使肾上腺过度生成某些具有睾酮样效应的中间激素。

HP:0000841.name: Hyperactive renin-angiotensin system
HP:0000841.definition: An abnormally increased activity of the renin-angiotensin system, causing hypertension by a combination of volume excess and vasoconstrictor mechanisms.
HP:0000841.name_cn: 过度活跃的肾素-血管紧张素系统
HP:0000841.definition_cn: 肾素-血管紧张素系统异常激活，通过容量过载和血管收缩机制共同作用导致高血压。

HP:0000842.name: Hyperinsulinemia
HP:0000842.definition: An increased concentration of insulin in the blood.

HP:0000843.name: Hyperparathyroidism
HP:0000843.definition: Excessive production of parathyroid hormone (PTH) by the parathyroid glands.
HP:0000843.definition_cn: 甲状旁腺激素（PTH）分泌过多。

HP:0000845.name: Elevated circulating growth hormone concentration
HP:0000845.definition: Acromegaly is a condition resulting from overproduction of growth hormone by the pituitary gland in persons with closed epiphyses, and consists chiefly in the enlargement of the distal parts of the body. The circumference of the skull increases, the nose becomes broad, the tongue becomes enlarged, the facial features become coarsened, the mandible grows excessively, and the teeth become separated. The fingers and toes grow chiefly in thickness.
HP:0000845.name_cn: 循环生长激素浓度升高
HP:0000845.definition_cn: 肢端肥大症是一种由于垂体在骨骺闭合的个体中过度分泌生长激素而导致的疾病，主要表现为身体远端部位的增大。颅骨周长增加，鼻部变宽，舌体增大，面部特征变得粗糙，下颌过度生长，牙齿间隙增大。手指和脚趾主要呈现增厚现象。

HP:0000846.name: Adrenal insufficiency
HP:0000846.definition: Insufficient production of steroid hormones (primarily cortisol) by the adrenal glands.
HP:0000846.definition_cn: 肾上腺类固醇激素（主要为皮质醇）分泌不足。

HP:0000847.name: Abnormality of renin-angiotensin system
HP:0000847.definition: An abnormality of the renin-angiotensin system.
HP:0000847.name_cn: 肾素-血管紧张素系统异常
HP:0000847.definition_cn: 肾素-血管紧张素系统异常。

HP:0000848.name: Increased circulating renin concentration
HP:0000848.definition: An increased level of renin in the blood.

HP:0000851.name: Congenital hypothyroidism
HP:0000851.definition: A type of hypothyroidism with congenital onset.
HP:0000851.name_cn: 先天性甲状腺功能减退症
HP:0000851.definition_cn: 一种先天性甲状腺功能减退症。

HP:0000852.name: Pseudohypoparathyroidism
HP:0000852.definition: A condition characterized by resistance to the action of parathyroid hormone, in which there is hypocalcemia, hyperphosphatemia, and (appropriately) high levels of parathyroid hormone.
HP:0000852.name_cn: 假性甲状旁腺功能减退症
HP:0000852.definition_cn: 一种以对甲状旁腺激素作用抵抗为特征的疾病，表现为低钙血症、高磷血症以及（相应地）甲状旁腺激素水平升高。

HP:0000853.name: Goiter
HP:0000853.definition: An enlargement of the thyroid gland.

HP:0000854.name: Thyroid adenoma
HP:0000854.definition: The presence of a adenoma of the thyroid gland.

HP:0000855.name: Insulin resistance
HP:0000855.definition: Increased resistance towards insulin, that is, diminished effectiveness of insulin in reducing blood glucose levels.
HP:0000855.definition_cn: 胰岛素抵抗性增加，即胰岛素在降低血糖水平方面的效能减弱。

HP:0000857.name: Neonatal insulin-dependent diabetes mellitus
HP:0000857.name_cn: 新生儿胰岛素依赖型糖尿病

HP:0000858.name: Irregular menstruation
HP:0000858.definition: Abnormally high variation in the amount of time between periods.
HP:0000858.definition_cn: 月经周期间隔时间异常高变异。

HP:0000859.name: Increased circulating aldosterone concentration
HP:0000859.definition: Overproduction of the mineralocorticoid aldosterone by the adrenal cortex.
HP:0000859.definition_cn: 肾上腺皮质过度分泌盐皮质激素醛固酮。

HP:0000860.name: Parathyroid hypoplasia
HP:0000860.definition: Developmental hypoplasia of the parathyroid gland.

HP:0000863.name: Central diabetes insipidus
HP:0000863.definition: A form of diabetes insipidus related to a failure of vasopressin (AVP) release from the hypothalamus.
HP:0000863.definition_cn: 一种与下丘脑抗利尿激素（AVP）释放障碍相关的尿崩症。

HP:0000864.name: Abnormality of the hypothalamus-pituitary axis
HP:0000864.definition: Abnormality of the pituitary gland (also known as hypophysis), which is an endocrine gland that protrudes from the bottom of the hypothalamus at the base of the brain. The pituitary gland secretes the hormones ACTH, TSH, PRL, GH, endorphins, FSH, LH, oxytocin, and antidiuretic hormone. The secretion of hormones from the anterior pituitary is under the strict control of hypothalamic hormones, and the posterior pituitary is essentially an extension of the hypothalamus, so that hypothalamus and pituitary gland may be regarded as a functional unit.
HP:0000864.definition_cn: 垂体异常（亦称为脑下垂体），其为一种内分泌腺体，自大脑底部下丘脑下方突出。垂体分泌的激素包括促肾上腺皮质激素（ACTH）、促甲状腺激素（TSH）、催乳素（PRL）、生长激素（GH）、内啡肽、促卵泡激素（FSH）、黄体生成素（LH）、催产素及抗利尿激素。垂体前叶的激素分泌严格受下丘脑激素调控，而垂体后叶实质上是下丘脑的延伸，因此下丘脑与垂体可视为一个功能单元。

HP:0000866.name: Euthyroid multinodular goiter
HP:0000866.name_cn: 正常甲状腺功能的多结节性甲状腺肿

HP:0000867.name: Secondary hyperparathyroidism
HP:0000867.definition: Secondary hyperparathyroidism refers to the production of higher than normal levels of parathyroid hormone in the presence of hypocalcemia.
HP:0000867.name_cn: 继发性甲状旁腺功能亢进症
HP:0000867.definition_cn: 继发性甲状旁腺功能亢进症是指在低钙血症存在下，甲状旁腺激素水平高于正常值的状态。

HP:0000870.name: Increased circulating prolactin concentration
HP:0000870.definition: The presence of abnormally increased levels of prolactin in the blood. Prolactin is a peptide hormone produced by the anterior pituitary gland that plays a role in breast development and lactation during pregnancy.
HP:0000870.name_cn: 循环中催乳素浓度升高
HP:0000870.definition_cn: 血液中催乳素水平异常升高。催乳素是一种由垂体前叶分泌的肽类激素，在妊娠期间对乳腺发育和泌乳起重要作用。

HP:0000871.name: Panhypopituitarism
HP:0000871.definition: A pituitary functional deficit affecting all the anterior pituitary hormones (growth hormone, thyroid-stimulating hormone, follicle-stimulating hormone, luteinizing hormone, adrenocorticotropic hormone, and prolactin).
HP:0000871.definition_cn: 全垂体功能减退症（Panhypopituitarism），影响所有前叶垂体激素（生长激素、促甲状腺激素、促卵泡激素、促黄体生成激素、促肾上腺皮质激素和催乳素）。

HP:0000872.name: Hashimoto thyroiditis
HP:0000872.definition: A chronic, autoimmune type of thyroiditis associated with hypothyroidism.
HP:0000872.definition_cn: 一种慢性自身免疫性甲状腺炎，与甲状腺功能减退相关。

HP:0000873.name: Diabetes insipidus
HP:0000873.definition: A state of excessive water intake and hypotonic (dilute) polyuria. Diabetes insipidus may be due to failure of vasopressin (AVP) release (central or neurogenic diabetes insipidus) or to a failure of the kidney to respond to AVP (nephrogenic diabetes insipidus).
HP:0000873.definition_cn: 过度饮水状态及低渗性（稀释性）多尿。尿崩症可能由于抗利尿激素（AVP）释放障碍（中枢性或神经源性尿崩症）或肾脏对AVP反应障碍（肾源性尿崩症）所致。

HP:0000876.name: Oligomenorrhea
HP:0000876.definition: Infrequent menses (less than 6 per year or more than 35 days between cycles).
HP:0000876.definition_cn: 月经稀发（每年少于6次或周期间隔超过35天）。

HP:0000877.name: Insulin-resistant diabetes mellitus at puberty
HP:0000877.name_cn: 青春期胰岛素抵抗性糖尿病

HP:0000878.name: 11 pairs of ribs
HP:0000878.definition: Presence of only 11 pairs of ribs.

HP:0000879.name: Short sternum
HP:0000879.definition: Decreased inferosuperior length of the sternum.

HP:0000888.name: Horizontal ribs
HP:0000888.definition: A horizontal (flat) conformation of the ribs, the long curved bones that form the rib cage and normally progressively oblique (slanted) from ribs 1 through 9, then less slanted through rib 12.
HP:0000888.definition_cn: 肋骨呈水平（平坦）排列，这些长而弯曲的骨骼构成胸廓，通常从第1肋至第9肋逐渐呈斜向（倾斜）排列，随后至第12肋倾斜度减小。

HP:0000889.name: Abnormal clavicle morphology
HP:0000889.definition: Any abnormality of the clavicles (collar bones).

HP:0000892.name: Bifid ribs
HP:0000892.definition: A bifid rib refers to cleavage of the sternal end of a rib, usually unilateral. Bifid ribs are usually asymptomatic, and are often discovered incidentally by chest x-ray.
HP:0000892.definition_cn: 双叉肋骨（Bifid rib）是指肋骨胸骨端的分裂，通常为单侧发生。双叉肋骨通常无症状，常在胸部X线检查中偶然发现。

HP:0000893.name: Bulging of the costochondral junction
HP:0000893.definition: Abnormal outward curving (protuberance) of the junction of ribs and costal cartilage.
HP:0000893.definition_cn: 肋软骨交界处异常外凸（突出）。

HP:0000895.name: Lateral clavicle hook
HP:0000895.definition: An excessive upward convexity of the lateral clavicle.

HP:0000896.name: Rib exostoses
HP:0000896.definition: Multiple circumscribed bony excrescences located in the ribs.
HP:0000896.definition_cn: 肋骨多发局限性骨赘形成。

HP:0000897.name: Rachitic rosary
HP:0000897.definition: A row of beadlike prominences at the junction of a rib and its cartilage (i.e., enlarged costochondral joints), resembling a rosary. Note that rachitic rosary would have one bead per rib (a swelling at the costochondral junction), while beaded ribs in the context of multiple rib fractures have multiple beads (fractures) along the same rib.
HP:0000897.definition_cn: 肋骨与软骨交界处（即增大的肋软骨关节）出现的一串珠样突起，形似念珠。需注意，佝偻病性串珠（rachitic rosary）表现为每根肋骨上有一个珠样突起（肋软骨交界处肿胀），而在多发性肋骨骨折的情况下，同一根肋骨上会出现多个珠样突起（骨折）。

HP:0000902.name: Rib fusion
HP:0000902.definition: Complete or partial merging of adjacent ribs.
HP:0000902.definition_cn: 相邻肋骨的完全或部分融合。

HP:0000904.name: Flaring of rib cage
HP:0000904.definition: The presence of wide, concave anterior rib ends.
HP:0000904.definition_cn: 存在宽大、凹陷的前肋端。

HP:0000905.name: Progressive clavicular acroosteolysis
HP:0000905.definition: Progressive bone resorption in the distal part of the clavicle.
HP:0000905.name_cn: 进行性锁骨远端骨溶解
HP:0000905.definition_cn: 锁骨远端进行性骨吸收。

HP:0000911.name: Flat glenoid fossa
HP:0000911.definition: Abnormally flat configuration of the glenoid fossa, also known as the glenoid cavity, which is the articular surface of the scapula that articulates with the head of the humerus.
HP:0000911.definition_cn: 肩胛盂窝形态异常平坦，亦称肩胛盂腔，其为肩胛骨与肱骨头相连接的关节面。

HP:0000912.name: Sprengel anomaly
HP:0000912.definition: A congenital skeletal deformity characterized by the elevation of one scapula (thus, one scapula is located superior to the other).
HP:0000912.definition_cn: 先天性骨骼畸形，特征为一侧肩胛骨抬高（即一侧肩胛骨位于另一侧肩胛骨的上方）。

HP:0000913.name: Posterior rib fusion
HP:0000913.definition: Complete or partial merging of the posterior part of adjacent ribs.
HP:0000913.definition_cn: 相邻肋骨后部的完全或部分融合。

HP:0000915.name: Pectus excavatum of inferior sternum
HP:0000915.definition: Pectus excavatum (defect of the chest wall characterized by depression of the sternum) affecting primarily the inferior region of the sternum.
HP:0000915.definition_cn: 漏斗胸（胸壁缺陷，以胸骨凹陷为特征），主要影响胸骨下段区域。

HP:0000916.name: Broad clavicles
HP:0000916.definition: Increased width (cross-sectional diameter) of the clavicles.
HP:0000916.definition_cn: 锁骨宽度（横截面直径）增加。

HP:0000917.name: Superior pectus carinatum
HP:0000917.definition: Pectus carinatum affecting primarily the superior part of the sternum.
HP:0000917.definition_cn: 主要累及胸骨上部的鸡胸。

HP:0000918.name: Scapular exostoses
HP:0000918.definition: The presence of multiple exostoses on the scapula. An exostosis is a benign growth the projects outward from the bone surface. It is capped by cartilage.
HP:0000918.definition_cn: 肩胛骨上存在多发性外生骨疣。外生骨疣是一种从骨表面向外突出的良性增生。其表面覆盖有软骨。

HP:0000919.name: Abnormality of the costochondral junction
HP:0000919.definition: Any anomaly of the costochondral junction. The costochondral junctions are located between the distal part of the ribs and the costal cartilages, which are bars of hyaline cartilage that connect the ribs to the sternum.
HP:0000919.definition_cn: 肋软骨连接处异常。肋软骨连接处位于肋骨远端与肋软骨之间，肋软骨为透明软骨条，将肋骨与胸骨相连。

HP:0000920.name: Enlargement of the costochondral junction
HP:0000920.definition: Abnormally increased size of the costochondral junctions, which are located between the distal part of the ribs and the costal cartilages, which are bars of hyaline cartilage that connect the ribs to the sternum.
HP:0000920.definition_cn: 肋软骨连接处异常增大，该连接处位于肋骨远端与肋软骨之间，肋软骨为透明软骨条，将肋骨与胸骨相连。

HP:0000921.name: Missing ribs
HP:0000921.definition: A developmental anomaly with absence of one or more ribs.

HP:0000924.name: Abnormality of the skeletal system
HP:0000924.definition: An abnormality of the skeletal system.

HP:0000925.name: Abnormality of the vertebral column
HP:0000925.definition: Any abnormality of the vertebral column.

HP:0000926.name: Platyspondyly
HP:0000926.definition: A flattened vertebral body shape with reduced distance between the vertebral endplates.
HP:0000926.definition_cn: 椎体扁平化伴椎体终板间距减小。

HP:0000927.name: Abnormality of skeletal maturation
HP:0000927.definition: The bones of the skeleton undergo a series of characteristic changes in size, shape, and calcification from fetal life until puberty. An abnormality of this process can include delayed or accelerated skeletal maturation, or deviation of some, but not all bones from the expected patterns of maturation.
HP:0000927.definition_cn: 骨骼系统从胎儿期至青春期会经历一系列特征性的变化，包括大小、形态和钙化程度的改变。这一过程的异常可能包括骨骼成熟延迟或加速，或部分骨骼（而非全部）偏离预期的成熟模式。

HP:0000929.name: Abnormal skull morphology
HP:0000929.definition: An abnormality of the skull, the bony framework of the head which is comprised of the neurocranium (with eight cranial bones) and the viscerocranium (facial skeleton) that comprises fourteen facial bones with the mandible as its largest bone.
HP:0000929.definition_cn: 颅骨异常，颅骨为头部的骨性框架，由神经颅（包含八块颅骨）和内脏颅（面骨）组成，其中内脏颅包括十四块面骨，下颌骨为其最大骨。

HP:0000930.name: Elevated imprint of the transverse sinuses

HP:0000931.name: Thinning and bulging of the posterior fossa bones

HP:0000932.name: Abnormal posterior cranial fossa morphology
HP:0000932.definition: An abnormality of the fossa cranii posterior (the posterior fossa), which is made up primarily of the occipital bone and which surrounds to the foramen magnum.
HP:0000932.definition_cn: 颅后窝（fossa cranii posterior）异常，该结构主要由枕骨（os occipitale）构成，并围绕枕骨大孔（foramen magnum）。

HP:0000933.name: Posterior fossa cyst at the fourth ventricle

HP:0000934.name: Chondrocalcinosis
HP:0000934.definition: Radiographic evidence of articular calcification that represent calcium pyrophosphate depositions in soft tissue surrounding joints and at the insertions of tendons near joints (Entheses/Sharpey fibers) .
HP:0000934.definition_cn: 影像学证据显示关节周围软组织及邻近关节的肌腱附着处（附着点/夏贝氏纤维）存在焦磷酸钙沉积所致的关节钙化。

HP:0000935.name: Thickened cortex of long bones
HP:0000935.definition: Abnormal thickening of the cortex of long bones.

HP:0000938.name: Osteopenia
HP:0000938.definition: Osteopenia is a term to define bone density that is not normal but also not as low as osteoporosis. By definition from the World Health Organization osteopenia is defined by bone densitometry as a T score -1 to -2.5.
HP:0000938.definition_cn: 骨量减少是指骨密度异常但未达到骨质疏松程度的医学术语。根据世界卫生组织的定义，骨量减少通过骨密度测定法定义为T值在-1至-2.5之间。

HP:0000939.name: Osteoporosis
HP:0000939.definition: Osteoporosis is a systemic skeletal disease characterized by low bone density and microarchitectural deterioration of bone tissue with a consequent increase in bone fragility. According to the WHO criteria, osteoporosis is defined as a BMD that lies 2.5 standard deviations or more below the average value for young healthy adults (a T-score below -2.5 SD).
HP:0000939.definition_cn: 骨质疏松症是一种以骨密度降低和骨组织微结构退化为特征的全身性骨骼疾病，从而导致骨脆性增加。根据世界卫生组织（WHO）的标准，骨质疏松症被定义为骨密度（BMD）低于年轻健康成年人平均值2.5个标准差或更多（T值低于-2.5 SD）。

HP:0000940.name: Abnormal diaphysis morphology
HP:0000940.definition: An abnormality of the structure or form of the diaphysis, i.e., of the main or mid-section (shaft) of a long bone.
HP:0000940.definition_cn: 骨干结构或形态异常，即长骨主体或中段（骨干）的结构或形态异常。

HP:0000944.name: Abnormal metaphysis morphology
HP:0000944.definition: An abnormality of one or more metaphysis, i.e., of the somewhat wider portion of a long bone that is adjacent to the epiphyseal growth plate and grows during childhood.
HP:0000944.definition_cn: 一种或多种干骺端异常，即长骨中较宽的部分，邻近骨骺生长板并在儿童期生长。

HP:0000947.name: Dumbbell-shaped long bone
HP:0000947.definition: An abnormal appearance of the long bones with resemblance to a dumbbell, a short bar with a weight at each end. That is, the long bone is shortened and displays flaring (widening) of the metaphyses.
HP:0000947.definition_cn: 长骨异常外观呈哑铃状，即长骨缩短并显示干骺端增宽（扩张）。

HP:0000952.name: Jaundice
HP:0000952.definition: Yellow pigmentation of the skin due to bilirubin, which in turn is the result of increased bilirubin concentration in the bloodstream.
HP:0000952.definition_cn: 皮肤黄染，由于胆红素所致，其原因是血液中胆红素浓度升高。

HP:0000953.name: Hyperpigmentation of the skin
HP:0000953.definition: A darkening of the skin related to an increase in melanin production and deposition.
HP:0000953.definition_cn: 皮肤色素沉着与黑色素生成和沉积增加相关。

HP:0000954.name: Single transverse palmar crease
HP:0000954.definition: The distal and proximal transverse palmar creases are merged into a single transverse palmar crease.
HP:0000954.definition_cn: 远端和近端掌横纹融合为单一掌横纹。

HP:0000956.name: Acanthosis nigricans
HP:0000956.definition: A dermatosis characterized by thickened, hyperpigmented plaques, typically on the intertriginous surfaces and neck.
HP:0000956.definition_cn: 一种皮肤病，其特征为增厚、色素沉着的斑块，通常发生于间擦部位和颈部。

HP:0000957.name: Cafe-au-lait spot
HP:0000957.definition: Cafe-au-lait spots are hyperpigmented lesions that can vary in color from light brown to dark brown with smooth borders and having a size of 1.5 cm or more in adults and 0.5 cm or more in children.
HP:0000957.definition_cn: 咖啡牛奶斑是一种色素沉着性病变，其颜色可从浅棕色至深棕色不等，边界光滑，成人的直径通常为1.5厘米或更大，儿童的直径通常为0.5厘米或更大。

HP:0000958.name: Dry skin
HP:0000958.definition: Skin characterized by the lack of natural or normal moisture.
HP:0000958.definition_cn: 皮肤表现为天然或正常水分缺乏。

HP:0000960.name: Sacral dimple
HP:0000960.definition: A cutaneous indentation resulting from tethering of the skin to underlying structures (bone) of the intergluteal cleft.
HP:0000960.definition_cn: 由于皮肤与臀间沟下方结构（骨骼）的牵拉导致的皮肤凹陷。

HP:0000961.name: Cyanosis
HP:0000961.definition: Bluish discoloration of the skin and mucosa due to poor circulation or inadequate oxygenation of arterial or capillary blood.
HP:0000961.definition_cn: 皮肤和黏膜因血液循环不良或动脉及毛细血管血氧不足而呈现的蓝紫色改变。

HP:0000962.name: Hyperkeratosis
HP:0000962.definition: Hyperkeratosis is thickening of the epidermis involving the outer layer of the skin, the stratum corneum, which is composed of large, polyhedral, plate-like envelopes filled with keratin which are the dead cells that have migrated up from the stratum granulosum.
HP:0000962.definition_cn: 角化过度是指表皮增厚，主要涉及皮肤的外层，即角质层。角质层由大量多面体、板状的外壳组成，这些外壳充满角蛋白，是由颗粒层迁移上来的死亡细胞构成。

HP:0000963.name: Thin skin
HP:0000963.definition: Reduction in thickness of the skin, generally associated with a loss of suppleness and elasticity of the skin.
HP:0000963.definition_cn: 皮肤厚度减少，通常伴随皮肤柔韧性和弹性的丧失。

HP:0000964.name: Eczematoid dermatitis
HP:0000964.definition: Eczema is a form of dermatitis that is characterized by scaly, pruritic, erythematous lesions located on flexural surfaces.
HP:0000964.definition_cn: 湿疹是一种皮炎，其特征为位于屈侧表面的鳞屑性、瘙痒性、红斑性皮损。

HP:0000965.name: Cutis marmorata
HP:0000965.definition: A reticular discoloration of the skin with cyanotic (reddish-blue appearing) areas surrounding pale central areas due to dilation of capillary blood vessels and stagnation of blood within the vessels. Cutis marmorata generally occurs on the legs, arms and trunk and is often more severe in cold weather.
HP:0000965.definition_cn: 皮肤网状变色，伴有紫绀（呈红蓝色）区域围绕苍白中心区域，由于毛细血管扩张及血管内血液淤滞所致。大理石样皮肤通常发生于下肢、上肢及躯干，寒冷天气时症状常更为严重。

HP:0000967.name: Petechiae
HP:0000967.definition: Petechiae are pinpoint-sized reddish/purple spots, resembling a rash, that appear just under the skin or a mucous membrane when capillaries have ruptured and some superficial bleeding into the skin has happened. This term refers to an abnormally increased susceptibility to developing petechiae.
HP:0000967.definition_cn: 瘀点是指毛细血管破裂后，皮肤或黏膜下发生浅表性出血，形成针尖大小的红/紫色斑点，类似于皮疹。该术语指的是异常增加的易发生瘀点的倾向。

HP:0000968.name: Ectodermal dysplasia
HP:0000968.definition: Ectodermal dysplasia is a group of conditions in which there is abnormal development of the skin, hair, nails, teeth, or sweat glands.
HP:0000968.definition_cn: 外胚层发育不良是一组以皮肤、毛发、指甲、牙齿或汗腺发育异常为特征的疾病。

HP:0000969.name: Edema
HP:0000969.definition: An abnormal accumulation of fluid beneath the skin, or in one or more cavities of the body.
HP:0000969.definition_cn: 皮下或体腔内一处或多处异常液体积聚。

HP:0000971.name: Abnormal sweat gland morphology
HP:0000971.definition: Any structural abnormality of the sweat gland.

HP:0000972.name: Palmoplantar hyperkeratosis
HP:0000972.definition: Abnormal thickening of the skin localized to the palm of the hand and the sole of the foot.
HP:0000972.definition_cn: 掌跖部局限性皮肤异常增厚。

HP:0000973.name: Cutis laxa
HP:0000973.definition: Wrinkled, redundant, inelastic and sagging skin.
HP:0000973.definition_cn: 皮肤皱褶、冗余、弹性减退及松弛。

HP:0000974.name: Hyperextensible skin
HP:0000974.definition: A condition in which the skin can be stretched beyond normal, and then returns to its initial position.
HP:0000974.definition_cn: 皮肤弹性过度，可被拉伸超出正常范围，随后恢复至初始状态。

HP:0000975.name: Hyperhidrosis
HP:0000975.definition: Abnormal excessive perspiration (sweating) despite the lack of appropriate stimuli like hot and humid weather.
HP:0000975.definition_cn: Hyperhidrosis in the absence of appropriate stimuli such as elevated ambient temperature and humidity.

HP:0000977.name: Soft skin
HP:0000977.definition: Subjective impression of increased softness upon palpation of the skin.
HP:0000977.definition_cn: 触诊时皮肤主观感觉柔软度增加。

HP:0000978.name: Bruising susceptibility
HP:0000978.definition: An ecchymosis (bruise) refers to the skin discoloration caused by the escape of blood into the tissues from ruptured blood vessels. This term refers to an abnormally increased susceptibility to bruising. The corresponding phenotypic abnormality is generally elicited on medical history as a report of frequent ecchymoses or bruising without adequate trauma.
HP:0000978.definition_cn: 瘀斑（ecchymosis）是指由于血管破裂导致血液渗入组织而引起的皮肤变色。该术语指的是异常增加的易瘀伤倾向。相应的表型异常通常通过病史采集引出，表现为频繁出现瘀斑或在无明显创伤的情况下出现瘀伤的报告。

HP:0000979.name: Purpura
HP:0000979.definition: Purpura (from Latin: purpura, meaning purple) is the appearance of red or purple discolorations on the skin that do not blanch on applying pressure. They are caused by bleeding underneath the skin. This term refers to an abnormally increased susceptibility to developing purpura. Purpura are larger than petechiae.
HP:0000979.definition_cn: 紫癜（源自拉丁语：purpura，意为紫色）是指皮肤上出现红色或紫色变色斑块，且在施加压力时不会褪色。其由皮下出血引起。该术语指异常增加的易发生紫癜的倾向。紫癜的病灶大于瘀点。

HP:0000982.name: Palmoplantar keratoderma
HP:0000982.definition: Abnormal thickening of the skin of the palms of the hands and the soles of the feet.

HP:0000988.name: Skin rash
HP:0000988.definition: A red eruption of the skin.

HP:0000989.name: Pruritus
HP:0000989.definition: Pruritus is an itch or a sensation that makes a person want to scratch. This term refers to an abnormally increased disposition to experience pruritus.
HP:0000989.definition_cn: 瘙痒症是一种令人产生搔抓欲望的皮肤异常感觉。该术语特指个体对瘙痒感受的异常增强倾向。

HP:0000991.name: Xanthomatosis
HP:0000991.definition: The presence of multiple xanthomas (xanthomata) in the skin. Xanthomas are yellowish, firm, lipid-laden nodules in the skin.
HP:0000991.definition_cn: 皮肤多发性黄色瘤（Xanthomata）。黄色瘤是皮肤中富含脂质的黄色、坚硬的结节。

HP:0000992.name: Cutaneous photosensitivity
HP:0000992.definition: An increased sensitivity of the skin to light. Photosensitivity may result in a rash upon exposure to the sun (which is known as photodermatosis). Photosensitivity can be diagnosed by phototests in which light is shone on small areas of skin.
HP:0000992.definition_cn: 皮肤对光线的敏感性增加。光敏性可能导致暴露于阳光下后出现皮疹（称为光敏性皮炎）。光敏性可通过光试验进行诊断，该试验将光线照射于皮肤的小面积区域。

HP:0000993.name: Molluscoid pseudotumors
HP:0000993.definition: Bluish-grey, spongy nodules associated with scars over pressure points and easily traumatized areas like the elbows and knees.
HP:0000993.definition_cn: 蓝灰色、海绵状结节，与压力点和易受创伤区域（如肘部和膝盖）的瘢痕相关。

HP:0000995.name: Melanocytic nevus
HP:0000995.definition: A oval and round, colored (usually medium-to dark brown, reddish brown, or flesh colored) lesion. Typically, a melanocytic nevus is less than 6 mm in diameter, but may be much smaller or larger.
HP:0000995.definition_cn: 椭圆形或圆形，有色（通常为中至深棕色、红棕色或肉色）的皮损。典型的黑素细胞痣直径小于6毫米，但可能更小或更大。

HP:0000996.name: Facial capillary hemangioma
HP:0000996.definition: Hemangioma, a benign tumor of the vascular endothelial cells with small endothelial spaces, occurring in the face.
HP:0000996.definition_cn: 血管瘤，一种发生于面部的血管内皮细胞良性肿瘤，具有微小的内皮间隙。

HP:0000997.name: Axillary freckling
HP:0000997.definition: The presence in the axillary region (armpit) of an increased number of freckles, small circular spots on the skin that are darker than the surrounding skin because of deposits of melanin.
HP:0000997.definition_cn: 腋窝区域（腋下）出现数量增多的雀斑，即皮肤上因黑色素沉积而形成的较周围皮肤颜色更深的小圆形斑点。

HP:0000998.name: Hypertrichosis
HP:0000998.definition: Hypertrichosis is increased hair growth that is abnormal in quantity or location.
HP:0000998.definition_cn: 多毛症是指毛发在数量或部位上异常增多的现象。

HP:0000999.name: Pyoderma
HP:0000999.definition: Any manifestation of a skin disease associated with the production of pus.
HP:0000999.definition_cn: 任何与脓液产生相关的皮肤疾病表现。

HP:0001000.name: Abnormality of skin pigmentation
HP:0001000.definition: An abnormality of the pigmentation of the skin.

HP:0001003.name: Multiple lentigines
HP:0001003.definition: Presence of an unusually high number of lentigines (singular: lentigo), which are flat, tan to brown oval spots.
HP:0001003.definition_cn: 存在异常大量的雀斑样痣（单数：lentigo），即平坦的、棕褐色至棕色的椭圆形斑点。

HP:0001004.name: Lymphedema
HP:0001004.definition: Localized fluid retention and tissue swelling caused by a compromised lymphatic system.

HP:0001005.name: Dermatological manifestations of systemic disorders
HP:0001005.name_cn: 系统性疾病的皮肤表现

HP:0001007.name: Hirsutism
HP:0001007.definition: Abnormally increased hair growth referring to a male pattern of body hair (androgenic hair).
HP:0001007.definition_cn: 多毛症（Hirsutism），特指女性出现男性型体毛（雄激素依赖性毛发）异常增多的现象。

HP:0001008.name: Accumulation of melanosomes in melanocytes
HP:0001008.name_cn: 黑素细胞中黑素小体的积聚

HP:0001009.name: Telangiectasia
HP:0001009.definition: Telangiectasias refer to small dilated blood vessels located near the surface of the skin or mucous membranes, measuring between 0.5 and 1 millimeter in diameter.
