Telangiectasia are located especially on the tongue, lips, palate, fingers, face, conjunctiva, trunk, nail beds, and fingertips.
HP:0001009.definition_cn: 毛细血管扩张症是指位于皮肤或黏膜表面附近的小型扩张血管，直径在0.5至1毫米之间。毛细血管扩张症尤其常见于舌部、唇部、腭部、手指、面部、结膜、躯干、甲床及指尖等部位。

HP:0001010.name: Hypopigmentation of the skin
HP:0001010.definition: A reduction of skin color related to a decrease in melanin production and deposition.
HP:0001010.definition_cn: 皮肤色素减退与黑色素生成和沉积减少相关。

HP:0001011.name: obsolete Diaphoresis (with pheochromocytoma)
HP:0001011.name_cn: 过时的术语：多汗症（伴嗜铬细胞瘤）

HP:0001012.name: Multiple lipomas
HP:0001012.definition: The presence of multiple lipomas (a type of benign tissue made of fatty tissue).
HP:0001012.definition_cn: 多发性脂肪瘤（一种由脂肪组织构成的良性组织）的存在。

HP:0001013.name: Eruptive xanthomas
HP:0001013.definition: Eruptive xanthomas are yellow-orange-to-red-brown papules that are often surrounded by an erythematous halo. They appear in crops on the buttocks, extensor surfaces of the extremities, and flexural creases. Acutely, variable amounts of pruritus and pain occur.
HP:0001013.definition_cn: 发疹性黄色瘤表现为黄橙色至红棕色的丘疹，常伴有红斑性晕轮。它们成批出现在臀部、四肢伸肌表面及屈曲皱褶处。急性期可伴有不同程度的瘙痒和疼痛。

HP:0001014.name: Angiokeratoma
HP:0001014.definition: Angiokeratomas are hyperkeratotic papules that are characterized histologically by superficial ectatic (i.e., dilated) blood vessels with epidermal proliferation. Clinically, angiokeratoma presents as a small, raised, dark-red spot.
HP:0001014.definition_cn: 血管角化瘤是一种角化过度性丘疹，其组织学特征为浅表扩张的血管伴表皮增生。临床上，血管角化瘤表现为小而隆起的暗红色斑点。

HP:0001015.name: Prominent superficial veins
HP:0001015.definition: A condition in which superficial veins (i.e., veins just under the skin) are more conspicuous or noticeable than normal.
HP:0001015.definition_cn: 浅表静脉（即位于皮肤下方的静脉）比正常情况下更为明显或显著的一种状况。

HP:0001017.name: Anemic pallor
HP:0001017.definition: A type of pallor that is secondary to the presence of anemia.
HP:0001017.definition_cn: 一种继发于贫血的苍白类型。

HP:0001018.name: Abnormal palmar dermatoglyphics
HP:0001018.definition: An abnormality of the dermatoglyphs, i.e., an abnormality of the patterns of ridges of the skin of palm of hand.
HP:0001018.definition_cn: 皮纹异常，即手掌皮肤嵴纹模式异常。

HP:0001019.name: Erythroderma
HP:0001019.definition: An inflammatory exfoliative dermatosis involving nearly all of the surface of the skin. Erythroderma develops suddenly. A patchy erythema may generalize and spread to affect most of the skin. Scaling may appear in 2-6 days and be accompanied by hot, red, dry skin, malaise, and fever.
HP:0001019.definition_cn: 一种累及几乎全部皮肤表面的炎症性剥脱性皮肤病。红皮病突然发生。斑片状红斑可能泛化并扩散至大部分皮肤。鳞屑可能在2-6天内出现，并伴有皮肤发红、干燥、发热、不适和发热。

HP:0001022.name: Albinism
HP:0001022.definition: An abnormal reduction in the amount of pigmentation (reduced or absent) of skin, hair and eye (iris and retina).
HP:0001022.definition_cn: 皮肤、毛发和眼睛（虹膜和视网膜）色素沉着量的异常减少（减少或缺失）。

HP:0001024.name: Skin dimple over apex of long bone angulation
HP:0001024.name_cn: 长骨成角顶点处皮肤凹陷

HP:0001025.name: Urticaria
HP:0001025.definition: Raised, well-circumscribed areas of erythema and edema involving the dermis and epidermis. Urticaria is intensely pruritic, and blanches completely with pressure.
HP:0001025.definition_cn: 隆起的、边界清晰的红斑和水肿区域，累及真皮和表皮。荨麻疹伴有剧烈瘙痒，且受压后完全变白。

HP:0001027.name: Soft, doughy skin
HP:0001027.definition: A skin texture that is unusually soft (and may feel silky), and has a malleable consistency resembling that of dough.
HP:0001027.definition_cn: 皮肤质地异常柔软（可能具有丝滑感），且具有类似面团的可塑性一致性。

HP:0001028.name: Hemangioma
HP:0001028.definition: A hemangioma is a benign tumor characterized by blood-filled spaces lined by benign endothelial cells. A hemangioma characterized by large endothelial spaces (caverns) is called a cavernous hemangioma (in contrast to a hemangioma with small endothelial spaces, which is called capillary hemangioma).
HP:0001028.definition_cn: 血管瘤是一种良性肿瘤，其特征为由良性内皮细胞排列的充满血液的腔隙。以较大内皮腔隙（海绵状）为特征的血管瘤称为海绵状血管瘤（与具有较小内皮腔隙的血管瘤相对，后者称为毛细血管瘤）。

HP:0001029.name: Poikiloderma
HP:0001029.definition: Poikiloderma refers to a patch of skin with (1) reticulated hypopigmentation and hyperpigmentation, (2) wrinkling secondary to epidermal atrophy, and (3) telangiectasias.
HP:0001029.definition_cn: 异色性皮病是指皮肤出现以下特征的斑块：(1) 网状色素减退和色素沉着，(2) 继发于表皮萎缩的皱褶，(3) 毛细血管扩张。

HP:0001030.name: Fragile skin
HP:0001030.definition: Skin that splits easily with minimal injury.
HP:0001030.definition_cn: 皮肤脆性增加（Cutis Fragilitas）或皮肤易裂性（Dermatosparaxis）。

HP:0001032.name: Absent distal interphalangeal creases
HP:0001032.definition: Absence of the distal interphalangeal flexion creases of the fingers.
HP:0001032.name_cn: 远端指间关节皱褶缺失
HP:0001032.definition_cn: 手指远端指间关节屈曲皱褶缺失。

HP:0001034.name: Hypermelanotic macule
HP:0001034.definition: A hyperpigmented circumscribed area of change in normal skin color without elevation or depression of any size.
HP:0001034.definition_cn: 正常皮肤颜色改变形成的局限性色素沉着区域，无任何大小的隆起或凹陷。

HP:0001036.name: Parakeratosis
HP:0001036.definition: Abnormal formation of the keratinocytes of the epidermis characterized by persistence of nuclei, incomplete formation of keratin, and moistness and swelling of the keratinocytes.
HP:0001036.definition_cn: 表皮角质形成细胞异常形成，其特征为细胞核持续存在、角蛋白形成不完全以及角质形成细胞湿润和肿胀。

HP:0001038.name: Warfarin-induced skin necrosis
HP:0001038.name_cn: 华法林诱导的皮肤坏死

HP:0001041.name: Facial erythema
HP:0001041.definition: Redness of the skin of the face, caused by hyperemia of the capillaries in the lower layers of the skin.
HP:0001041.definition_cn: 面部皮肤红斑，由皮肤深层毛细血管充血引起。

HP:0001046.name: Intermittent jaundice
HP:0001046.definition: Jaundice that is sometimes present, sometimes not.

HP:0001047.name: Atopic dermatitis
HP:0001047.definition: Atopic dermatitis (AD) or atopic eczema is an itchy, inflammatory skin condition with a predilection for the skin flexures. It is characterized by poorly defined erythema with edema, vesicles, and weeping in the acute stage and skin thickening (lichenification) in the chronic stage.
HP:0001047.definition_cn: 特应性皮炎（Atopic Dermatitis, AD）或特应性湿疹是一种以皮肤屈侧为好发部位的瘙痒性炎症性皮肤病。其急性期表现为边界不清的红斑伴水肿、水疱和渗出，慢性期则表现为皮肤增厚（苔藓样变）。

HP:0001048.name: Cavernous hemangioma
HP:0001048.definition: The presence of a cavernous hemangioma. A hemangioma characterized by large endothelial spaces (caverns) is called a cavernous hemangioma.
HP:0001048.definition_cn: 海绵状血管瘤的存在。一种以大型内皮腔隙（海绵状）为特征的血管瘤称为海绵状血管瘤。

HP:0001049.name: Absent dorsal skin creases over affected joints
HP:0001049.name_cn: 受累关节背侧皮肤皱褶缺失

HP:0001051.name: Seborrheic dermatitis
HP:0001051.definition: Seborrheic dermatitis is a form of eczema which is closely related to dandruff. It causes dry or greasy peeling of the scalp, eyebrows, and face, and sometimes trunk.
HP:0001051.definition_cn: 脂溢性皮炎是一种与头皮屑密切相关的湿疹类型。它会导致头皮、眉毛和面部出现干燥或油腻的脱屑，有时也会累及躯干。

HP:0001052.name: Nevus flammeus
HP:0001052.definition: A congenital vascular malformation consisting of superficial and deep dilated capillaries in the skin which produce a reddish to purplish discolouration of the skin.
HP:0001052.definition_cn: 一种先天性血管畸形，由皮肤浅层和深层的扩张毛细血管组成，导致皮肤呈现红色至紫色的色素沉着。

HP:0001055.name: Erysipelas
HP:0001055.definition: Increased susceptibility to erysipelas, as manifested by a medical history of repeated episodes of erysipelas, which is a superficial infection of the skin, typically involving the lymphatic system.
HP:0001055.definition_cn: 丹毒易感性增加，表现为反复发作的丹毒病史，丹毒是一种皮肤浅表感染，通常累及淋巴系统。

HP:0001056.name: Milia
HP:0001056.definition: Presence of multiple small cysts containing keratin (skin protein) and presenting as tiny pearly-white bumps just under the surface of the skin.
HP:0001056.definition_cn: 存在多个含有角蛋白（皮肤蛋白质）的小囊肿，表现为皮肤表面下微小的珍珠白色丘疹。

HP:0001057.name: Aplasia cutis congenita
HP:0001057.definition: A developmental defect resulting in the congenital absence of skin in multiple or solitary non-inflammatory, well-demarcated, oval or circular ulcers with a diameter of about 1 to 2 cm. Aplasia cutis congenita most commonly occurs on the scalp, but may present in the face, trunk, or limbs.
HP:0001057.definition_cn: 一种发育缺陷，导致先天性皮肤缺失，表现为多发或孤立的非炎症性、边界清晰的椭圆形或圆形溃疡，直径约为1至2厘米。先天性皮肤发育不全最常见于头皮，但也可能出现在面部、躯干或四肢。

HP:0001058.name: Poor wound healing
HP:0001058.definition: A reduced ability to heal cutaneous wounds.
HP:0001058.definition_cn: 皮肤伤口愈合能力降低。

HP:0001059.name: Pterygium
HP:0001059.definition: Pterygia are 'winglike' triangular membranes occurring in the neck, eyes, knees, elbows, ankles or digits.
HP:0001059.definition_cn: 翼状胬肉是呈“翼状”的三角形膜状物，可发生于颈部、眼部、膝部、肘部、踝部或指（趾）部。

HP:0001060.name: Axillary pterygium
HP:0001060.definition: Presence of a cutaneous membrane (flap) in the armpit.

HP:0001061.name: Acne
HP:0001061.definition: A skin condition in which there is an increase in sebum secretion by the pilosebaceous apparatus associated with open comedones (blackheads), closed comedones (whiteheads), and pustular nodules (papules, pustules, and cysts).
HP:0001061.definition_cn: 一种皮肤疾病，其特征为皮脂腺分泌增加，伴随开放性粉刺（黑头）、闭合性粉刺（白头）以及脓疱性结节（丘疹、脓疱和囊肿）。

HP:0001062.name: Atypical nevus
HP:0001062.definition: A large pigmented lesion measuring 5-15 mm in diameter with irregular, notched, and ill defined border and with color that may range from tan to dark brown to pink.
HP:0001062.definition_cn: 一个直径5-15毫米的大型色素性病变，边缘不规则、呈锯齿状且边界不清，颜色可从浅棕色至深棕色至粉红色不等。

HP:0001063.name: Acrocyanosis
HP:0001063.definition: Bluish discoloration of the skin of the hands or feet.

HP:0001065.name: Striae distensae
HP:0001065.definition: Thinned, erythematous, depressed bands of atrophic skin. Initially, striae appear as flattened and thinned, pinkish linear regions of the skin. Striae tend to enlarge in length and become reddish or purplish. Later, striae tend to appear as white, depressed bands that are parallel to the lines of skin tension. Striae distensae occur most often in areas that have been subject to distension such as the lower back, buttocks, thighs, breast, abdomen, and shoulders.
HP:0001065.definition_cn: 变薄、红斑性、凹陷的萎缩性皮肤带。最初，皮纹表现为皮肤平坦、变薄的粉红色线性区域。皮纹往往在长度上扩大并变为红色或紫色。随后，皮纹往往表现为白色、凹陷的带，与皮肤张力线平行。膨胀纹最常出现在受到扩张的区域，如腰部、臀部、大腿、乳房、腹部和肩部。

HP:0001067.name: Neurofibroma
HP:0001067.definition: A benign peripheral nerve sheath tumor that generally appears as a soft, skin-colored papule or small subcutaneous nodule. Individuals with neurofibromatosis can have numerous neurofibromas.
HP:0001067.definition_cn: 一种良性周围神经鞘肿瘤，通常表现为柔软的、肤色丘疹或小型皮下结节。神经纤维瘤病患者可出现多发性神经纤维瘤。

HP:0001069.name: Episodic hyperhidrosis
HP:0001069.definition: Intermittent episodes of abnormally increased perspiration.

HP:0001070.name: Mottled pigmentation
HP:0001070.definition_cn: 斑片状不规则皮肤色素沉着。

HP:0001071.name: Angiokeratoma corporis diffusum
HP:0001071.definition: Angiokeratoma corporis diffusum (ACD) is typically characterized by innumerable small red to black papules which occur in clusters and are situated symmetrically in the bathing trunks area. The number of lesions and the extension of the body increase steadily with time so that generalization and mucosal involvement are common. The single lesion begins with a minute reddish papule which enlarges to up to 10 mm in diameter, becomes dark red to black with a discrete keratotic overgrowth. Histologically, the papules are characterized by superficial dilated capillaries in papillary dermis with epidermal proliferation.
HP:0001071.name_cn: 弥漫性躯体血管角化瘤
HP:0001071.definition_cn: 弥漫性躯体血管角化瘤（Angiokeratoma corporis diffusum, ACD）通常表现为无数簇状分布的小型红色至黑色丘疹，对称分布于躯干下部区域。病变的数量和范围随时间逐渐增加，导致全身泛发及黏膜受累较为常见。单个病变最初表现为微小的红色丘疹，逐渐增大至直径可达10毫米，颜色变为深红至黑色，并伴有明显的角化过度。组织学上，丘疹的特征为乳头层真皮浅层扩张的毛细血管伴表皮增生。

HP:0001074.name: Atypical nevi in non-sun exposed areas
HP:0001074.name_cn: 非日光暴露部位的非典型痣

HP:0001075.name: Atrophic scars
HP:0001075.definition: Scars that form a depression compared to the level of the surrounding skin because of damage to the collagen, fat or other tissues below the skin.
HP:0001075.definition_cn: 由于皮下胶原蛋白、脂肪或其他组织损伤而形成的与周围皮肤水平相比呈凹陷状的瘢痕。

HP:0001080.name: Biliary tract abnormality
HP:0001080.definition: An abnormality of the biliary tree.

HP:0001081.name: Cholelithiasis
HP:0001081.definition: Hard, pebble-like deposits that form within the gallbladder.
HP:0001081.definition_cn: 胆囊内形成的坚硬、卵石样沉积物。

HP:0001082.name: Cholecystitis
HP:0001082.definition: The presence of inflammatory changes in the gallbladder.
HP:0001082.definition_cn: 胆囊内存在炎症性改变。

HP:0001083.name: Ectopia lentis
HP:0001083.definition: Dislocation or malposition of the crystalline lens of the eye. A partial displacement (or dislocation) of the lens is described as a subluxation of the lens, while a complete displacement is termed luxation of the lens. A complete displacement occurs if the lens is completely outside the patellar fossa of the lens, either in the anterior chamber, in the vitreous, or directly on the retina. If the lens is partially displaced but still contained within the lens space, then it is termed subluxation.
HP:0001083.definition_cn: 晶状体脱位或异位。晶状体的部分移位（或脱位）称为晶状体半脱位，而完全移位则称为晶状体全脱位。若晶状体完全脱离晶状体窝，位于前房、玻璃体或直接位于视网膜上，则称为全脱位。若晶状体部分移位但仍位于晶状体空间内，则称为半脱位。

HP:0001084.name: Corneal arcus
HP:0001084.definition: A hazy, grayish-white ring about 2 mm in width located close to but separated from the limbus (the corneoscleral junction). Corneal arcus generally occurs bilaterally, and is related to lipid deposition in the cornea. Corneal arcus can occur in elderly persons as a part of the aging process but may be associated with hypercholesterolemia in people under the age of 50 years.
HP:0001084.definition_cn: 角膜老年环（Corneal Arcus）是一种位于角膜缘（Corneoscleral Junction）附近但与之分离的、宽度约为2毫米的模糊灰白色环状结构。角膜老年环通常为双侧发生，与角膜内脂质沉积相关。该病变在老年人中可作为衰老过程的一部分出现，但在50岁以下人群中可能与高胆固醇血症（Hypercholesterolemia）相关。

HP:0001085.name: Papilledema
HP:0001085.definition: Papilledema refers to edema (swelling) of the optic disc secondary to any factor which increases cerebral spinal fluid pressure.
HP:0001085.definition_cn: 视乳头水肿是指由于任何导致脑脊液压力升高的因素所引起的视盘继发性水肿（肿胀）。

HP:0001087.name: Developmental glaucoma
HP:0001087.definition: Glaucoma which forms during the early years of a child's life is called developmental or congenital glaucoma.
HP:0001087.definition_cn: 在儿童早期形成的青光眼被称为发育性青光眼或先天性青光眼。

HP:0001088.name: Brushfield spots
HP:0001088.definition: The presence of whitish spots in a ring-like arrangement at the periphery of the iris.
HP:0001088.definition_cn: 虹膜周边呈环状排列的白色斑点。

HP:0001089.name: Iris atrophy
HP:0001089.definition_cn: 虹膜组织萎缩（虹膜萎缩）

HP:0001090.name: Abnormally large globe
HP:0001090.definition: Diffusely large eye (with megalocornea) without glaucoma.
HP:0001090.definition_cn: 弥漫性大眼（伴巨角膜），无青光眼。

HP:0001092.name: Absent lacrimal punctum
HP:0001092.definition: No identifiable superior and/or inferior lacrimal punctum.
HP:0001092.definition_cn: 无法识别上泪点和/或下泪点。

HP:0001093.name: Optic nerve dysplasia
HP:0001093.definition: The presence of developmental dysplasia of the optic nerve.
HP:0001093.definition_cn: 视神经发育不良的存在。

HP:0001094.name: Iridocyclitis
HP:0001094.definition: A type of anterior uveitis, in which there is Inflammation of the iris and the ciliary body.
HP:0001094.definition_cn: 一种前葡萄膜炎，表现为虹膜和睫状体的炎症。

HP:0001096.name: Keratoconjunctivitis
HP:0001096.definition: Inflammation of the cornea and conjunctiva.

HP:0001097.name: Keratoconjunctivitis sicca
HP:0001097.definition: Dryness of the eye related to deficiency of the tear film components (aqueous, mucin, or lipid), lid surface abnormalities, or epithelial abnormalities. Keratoconjunctivitis sicca often results in a scratchy or sandy sensation (foreign body sensation) in the eyes, and may also be associated with itching, inability to produce tears, photosensitivity, redness, pain, and difficulty in moving the eyelids.
HP:0001097.definition_cn: 眼干燥症与泪膜成分（水样、粘蛋白或脂质）缺乏、眼睑表面异常或上皮异常相关。干性角结膜炎常导致眼部出现砂砾感或异物感，并可能伴随瘙痒、泪液分泌不足、畏光、充血、疼痛及眼睑运动困难等症状。

HP:0001098.name: Abnormal fundus morphology
HP:0001098.definition: Any structural abnormality of the fundus of the eye.

HP:0001100.name: Heterochromia iridis
HP:0001100.definition: Heterochromia iridis is a difference in the color of the iris in the two eyes.
HP:0001100.definition_cn: 虹膜异色症是指双眼虹膜颜色存在差异。

HP:0001102.name: Angioid streaks of the fundus
HP:0001102.definition: Irregular lines in the deep retina that are typically configured in a radiating fashion and emanate from the optic disc. Angioid streaks are crack-like dehiscences in abnormally thickened and calcified Bruch's membrane, resulting in atrophy of the overlying retinal pigment epithelium. They may be associated with a number of endocrine, metabolic, and connective tissue abnormalities but are frequently idiopathic.
HP:0001102.definition_cn: 深部视网膜中呈放射状排列并从视盘发出的不规则线条。血管样条纹是异常增厚和钙化的Bruch膜中的裂纹样裂开，导致其上方的视网膜色素上皮萎缩。它们可能与多种内分泌、代谢和结缔组织异常相关，但通常为特发性。

HP:0001103.name: Abnormal macular morphology
HP:0001103.definition: A structural abnormality of the macula lutea, which is an oval-shaped highly pigmented yellow spot near the center of the retina.
HP:0001103.definition_cn: 黄斑结构异常，黄斑为视网膜中心附近呈椭圆形、高度色素沉着的黄色斑点。

HP:0001105.name: Retinal atrophy
HP:0001105.definition: Well-demarcated area(s) of partial or complete depigmentation in the fundus, reflecting atrophy of the retinal pigment epithelium with associated retinal photoreceptor loss.
HP:0001105.definition_cn: 眼底出现界限清晰的局部或完全脱色素区域，反映视网膜色素上皮萎缩并伴有视网膜光感受器丧失。

HP:0001106.name: Periorbital hyperpigmentation
HP:0001106.definition: Increased pigmentation of the skin in the region surrounding the orbit of the eye.
HP:0001106.definition_cn: 眶周皮肤色素沉着增加。

HP:0001107.name: Ocular albinism
HP:0001107.definition: An abnormal reduction in the amount of pigmentation (reduced or absent) of the iris and retina.
HP:0001107.definition_cn: 虹膜和视网膜色素沉着异常减少（色素减少或缺失）。

HP:0001112.name: Leber optic atrophy
HP:0001112.definition: Degeneration of retinal ganglion cells and their axons.
HP:0001112.definition_cn: 视网膜神经节细胞及其轴突的变性。

HP:0001114.name: Xanthelasma
HP:0001114.definition: The presence of xanthomata in the skin of the eyelid.

HP:0001115.name: Posterior polar cataract
HP:0001115.definition: A polar cataract that affects the posterior pole of the lens.
HP:0001115.definition_cn: 影响晶状体后极部的极性白内障。

HP:0001116.name: Macular coloboma
HP:0001116.definition: A congenital defect of the macula distinct from coloboma associated with optic fissure closure defects. Macular coloboma is characterized by a sharply defined, rather large defect in the central area of the fundus that is oval or round, and coarsely pigmented.
HP:0001116.definition_cn: 一种与视裂闭合缺陷相关的黄斑先天性缺损，区别于黄斑缺损。黄斑缺损的特征是眼底中央区域出现边界清晰、较大且呈椭圆形或圆形的粗糙色素沉着缺损。

HP:0001117.name: Sudden loss of visual acuity
HP:0001117.definition: Severe loss of visual acuity within hours or days. This is characteristic of Leber hereditary optic neuropathy.
HP:0001117.definition_cn: 数小时或数天内视力严重下降。这是莱伯遗传性视神经病变的特征性表现。

HP:0001118.name: Juvenile cataract
HP:0001118.definition: A type of cataract that is not apparent at birth but that arises in childhood or adolescence.
HP:0001118.definition_cn: 一种在出生时不明显但在儿童期或青春期出现的白内障类型。

HP:0001119.name: Keratoglobus
HP:0001119.definition: Limbus-to-limbus corneal thinning, often greatest in the periphery, with globular protrusion of the cornea.
HP:0001119.definition_cn: 角膜缘至角膜缘的角膜变薄，通常在外周最为显著，伴有角膜的球形突出。

HP:0001120.name: Abnormality of corneal size
HP:0001120.definition: Any abnormality of the size or morphology of the cornea.

HP:0001122.name: obsolete Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the choroid
HP:0001122.name_cn: 过时的脉络膜发育不全/发育不良

HP:0001125.name: Transient unilateral blurring of vision
HP:0001125.definition: Transient blurring of vision associated with the aura phase of migraine.
HP:0001125.definition_cn: 偏头痛先兆期相关的短暂性视力模糊。

HP:0001126.name: Cryptophthalmos
HP:0001126.definition: Cryptophthalmos is a condition of total absence of eyelids and the skin of forehead is continuous with that of cheek, in which the eyeball is completely concealed by the skin, which is stretched over the orbital cavity.
HP:0001126.definition_cn: 隐眼畸形是一种完全缺乏眼睑且前额皮肤与颊部皮肤相连的病症，其中眼球被覆盖在眼眶腔上的皮肤完全遮蔽。

HP:0001128.name: Trichiasis
HP:0001128.definition: Inversion and rubbing of the eyelashes against the globe of the eye.

HP:0001131.name: Corneal dystrophy
HP:0001131.definition: The term corneal dystrophy embraces a heterogenous group of bilateral genetically determined non-inflammatory corneal diseases that are restricted to the cornea.
HP:0001131.definition_cn: 角膜营养不良这一术语涵盖了一组异质性的、双侧遗传性非炎症性角膜疾病，这些疾病仅限于角膜。

HP:0001132.name: Lens subluxation
HP:0001132.definition: Partial dislocation of the lens of the eye.

HP:0001133.name: Constriction of peripheral visual field
HP:0001133.definition: An absolute or relative decrease in retinal sensitivity extending from edge (periphery) of the visual field in a concentric pattern. The visual field is the area that is perceived simultaneously by a fixating eye.
HP:0001133.definition_cn: 视网膜敏感度从视野边缘（周边）以同心圆模式出现绝对或相对下降。视野是指固定注视眼同时感知的区域。

HP:0001134.name: Anterior polar cataract
HP:0001134.definition: A polar cataract that affects the anterior pole of the lens.

HP:0001135.name: Chorioretinal dystrophy
HP:0001135.name_cn: 脉络膜视网膜营养不良

HP:0001136.name: Retinal arteriolar tortuosity
HP:0001136.definition: The presence of an increased number of twists and turns of the retinal arterioles.
HP:0001136.definition_cn: 视网膜小动脉迂曲度增加。

HP:0001137.name: Alternating esotropia
HP:0001137.definition: Esotropia in which either eye may be used for fixation.

HP:0001140.name: Limbal dermoid
HP:0001140.definition: A benign tumor typically found at the junction of the cornea and sclera (limbal epibullar dermoid).
HP:0001140.definition_cn: 一种良性肿瘤，通常位于角膜与巩膜交界处（角膜缘上皮样皮样囊肿）。

HP:0001141.name: Severely reduced visual acuity
HP:0001141.definition: Severe reduction of the ability to see. On the 6m visual acuity scale, severe reduction is defined as less than 6/60 but at least 3/60. On the 20ft visual acuity scale, severe reduction is defined as less than 20/200 but at least 20/400. On the decimal visual acuity scale, severe reduction is defined as less than 0.1 but at least 0.05.
HP:0001141.definition_cn: 视力严重减退。在6米视力表上，严重减退定义为视力低于6/60但至少为3/60。在20英尺视力表上，严重减退定义为视力低于20/200但至少为20/400。在小数视力表上，严重减退定义为视力低于0.1但至少为0.05。

HP:0001142.name: Lenticonus
HP:0001142.definition: A conical projection of the anterior or posterior surface of the lens, occurring as a developmental anomaly.
HP:0001142.definition_cn: 晶状体前表面或后表面的锥形突起，作为一种发育异常出现。

HP:0001144.name: Orbital cyst
HP:0001144.definition: Presence of a cyst in the region of the periorbital tissues. Orbital cysts can be derived from epithelial or glandular tissue within or surrounding the orbit (lacrimal glands, salivary glands, conjunctival, oral, nasal, or sinus epithelium).
HP:0001144.definition_cn: 眶周组织区域存在囊肿。眼眶囊肿可源自眼眶内或周围的表皮或腺体组织（泪腺、唾液腺、结膜、口腔、鼻腔或鼻窦上皮）。

HP:0001145.name: obsolete Chorioretinopathy
HP:0001145.name_cn: 陈旧性脉络膜视网膜病变

HP:0001146.name: obsolete Pigmentary retinal degeneration
HP:0001146.name_cn: 陈旧性色素性视网膜变性

HP:0001147.name: Retinal exudate
HP:0001147.definition: Fluid which has escaped from retinal blood vessels with a high concentration of lipid, protein, and cellular debris with a typically bright, reflective, white or cream colored appearance on the surface of the retina.
HP:0001147.definition_cn: 从视网膜血管渗出的液体，含有高浓度的脂质、蛋白质和细胞碎片，在视网膜表面呈现典型的明亮、反光、白色或奶油色外观。

HP:0001149.name: Lattice corneal dystrophy
HP:0001149.definition: The presence of fine, branching linear opacities in Bowman's layer in the central area that may spread to the periphery in the clinical course. The deep corneal stroma may be involved but the process does not reach Descemet's membrane. Recurrent corneal erosion may occur. Histologic examination reveals amyloid deposits in the collagen fibers of the cornea.
HP:0001149.definition_cn: 在中央区域Bowman层内存在细小的、分支状线性混浊，可能在临床病程中向周边扩散。深层角膜基质可能受累，但病变未达Descemet膜。可能发生复发性角膜糜烂。组织学检查显示角膜胶原纤维中存在淀粉样物质沉积。

HP:0001151.name: Impaired horizontal smooth pursuit
HP:0001151.definition: An abnormality of ocular smooth pursuit characterized by an impairment of the ability to track horizontally moving objects.
HP:0001151.definition_cn: 水平平滑追踪异常，表现为对水平移动物体追踪能力受损。

HP:0001152.name: Saccadic smooth pursuit
HP:0001152.definition: An abnormality of tracking eye movements in which smooth pursuit is interrupted by an abnormally high number of saccadic movements.
HP:0001152.definition_cn: 眼球追踪运动异常，其中平滑追踪被异常高数量的扫视运动所中断。

HP:0001153.name: Septate vagina
HP:0001153.definition: The presence of a vaginal septum, thereby creating a vaginal duplication. The septum is longitudinal in the majority of cases.
HP:0001153.definition_cn: 阴道隔膜的存在，从而导致阴道重复。在大多数情况下，隔膜呈纵向分布。

HP:0001155.name: Abnormality of the hand
HP:0001155.definition: An abnormality affecting one or both hands.

HP:0001156.name: Brachydactyly
HP:0001156.definition: Digits that appear disproportionately short compared to the hand/foot. The word brachydactyly is used here to describe a series distinct patterns of shortened digits (brachydactyly types A-E). This is the sense used here.
HP:0001156.definition_cn: 与手/足相比，指/趾显得不成比例地短。此处使用“短指畸形”一词来描述一系列不同的指/趾缩短模式（短指畸形类型A-E）。这是此处使用的含义。

HP:0001159.name: Syndactyly
HP:0001159.definition: Webbing or fusion of the fingers or toes, involving soft parts only or including bone structure. Bony fusions are referred to as \\
HP:0001159.definition_cn: 指（趾）蹼或指（趾）融合，仅涉及软组织或包括骨结构。骨性融合称为“骨性并指（趾）”。

HP:0001161.name: Hand polydactyly
HP:0001161.definition: A kind of polydactyly characterized by the presence of a supernumerary finger or fingers.
HP:0001161.definition_cn: 一种多指畸形，其特征为存在一个或多个额外手指。

HP:0001162.name: Postaxial hand polydactyly
HP:0001162.definition: Supernumerary digits located at the ulnar side of the hand (that is, on the side with the fifth finger).
HP:0001162.definition_cn: 位于手部尺侧（即小指侧）的多指畸形。

HP:0001163.name: obsolete Abnormality of the metacarpal bones

HP:0001166.name: Arachnodactyly
HP:0001166.definition: Abnormally long and slender fingers (spider fingers).

HP:0001169.name: Broad palm
HP:0001169.definition: For children from birth to 4 years of age the palm width is more than 2 SD above the mean; for children from 4 to 16 years of age the palm width is above the 95th centile; or, the width of the palm appears disproportionately wide for the length.
HP:0001169.definition_cn: 对于出生至4岁儿童，手掌宽度超过平均值2个标准差；对于4至16岁儿童，手掌宽度超过第95百分位数；或手掌宽度相对于长度显得不成比例地宽。

HP:0001171.name: Split hand
HP:0001171.definition: A condition in which middle parts of the hand (fingers and metacarpals) are missing giving a cleft appearance. The severity is very variable ranging from slightly hypoplastic middle fingers over absent middle fingers as far as oligo- or monodactyl hands.
HP:0001171.definition_cn: 一种表现为手部中间部分（手指和掌骨）缺失，呈现裂状外观的病症。其严重程度差异显著，范围从中指轻度发育不良到中指完全缺失，甚至出现少指或单指手畸形。

HP:0001172.name: Abnormal thumb morphology
HP:0001172.definition: An abnormal structure of the first digit of the hand.

HP:0001177.name: Preaxial hand polydactyly
HP:0001177.definition: Supernumerary digits located at the radial side of the hand. Polydactyly (supernumerary digits) involving the thumb occurs in many distinct forms of high variability and severity. Ranging from fleshy nubbins over varying degrees of partial duplication/splitting to completely duplicated or even triplicated thumbs or preaxial (on the radial side of the hand) supernumerary digits.
HP:0001177.definition_cn: 位于手部桡侧的多余指。涉及拇指的多指症（多余指）以多种不同的形式存在，其变异性和严重程度各异。表现形式从肉质小赘生物到不同程度的部分重复/分裂，直至完全重复甚至三重拇指或桡侧（手部桡侧）多余指。

HP:0001178.name: Ulnar claw
HP:0001178.definition: An abnormal hand position characterized by hyperextension of the fourth and fifth fingers at the metacarpophalangeal joints and flexion of the interphalangeal joints of the same fingers such that they are curled towards the palm.
HP:0001178.definition_cn: 一种异常手部姿势，表现为第四和第五指在掌指关节处过度伸展，同时同一手指的指间关节屈曲，使手指向手掌方向卷曲。

HP:0001180.name: obsolete Hand oligodactyly
HP:0001180.name_cn: 废弃术语：手部少指畸形

HP:0001181.name: Adducted thumb
HP:0001181.definition: In the resting position, the tip of the thumb is on, or near, the palm, close to the base of the fourth or fifth finger.
HP:0001181.definition_cn: 在静息位时，拇指尖端位于或接近手掌，靠近第四或第五指基底。

HP:0001182.name: Tapered finger
HP:0001182.definition: The gradual reduction in girth of the finger from proximal to distal.
HP:0001182.definition_cn: 手指周径从近端向远端逐渐减小。

HP:0001187.name: Hyperextensibility of the finger joints
HP:0001187.definition: The ability of the finger joints to move beyond their normal range of motion.
HP:0001187.definition_cn: 指关节活动度超过正常范围的能力。

HP:0001188.name: Hand clenching
HP:0001188.definition: An abnormal hand posture in which the hands are clenched to fists. All digits held completely flexed at the metacarpophalangeal and interphalangeal joints. In prenatal sonography of the fetal clenched hand, the index finger overlaps a clenched fist formed by the other digits. The proximal interphalangeal articulation of the index finger is flexed and ulnarly deviated, and the thumb is adducted.
HP:0001188.definition_cn: 异常手部姿势表现为手部紧握成拳。所有手指在掌指关节和指间关节处完全屈曲。在胎儿紧握手的产前超声检查中，食指重叠于其他手指形成的紧握拳上。食指的近端指间关节屈曲并向尺侧偏斜，拇指内收。

HP:0001191.name: Abnormal carpal morphology
HP:0001191.definition: An abnormality affecting the carpal bones of the wrist (scaphoid, lunate, triquetral, pisiform, trapezium, trapezoid, capitate, hamate).
HP:0001191.definition_cn: 影响腕部腕骨（舟骨、月骨、三角骨、豌豆骨、大多角骨、小多角骨、头状骨、钩骨）的异常。

HP:0001193.name: Ulnar deviation of the hand or of fingers of the hand

HP:0001194.name: Abnormalities of placenta or umbilical cord
HP:0001194.definition: An abnormality of the placenta (the organ that connects the developing fetus to the uterine wall) or of the umbilical cord (the cord that connects the fetus to the placenta).
HP:0001194.definition_cn: 胎盘（将发育中的胎儿连接到子宫壁的器官）或脐带（将胎儿连接到胎盘的索状结构）异常。

HP:0001195.name: Single umbilical artery
HP:0001195.definition: Single umbilical artery (SUA) is the absence of one of the two umbilical arteries surrounding the fetal bladder and in the fetal umbilical cord.
HP:0001195.definition_cn: 单脐动脉（Single Umbilical Artery, SUA）是指胎儿膀胱周围及胎儿脐带中两条脐动脉中缺失一条的病理状态。

HP:0001196.name: Short umbilical cord
HP:0001196.definition: Decreased length of the umbilical cord.

HP:0001197.name: Abnormality of prenatal development or birth
HP:0001197.definition: An abnormality of the fetus or the birth of the fetus, excluding structural abnormalities.
HP:0001197.name_cn: 产前发育异常或出生异常
HP:0001197.definition_cn: 胎儿异常或胎儿出生异常，不包括结构异常。

HP:0001199.name: Triphalangeal thumb
HP:0001199.definition: A thumb with three phalanges in a single, proximo-distal axis. Thus, this term applies if the thumb has an accessory phalanx, leading to a digit like appearance of the thumb.
HP:0001199.definition_cn: 具有三个指骨的单根近远轴拇指。因此，若拇指存在额外指骨，导致拇指呈现类似手指的外观，则适用此术语。

HP:0001204.name: Distal symphalangism of hands
HP:0001204.definition: The term distal symphalangism refers to a bony fusion of the distal and middle phalanges of the digits of the hand, in other words the distal interphalangeal joint (DIJ) is missing which can be seen either on x-rays or as an absence of the distal interphalangeal finger creases.
HP:0001204.name_cn: 手部远端指间关节融合症
HP:0001204.definition_cn: 远端指节融合症（Distal symphalangism）是指手部远端指骨与中节指骨之间的骨性融合，即远端指间关节（Distal Interphalangeal Joint, DIJ）缺失，这一现象可通过X射线检查观察到，或表现为远端指间关节皮肤皱褶的缺失。

HP:0001211.name: Abnormal fingertip morphology
HP:0001211.definition: An abnormal structure of the tip (end) of a finger.

HP:0001212.name: Prominent fingertip pads
HP:0001212.definition: A soft tissue prominence of the ventral aspects of the fingertips. The term \\
HP:0001212.definition_cn: 指尖腹侧软组织的突出。术语“\\

HP:0001215.name: Camptodactyly of 2nd-5th fingers
HP:0001215.definition: The distal interphalangeal joint and/or the proximal interphalangeal joint of the second to fifth fingers cannot be extended to 180 degrees by either active or passive extension.
HP:0001215.name_cn: 第二至第五指屈曲畸形
HP:0001215.definition_cn: 第二至第五指的远端指间关节和/或近端指间关节无法通过主动或被动伸展达到180度。

HP:0001216.name: Delayed ossification of carpal bones
HP:0001216.definition: Ossification of carpal bones occurs later than age-adjusted norms.
HP:0001216.definition_cn: 腕骨骨化晚于年龄调整标准。

HP:0001217.name: Clubbing
HP:0001217.definition: Broadening of the soft tissues (non-edematous swelling of soft tissues) of the digital tips in all dimensions associated with an increased longitudinal and lateral curvature of the nails.
HP:0001217.definition_cn: 指端软组织全方位增厚（非水肿性软组织肿胀），伴随指甲纵向及横向曲度增加。

HP:0001218.name: Autoamputation
HP:0001218.definition: Auto-amputation is the spontaneous detachment of an appendage from the body due to long standing pathology.
HP:0001218.definition_cn: 自体截肢是由于长期病理变化导致肢体自发性脱离身体的现象。

HP:0001220.name: Interphalangeal joint contracture of finger
HP:0001220.definition: Chronic loss of joint motion in an interphalangeal joint of a finger due to structural changes in non-bony tissue.
HP:0001220.definition_cn: 指间关节因非骨性组织结构改变导致的慢性关节运动丧失。

HP:0001223.name: Pointed proximal second through fifth metacarpals
HP:0001223.definition: All of the metacarpal bones of the hand have a pointed proximal appearance.
HP:0001223.name_cn: 近端尖锐的第二至第五掌骨
HP:0001223.definition_cn: 所有掌骨的近端均呈尖状外观。

HP:0001226.name: obsolete Acral ulceration and osteomyelitis leading to autoamputation of digits
HP:0001226.name_cn: 陈旧性肢端溃疡和骨髓炎导致指（趾）自截。

HP:0001227.name: Abnormality of the thenar eminence
HP:0001227.definition: An abnormality of the thenar eminence, i.e., of the muscle on the palm of the human hand just beneath the thumb.
HP:0001227.definition_cn: 鱼际隆起异常，即位于人类手掌拇指下方肌肉的异常。

HP:0001232.name: Nail bed telangiectasia
HP:0001232.definition: Telangiectases in the area of the nails.

HP:0001233.name: 2-3 finger cutaneous syndactyly
HP:0001233.definition: A soft tissue continuity in the anteroposterior axis between the second to the third fingers that extends distally to at least the level of the proximal interphalangeal joints.
HP:0001233.definition_cn: 第二至第三指间沿前后轴方向的软组织连续性，向远端延伸至少至近端指间关节水平。

HP:0001234.name: Hitchhiker thumb
HP:0001234.definition: With the hand relaxed and the thumb in the plane of the palm, the axis of the thumb forms an angle of at least 90 degrees with the long axis of the hand.
HP:0001234.definition_cn: 在手掌放松且拇指位于手掌平面时，拇指的轴线与手的长轴形成至少90度的角度。

HP:0001238.name: Slender finger
HP:0001238.definition: Fingers that are disproportionately narrow (reduced girth) for the hand/foot size or build of the individual.
HP:0001238.definition_cn: 手指相对于手/足尺寸或个体体型呈不成比例的狭窄（周径减小）。

HP:0001239.name: Wrist flexion contracture
HP:0001239.definition: A chronic loss of wrist joint motion due to structural changes in muscle, tendons, ligaments, or skin that prevent normal movement of the joints of the wrist.
HP:0001239.definition_cn: 由于肌肉、肌腱、韧带或皮肤的结构性改变导致腕关节正常运动受限，从而引起的慢性腕关节活动丧失。

HP:0001245.name: Small thenar eminence
HP:0001245.definition: Underdevelopment of the thenar eminence with reduced palmar soft tissue mass surrounding the base of the thumb.
HP:0001245.definition_cn: 鱼际肌发育不全伴拇指基底部掌侧软组织量减少。

HP:0001248.name: Short tubular bones of the hand
HP:0001248.definition: Decreased length of the tubular bones of the hand, that is, the phalanges and metacarpals.
HP:0001248.definition_cn: 手部管状骨长度缩短，即指骨和掌骨长度缩短。

HP:0001249.name: Intellectual disability
HP:0001249.definition: Intellectual disability, previously referred to as mental retardation, is characterized by subnormal intellectual functioning that occurs during the developmental period. It is defined by an IQ score below 70.
HP:0001249.definition_cn: 智力障碍，既往称为精神发育迟滞，其特征为发育期内出现的智力功能低于正常水平。其定义为智商（IQ）评分低于70。

HP:0001250.name: Seizure
HP:0001250.definition: A seizure is an intermittent abnormality of nervous system physiology characterized by a transient occurrence of signs and/or symptoms due to abnormal excessive or synchronous neuronal activity in the brain.
HP:0001250.definition_cn: 癫痫发作是一种神经系统生理功能的间歇性异常，其特征是由于大脑中神经元活动异常过度或同步化而导致的短暂性体征和/或症状的出现。

HP:0001251.name: Ataxia
HP:0001251.definition: Cerebellar ataxia refers to ataxia due to dysfunction of the cerebellum. This causes a variety of elementary neurological deficits including asynergy (lack of coordination between muscles, limbs and joints), dysmetria (lack of ability to judge distances that can lead to under- or overshoot in grasping movements), and dysdiadochokinesia (inability to perform rapid movements requiring antagonizing muscle groups to be switched on and off repeatedly).
HP:0001251.definition_cn: 小脑性共济失调是指由于小脑功能障碍引起的共济失调。这会导致多种基本神经功能缺陷，包括协同失调（肌肉、肢体和关节之间缺乏协调）、辨距不良（无法判断距离，可能导致抓握动作过近或过远）以及轮替运动障碍（无法执行需要拮抗肌群反复切换的快速动作）。

HP:0001252.name: Hypotonia
HP:0001252.definition: Hypotonia is an abnormally low muscle tone (the amount of tension or resistance to movement in a muscle). Even when relaxed, muscles have a continuous and passive partial contraction which provides some resistance to passive stretching. Hypotonia thus manifests as diminished resistance to passive stretching. Hypotonia is not the same as muscle weakness, although the two conditions can co-exist.
HP:0001252.definition_cn: 肌张力低下（Hypotonia）是指肌肉张力异常降低（即肌肉在运动时产生的张力或阻力减少）。即使在放松状态下，肌肉仍保持持续且被动的部分收缩，从而对被动拉伸产生一定的阻力。因此，肌张力低下表现为对被动拉伸的阻力减弱。肌张力低下与肌无力（Muscle Weakness）不同，尽管这两种情况可能同时存在。

HP:0001254.name: Lethargy
HP:0001254.definition: A state of fatigue, either physical or mental slowness and sluggishness, with difficulties in initiating or performing simple tasks. Distinguished from apathy which implies indifference and a lack of desire or interest in the task. A person with lethargy may have the desire, but not the energy to engage in personal or socially relevant tasks.
HP:0001254.definition_cn: 一种疲劳状态，表现为身体或精神上的迟缓与迟钝，难以启动或执行简单任务。与冷漠（apathy）相区别，后者指对任务漠不关心且缺乏欲望或兴趣。处于嗜睡（lethargy）状态的人可能有参与的欲望，但缺乏能量去从事个人或社会相关的任务。

HP:0001256.name: Intellectual disability, mild
HP:0001256.definition: Mild intellectual disability is defined as an intelligence quotient (IQ) in the range of 50-69.
HP:0001256.definition_cn: 轻度智力障碍定义为智商（IQ）在50至69之间。

HP:0001257.name: Spasticity
HP:0001257.definition: A motor disorder characterized by a velocity-dependent increase in tonic stretch reflexes with increased muscle tone, exaggerated (hyperexcitable) tendon reflexes.
HP:0001257.definition_cn: 一种运动障碍，其特征为速度依赖性张力性牵张反射增强，伴随肌张力增高，腱反射亢进（过度兴奋）。

HP:0001258.name: Spastic paraplegia
HP:0001258.definition: Spasticity and weakness of the leg and hip muscles.
HP:0001258.definition_cn: 下肢及髋部肌肉痉挛与肌力减弱。

HP:0001259.name: Coma
HP:0001259.definition: The complete absence of wakefulness and consciousness, which is evident through a lack of response to any form of external stimuli.
HP:0001259.definition_cn: 完全丧失觉醒和意识状态，表现为对任何形式的外部刺激均无反应。

HP:0001260.name: Dysarthria
HP:0001260.definition: Dysarthric speech is a general description referring to a neurological speech disorder characterized by poor articulation. Depending on the involved neurological structures, dysarthria may be further classified as spastic, flaccid, ataxic, hyperkinetic and hypokinetic, or mixed.
HP:0001260.definition_cn: 构音障碍是一种神经性言语障碍的总体描述，其特征为发音不清。根据受累的神经结构不同，构音障碍可进一步分为痉挛性、弛缓性、共济失调性、运动过度性、运动低下性或混合性构音障碍。

HP:0001262.name: Excessive daytime somnolence
HP:0001262.definition: A state of abnormally strong desire for sleep during the daytime.
HP:0001262.definition_cn: 日间过度嗜睡（Excessive Daytime Sleepiness, EDS）

HP:0001263.name: Global developmental delay
HP:0001263.definition: A delay in the achievement of motor or mental milestones in the domains of development of a child, including motor skills, speech and language, cognitive skills, and social and emotional skills. This term should only be used to describe children younger than five years of age.
HP:0001263.definition_cn: 儿童在发育领域（包括运动技能、言语和语言、认知技能以及社会和情感技能）中达到运动或心理里程碑的延迟。该术语仅应用于描述五岁以下的儿童。

HP:0001264.name: Spastic diplegia
HP:0001264.definition: Spasticity (neuromuscular hypertonia) primarily in the muscles of the legs, hips, and pelvis.
HP:0001264.definition_cn: 痉挛（神经肌肉张力过高）主要发生在腿部、髋部和骨盆的肌肉。

HP:0001265.name: Hyporeflexia
HP:0001265.definition: Reduction of neurologic reflexes such as the knee-jerk reaction.
HP:0001265.definition_cn: 神经反射减退，如膝跳反射减弱。

HP:0001266.name: Choreoathetosis
HP:0001266.definition: Involuntary movements characterized by both athetosis (inability to sustain muscles in a fixed position) and chorea (widespread jerky arrhythmic movements).
HP:0001266.definition_cn: 以手足徐动症（无法维持肌肉固定位置）和舞蹈症（广泛性不规则的节律性运动）为特征的不自主运动。

HP:0001268.name: Mental deterioration
HP:0001268.definition: Loss of previously present mental abilities, generally in adults.

HP:0001269.name: Hemiparesis
HP:0001269.definition: Loss of strength in the arm, leg, and sometimes face on one side of the body. Hemiplegia refers to a complete loss of strength, whereas hemiparesis refers to an incomplete loss of strength.
HP:0001269.definition_cn: 单侧上肢、下肢及有时面部肌力丧失。偏瘫（Hemiplegia）指肌力完全丧失，而轻偏瘫（Hemiparesis）指肌力部分丧失。

HP:0001270.name: Motor delay
HP:0001270.definition: A type of Developmental delay characterized by a delay in acquiring motor skills.
HP:0001270.definition_cn: 一种以运动技能获取延迟为特征的发育迟缓类型。

HP:0001271.name: Polyneuropathy
HP:0001271.definition: A generalized disorder of peripheral nerves.
HP:0001271.definition_cn: 周围神经的广泛性病变。

HP:0001272.name: Cerebellar atrophy
HP:0001272.definition: Cerebellar atrophy is defined as a cerebellum with initially normal structures, in a posterior fossa with normal size, which displays enlarged fissures (interfolial spaces) in comparison to the foliae secondary to loss of tissue. Cerebellar atrophy implies irreversible loss of tissue and result from an ongoing progressive disease until a final stage is reached or a single injury, e.g. an intoxication or infectious event.
HP:0001272.definition_cn: 小脑萎缩定义为在颅后窝大小正常的情况下，小脑初始结构正常，但由于组织丧失，与次级小叶相比，显示出增大的裂隙（叶间间隙）。小脑萎缩意味着组织的不可逆丧失，通常由持续进展性疾病直至终末期或单次损伤（如中毒或感染事件）引起。

HP:0001274.name: Agenesis of corpus callosum
HP:0001274.definition: Absence of the corpus callosum as a result of the failure of the corpus callosum to develop, which can be the result of a failure in any one of the multiple steps of callosal development including cellular proliferation and migration, axonal growth or glial patterning at the midline.
HP:0001274.definition_cn: 胼胝体缺失是由于胼胝体发育不全所致，其可能由胼胝体发育过程中任一环节的异常引起，包括细胞增殖与迁移、轴突生长或中线胶质模式形成等步骤的缺陷。

HP:0001276.name: Hypertonia
HP:0001276.definition: A condition in which there is increased muscle tone so that arms or legs, for example, are stiff and difficult to move.
HP:0001276.definition_cn: 肌张力增高（Hypertonia），表现为肢体（如手臂或腿部）僵硬且活动困难。

HP:0001278.name: Orthostatic hypotension
HP:0001278.definition: A form of hypotension characterized by a sudden fall in blood pressure that occurs when a person assumes a standing position.
HP:0001278.definition_cn: 一种以体位性低血压为特征的血压突然下降，发生在个体由卧位或坐位转为直立位时。

HP:0001279.name: Syncope
HP:0001279.definition: Syncope is a syndrome in which loss of consciousness is of relatively sudden onset, temporary (usually less than 1 to 2 minutes), self-terminating, and of usually rapid recovery. Syncope leads to a generalized weakness of muscles with loss of postural tone, inability to stand upright, and loss of consciousness. Once the patient is in a horizontal position, blood flow to the brain is no longer hindered by gravitation and consciousness is regained. Unconsciousness usually lasts for seconds to minutes. Headache and drowsiness (which usually follow seizures) do not follow a syncopal attack. Syncope results from a sudden impairment of brain metabolism usually due to a reduction in cerebral blood flow.
HP:0001279.definition_cn: 晕厥是一种综合征，其特征为意识丧失相对突然发作、短暂（通常少于1至2分钟）、可自行终止且通常迅速恢复。晕厥导致全身肌肉无力，伴姿势张力丧失，无法直立，并出现意识丧失。一旦患者处于水平位，脑部血流不再受重力阻碍，意识即可恢复。意识丧失通常持续数秒至数分钟。晕厥发作后通常不会出现头痛和嗜睡（这些症状常见于癫痫发作后）。晕厥通常是由于脑血流减少导致的脑代谢突然受损所致。

HP:0001281.name: Tetany
HP:0001281.definition: A condition characterized by intermittent involuntary contraction of muscles (spasms) related to hypocalcemia or occasionally magnesium deficiency.
HP:0001281.definition_cn: 一种以间歇性不自主肌肉收缩（痉挛）为特征的病症，与低钙血症或偶发的镁缺乏相关。

HP:0001283.name: Bulbar palsy
HP:0001283.definition: Bulbar weakness (or bulbar palsy) refers to bilateral impairment of function of the lower cranial nerves IX, X, XI and XII, which occurs due to lower motor neuron lesion either at nuclear or fascicular level in the medulla or from bilateral lesions of the lower cranial nerves outside the brain-stem. Bulbar weakness is often associated with difficulty in chewing, weakness of the facial muscles, dysarthria, palatal weakness and regurgitation of fluids, dysphagia, and dysphonia.
HP:0001283.definition_cn: 延髓性麻痹（或球麻痹）是指由于延髓内下运动神经元在核性或束性水平的病变，或脑干外双侧下位颅神经（IX、X、XI和XII）的病变，导致这些神经功能的双侧受损。延髓性麻痹常伴有咀嚼困难、面部肌肉无力、构音障碍、软腭无力及液体反流、吞咽困难和发音障碍等症状。

HP:0001284.name: Areflexia
HP:0001284.definition: Absence of neurologic reflexes such as the knee-jerk reaction.
HP:0001284.definition_cn: 神经反射缺失，如膝跳反射消失。

HP:0001285.name: Spastic tetraparesis
HP:0001285.definition: Spastic weakness affecting all four limbs.

HP:0001288.name: Gait disturbance
HP:0001288.definition: The term gait disturbance can refer to any disruption of the ability to walk.
HP:0001288.definition_cn: 步态障碍（Gait Disturbance）可指任何行走能力的异常或受损。

HP:0001289.name: Confusion
HP:0001289.definition: Lack of clarity and coherence of thought, perception, understanding, or action.
HP:0001289.definition_cn: 思维、感知、理解或行为缺乏清晰性和连贯性。

HP:0001290.name: Generalized hypotonia
HP:0001290.definition: Generalized muscular hypotonia (abnormally low muscle tone).
HP:0001290.definition_cn: 全身性肌张力减退（肌张力异常低下）。

HP:0001291.name: Abnormal cranial nerve morphology
HP:0001291.definition: Structural abnormality affecting one or more of the cranial nerves, which emerge directly from the brain stem.
HP:0001291.definition_cn: 影响一条或多条颅神经的结构异常，这些颅神经直接从脑干发出。

HP:0001297.name: Stroke
HP:0001297.definition: Sudden impairment of blood flow to a part of the brain due to occlusion or rupture of an artery to the brain.
HP:0001297.definition_cn: 急性脑动脉闭塞或破裂导致的脑部局部血流突然中断。

HP:0001298.name: Encephalopathy
HP:0001298.definition: Encephalopathy is a term that means brain disease, damage, or malfunction. In general, encephalopathy is manifested by an altered mental state.
HP:0001298.definition_cn: 脑病（Encephalopathy）是指脑部疾病、损伤或功能障碍的统称。通常，脑病表现为精神状态改变（Altered Mental State）。

HP:0001300.name: Parkinsonism
HP:0001300.definition: Characteristic neurologic anomaly resulting from degeneration of dopamine-generating cells in the substantia nigra, a region of the midbrain, characterized clinically by shaking, rigidity, slowness of movement and difficulty with walking and gait.
HP:0001300.definition_cn: 特征性神经异常，由中脑黑质区域多巴胺生成细胞的退化引起，临床表现为震颤、强直、运动迟缓以及步态和行走困难。

HP:0001301.name: Chronic sensorineural polyneuropathy
HP:0001301.name_cn: 慢性感觉神经性多发性神经病

HP:0001302.name: Pachygyria
HP:0001302.definition: Pachygyria is a malformation of cortical development with abnormally wide gyri with sulci 1,5-3 cm apart and abnormally thick cortex measuring more than 5 mm (radiological definition). See also neuropathological definitions for 2-, 3-, and 4-layered lissencephaly.
HP:0001302.definition_cn: 巨脑回畸形是一种皮质发育畸形，表现为脑回异常增宽，脑沟间距为1.5至3厘米，且皮质异常增厚，厚度超过5毫米（放射学定义）。另请参见2层、3层和4层无脑回畸形的神经病理学定义。

HP:0001304.name: Torsion dystonia
HP:0001304.definition: Sustained involuntary muscle contractions that produce twisting and repetitive movements of the body.
HP:0001304.definition_cn: 持续性不自主肌肉收缩导致身体出现扭转性和重复性运动。

HP:0001305.name: Dandy-Walker malformation
HP:0001305.definition: A congenital brain malformation typically characterized by incomplete formation of the cerebellar vermis, dilation of the fourth ventricle, and enlargement of the posterior fossa. In layman's terms, Dandy Walker malformation is a cyst in the cerebellum (typically symmetrical) that is involved with the fourth ventricle. This may interfere with the ability to drain cerebrospinal fluid from the brain, resulting in hydrocephalus. Dandy Walker cysts are formed during early embryonic development, while the brain forms. The cyst in the cerebellum typically has several blood vessels running through it connecting to the brain, thereby prohibiting surgical removal.
HP:0001305.definition_cn: 一种先天性脑发育畸形，通常表现为小脑蚓部发育不全、第四脑室扩张和后颅窝扩大。通俗地说，Dandy-Walker畸形是小脑（通常为对称性）中的一个囊肿，与第四脑室相连。这可能会干扰脑脊液从大脑排出的能力，导致脑积水。Dandy-Walker囊肿是在大脑形成的早期胚胎发育过程中形成的。小脑中的囊肿通常有几条血管穿过，与大脑相连，因此无法通过手术切除。

HP:0001308.name: Tongue fasciculations
HP:0001308.definition: Fasciculations or fibrillation affecting the tongue muscle.

HP:0001310.name: Dysmetria
HP:0001310.definition: A type of ataxia characterized by the inability to carry out movements with the correct range and motion across the plane of more than one joint related to incorrect estimation of the distances required for targeted movements.
HP:0001310.definition_cn: 一种共济失调类型，其特征是由于对目标运动所需距离的错误估计，导致无法在多个关节平面上以正确的幅度和运动执行动作。

HP:0001311.name: Abnormal nervous system electrophysiology
HP:0001311.definition: An abnormality of the function of the electrical signals with which nerve cells communicate with each other or with muscles as measured by electrophysiological investigations.
HP:0001311.definition_cn: 通过电生理学检查测量的神经细胞之间或神经细胞与肌肉之间电信号传导功能的异常。

HP:0001312.name: Giant somatosensory evoked potentials
HP:0001312.definition: An abnormal enlargement (i.e. increase in measured voltage) of somatosensory evoked potentials.
HP:0001312.definition_cn: 躯体感觉诱发电位的异常增大（即测量电压的增加）。

HP:0001315.name: Reduced tendon reflexes
HP:0001315.definition: Diminution of tendon reflexes, which is an invariable sign of peripheral nerve disease.
HP:0001315.definition_cn: 腱反射减弱，这是周围神经疾病的恒定体征。

HP:0001317.name: Abnormal cerebellum morphology
HP:0001317.definition: Any structural abnormality of the cerebellum.

HP:0001319.name: Neonatal hypotonia
HP:0001319.definition: Muscular hypotonia (abnormally low muscle tone) manifesting in the neonatal period.
HP:0001319.definition_cn: 新生儿期出现的肌张力低下（肌张力异常降低）。

HP:0001320.name: Cerebellar vermis hypoplasia
HP:0001320.definition: Underdevelopment of the vermis of cerebellum.

HP:0001321.name: Cerebellar hypoplasia
HP:0001321.definition: Cerebellar hypoplasia is a descriptive term implying a cerebellum with a reduced volume, but a normal shape and is stable over time.
HP:0001321.definition_cn: 小脑发育不全是一个描述性术语，意指小脑体积减小，但形态正常且随时间保持稳定。

HP:0001325.name: Hypoglycemic coma
HP:0001325.definition: Coma induced by low blood sugar.

HP:0001326.name: EEG with irregular generalized spike and wave complexes
HP:0001326.definition: EEG shows spikes (<80 ms) and waves, which are recorded over the entire scalp and do not have a specific frequency.
HP:0001326.name_cn: 脑电图显示不规则广泛性棘慢波复合波
HP:0001326.definition_cn: 脑电图显示棘波（<80毫秒）和慢波，这些波形在整个头皮上均有记录，且不具有特定频率。

HP:0001327.name: Photosensitive myoclonic seizure
HP:0001327.definition: Generalised myoclonic seizure provoked by flashing or flickering light.
HP:0001327.definition_cn: 由闪烁或闪光诱发的全身性肌阵挛性发作。

HP:0001328.name: Specific learning disability
HP:0001328.definition: Impairment of certain skills such as reading or writing, coordination, self-control, or attention that interfere with the ability to learn. The impairment is not related to a global deficiency of intelligence.
HP:0001328.definition_cn: 特定技能（如阅读、书写、协调能力、自我控制或注意力）的损害，这些损害干扰了学习能力。该损害与整体智力缺陷无关。

HP:0001331.name: Absent septum pellucidum
HP:0001331.definition: Absence of the septum pellucidum (meaning translucent wall in Latin - SP), also known as the ventricle of Sylvius. The septum pellucidum is a thin, triangular double membrane separating the frontal horns of the right and left lateral ventricles of the brain. It extends between the anterior portion of the corpus callosum, and the body of the fornix and its width varies from 1.5 to 3.0 mm.
HP:0001331.definition_cn: 透明隔缺失（拉丁语中意为“透明壁”，简称SP），也称为西尔维乌斯脑室。透明隔是一层薄而呈三角形的双层膜，分隔大脑左右侧脑室的前角。它延伸于胼胝体前部与穹窿体之间，其宽度在1.5至3.0毫米之间变化。

HP:0001332.name: Dystonia
HP:0001332.definition: An abnormally increased muscular tone that causes fixed abnormal postures. There is a slow, intermittent twisting motion that leads to exaggerated turning and posture of the extremities and trunk.
HP:0001332.definition_cn: 肌张力异常增高导致固定性异常姿势。表现为缓慢、间歇性扭转运动，导致四肢和躯干的过度扭转和姿势异常。

HP:0001334.name: Communicating hydrocephalus
HP:0001334.definition: A form of hydrocephalus in which there is no visible obstruction to the flow of the cerebrospinal fluid between the ventricles and subarachnoid space.
HP:0001334.definition_cn: 一种脑积水形式，其中脑室与蛛网膜下腔之间的脑脊液流动无明显梗阻。

HP:0001335.name: Bimanual synkinesia
HP:0001335.definition: Involuntary movements of one hand that accompany and mirror intentional movements of the opposite hand.
HP:0001335.definition_cn: 对侧手部意向性运动伴随的同侧手部不自主镜像运动。

HP:0001336.name: Myoclonus
HP:0001336.definition: Very brief, involuntary random muscular contractions occurring at rest, in response to sensory stimuli, or accompanying voluntary movements.
HP:0001336.definition_cn: 短暂、不自主、随机的肌肉收缩，可发生于静息状态、对感觉刺激的反应或伴随自主运动。

HP:0001337.name: Tremor
HP:0001337.definition: An unintentional, oscillating to-and-fro muscle movement about a joint axis.
HP:0001337.definition_cn: 一种无意识的、围绕关节轴线的来回摆动性肌肉运动。

HP:0001338.name: Partial agenesis of the corpus callosum
HP:0001338.definition: A partial failure of the development of the corpus callosum.

HP:0001339.name: Lissencephaly
HP:0001339.definition: A spectrum of malformations of cortical development caused by insufficient neuronal migration that subsumes the terms agyria, pachygyria and subcortical band heterotopia. See also neuropathological definitions for 2-, 3-, and 4-layered lissencephaly.
HP:0001339.definition_cn: 由神经元迁移不足引起的皮质发育畸形谱系，包括无脑回畸形、巨脑回畸形和皮质下带状异位。另见2层、3层和4层无脑回畸形的神经病理学定义。

HP:0001340.name: Enhancement of the C-reflex
HP:0001340.definition: Increase in amplitude of a long-loop response upon somatosensory evoked potential testing, representing an electrically evoked myoclonic response.
HP:0001340.definition_cn: 体感诱发电位测试中长环路反应振幅增加，表现为电诱发肌阵挛反应。

HP:0001342.name: Cerebral hemorrhage
HP:0001342.definition: Hemorrhage into the parenchyma of the brain.

HP:0001343.name: Kernicterus
HP:0001343.definition: Damage to cerebral nuclei caused in infants by highly increased levels of unconjugated bilirubin. The basal ganglia and brainstem nuclei could be shown to have a yellow staining historically in infants who died of kernicterus, that is, kernicterus is strictly speaking a pathological diagnosis. The presence of kernicterus may be inferred in infants with characteristic acute or chronic bilirubin-induced neurological dysfunction.
HP:0001343.definition_cn: 婴儿因未结合胆红素水平显著升高导致的脑核损伤。历史上，死于核黄疸的婴儿的基底节和脑干核团可显示黄色染色，即严格来说，核黄疸是一种病理学诊断。在具有特征性急性或慢性胆红素诱导的神经功能障碍的婴儿中，可推断核黄疸的存在。

HP:0001344.name: Absent speech
HP:0001344.definition: Complete lack of development of speech and language abilities.
HP:0001344.definition_cn: 完全性言语和语言能力发育缺失。

HP:0001345.name: Psychotic mentation
HP:0001345.definition: A pattern of thinking and perceiving characterized by a loss of contact with reality, leading to significant changes in thoughts, perceptions, and behaviors.
HP:0001345.definition_cn: 一种以与现实脱节为特征的思维和感知模式，导致思维、感知和行为的显著改变。

HP:0001347.name: Hyperreflexia
HP:0001347.definition: Hyperreflexia is the presence of hyperactive stretch reflexes of the muscles.
HP:0001347.definition_cn: 反射亢进是指肌肉牵张反射过度活跃的现象。

HP:0001348.name: Brisk reflexes
HP:0001348.definition: Tendon reflexes that are noticeably more active than usual (conventionally denoted 3+ on clinical examination). Brisk reflexes may or may not indicate a neurological lesion. They are distinguished from hyperreflexia by the fact that hyerreflexia is characterized by hyperactive repeating (clonic) reflexes, which are considered to be always abnormal.
HP:0001348.definition_cn: 腱反射明显较正常活跃（临床检查中通常标记为3+）。活跃的腱反射可能提示也可能不提示神经系统病变。它们与反射亢进相区别，反射亢进的特征是过度活跃的重复性（阵挛性）反射，这通常被认为是异常表现。

HP:0001349.name: Facial diplegia
HP:0001349.definition: Facial diplegia refers to bilateral facial palsy (bilateral facial palsy is much rarer than unilateral facial palsy).
HP:0001349.definition_cn: 面部双瘫是指双侧面部麻痹（双侧面部麻痹比单侧面部麻痹罕见得多）。

HP:0001350.name: Slurred speech
HP:0001350.definition: Abnormal coordination of muscles involved in speech.

HP:0001351.name: Jerk-locked premyoclonus spikes
HP:0001351.definition: Jerk-locked averaging (JLA) is used to record the timing and distribution of brain activity preceding brisk involuntary movements such as those observed in patients with myoclonus. JLA is capable of revealing a premyoclonus spike in the absence of paroxysmal activity in the routine EEG.
HP:0001351.name_cn: 抽动锁定的肌阵挛前棘波
HP:0001351.definition_cn: 急动锁定平均（Jerk-locked averaging, JLA）用于记录在快速不自主运动（如肌阵挛患者中观察到的运动）之前脑活动的时间和分布。JLA能够在常规脑电图（EEG）中未出现阵发性活动的情况下，揭示肌阵挛前棘波（premyoclonus spike）。

HP:0001355.name: Megalencephaly
HP:0001355.definition: Diffuse enlargement of the entire cerebral hemispheres leading to macrocephaly (with or without overlying cortical dysplasia).
HP:0001355.definition_cn: 全脑半球弥漫性增大导致巨脑畸形（伴或不伴表面皮质发育不良）。

HP:0001357.name: Plagiocephaly
HP:0001357.definition: Asymmetric head shape, which is usually a combination of unilateral occipital flattening with ipsilateral frontal prominence, leading to rhomboid cranial shape.
HP:0001357.definition_cn: 头部形状不对称，通常表现为单侧枕部扁平合并同侧额部突出，导致颅骨呈菱形形态。

HP:0001360.name: Holoprosencephaly
HP:0001360.definition: Holoprosencephaly is a structural anomaly of the brain in which the developing forebrain fails to divide into two separate hemispheres and ventricles.
HP:0001360.definition_cn: 前脑无裂畸形是一种大脑结构异常，表现为发育中的前脑未能分裂为两个独立的半球和脑室。

HP:0001361.name: Nystagmus-induced head nodding
HP:0001361.definition: Head movements associated with nystagmus, that may represent an attempt to compensate for the involuntary eye movements and to improve vision.
HP:0001361.definition_cn: 与眼球震颤相关的头部运动，可能代表一种试图代偿不自主眼球运动并改善视力的行为。

HP:0001362.name: Calvarial skull defect
HP:0001362.definition: A localized defect in the bone of the skull resulting from abnormal embryological development. The defect is covered by normal skin. In some cases, skull x-rays have shown underlying lytic bone lesions which have closed before the age of one year.
HP:0001362.definition_cn: 颅骨局部缺损，由胚胎发育异常所致。缺损部位被正常皮肤覆盖。在某些病例中，颅骨X线检查显示其下方的溶骨性病变在1岁前已自行闭合。

HP:0001363.name: Craniosynostosis
HP:0001363.definition: Craniosynostosis refers to the premature closure of the cranial sutures. Primary craniosynostosis refers to the closure of one or more sutures due to abnormalities in skull development, and secondary craniosynostosis results from failure of brain growth.
HP:0001363.definition_cn: 颅缝早闭（Craniosynostosis）是指颅骨缝的过早闭合。原发性颅缝早闭（Primary craniosynostosis）是指由于颅骨发育异常导致的一条或多条颅缝闭合，而继发性颅缝早闭（Secondary craniosynostosis）则是由于脑部生长障碍所致。

HP:0001367.name: Abnormal joint morphology
HP:0001367.definition: An abnormal structure or form of the joints, i.e., one or more of the articulations where two bones join.
HP:0001367.definition_cn: 关节结构或形态异常，即一处或多处骨连接处的关节异常。

HP:0001370.name: Rheumatoid arthritis
HP:0001370.definition: Inflammatory changes in the synovial membranes and articular structures with widespread fibrinoid degeneration of the collagen fibers in mesenchymal tissues, as well as atrophy and rarefaction of bony structures.
HP:0001370.definition_cn: 滑膜及关节结构中的炎性改变，伴随间充质组织中胶原纤维的广泛纤维蛋白样变性，以及骨结构的萎缩和稀疏。

HP:0001371.name: Flexion contracture
HP:0001371.definition: A flexion contracture is a bent (flexed) joint that cannot be straightened actively or passively. It is thus a chronic loss of joint motion due to structural changes in muscle, tendons, ligaments, or skin that prevents normal movement of joints.
HP:0001371.definition_cn: 屈曲挛缩是一种关节弯曲（屈曲）状态，无法主动或被动伸直。因此，这是由于肌肉、肌腱、韧带或皮肤的结构性改变导致的关节运动慢性丧失，从而阻碍了关节的正常活动。

HP:0001376.name: Limitation of joint mobility
HP:0001376.definition: A reduction in the freedom of movement of one or more joints.

HP:0001377.name: Limited elbow extension
HP:0001377.definition: Limited ability to straighten the arm at the elbow joint.

HP:0001382.name: Joint hypermobility
HP:0001382.definition: The capability that a joint (or a group of joints) has to move, passively and/or actively, beyond normal limits along physiological axes.
HP:0001382.definition_cn: 关节（或一组关节）在生理轴上被动和/或主动地超越正常范围的运动能力。

HP:0001384.name: Abnormal hip joint morphology
HP:0001384.definition: An abnormality of the hip joint.

HP:0001385.name: Hip dysplasia
HP:0001385.definition: The presence of developmental dysplasia of the hip.
HP:0001385.definition_cn: 髋关节发育不良的存在。

HP:0001387.name: Joint stiffness
HP:0001387.definition: Joint stiffness is a perceived sensation of tightness in a joint or joints when attempting to move them after a period of inactivity. Joint stiffness typically subsides over time.
HP:0001387.definition_cn: 关节僵硬是指在长时间不活动后尝试移动关节时，感受到的关节或关节群紧绷感。关节僵硬通常会随着时间的推移逐渐缓解。

HP:0001394.name: Cirrhosis
HP:0001394.definition: A chronic disorder of the liver in which liver tissue becomes scarred and is partially replaced by regenerative nodules and fibrotic tissue resulting in loss of liver function.
HP:0001394.definition_cn: 慢性肝病，其中肝组织发生纤维化，部分被再生结节和纤维组织取代，导致肝功能丧失。

HP:0001395.name: Hepatic fibrosis
HP:0001395.definition: The presence of excessive fibrous connective tissue in the liver. Fibrosis is a reparative or reactive process.
HP:0001395.definition_cn: 肝脏中纤维结缔组织过度增生。纤维化是一种修复性或反应性病理过程。

HP:0001396.name: Cholestasis
HP:0001396.definition: Impairment of bile flow due to obstruction in bile ducts.
HP:0001396.definition_cn: 胆道梗阻导致的胆汁流动障碍。

HP:0001397.name: Hepatic steatosis
HP:0001397.definition: Steatosis is a term used to denote lipid accumulation within hepatocytes.
HP:0001397.definition_cn: 脂肪变性是指肝细胞内脂质积聚的医学术语。

HP:0001400.name: obsolete Hepatic abscesses due to immunodeficiency
HP:0001400.name_cn: 免疫缺陷导致的陈旧性肝脓肿

HP:0001402.name: Hepatocellular carcinoma
HP:0001402.definition: A kind of neoplasm of the liver that originates in hepatocytes and presents macroscopically as a soft and hemorrhagic tan mass in the liver.
HP:0001402.definition_cn: 一种起源于肝细胞的肝脏肿瘤，宏观表现为肝脏内柔软且出血性的棕褐色肿块。

HP:0001403.name: Macrovesicular hepatic steatosis
HP:0001403.definition: A form of hepatic steatosis characterized by the presence of large, lipid-laden vesicles in the affected hepatocytes.
HP:0001403.definition_cn: 一种肝脂肪变性形式，其特征为受累肝细胞内存在大量脂质充盈的大泡。

HP:0001405.name: Periportal fibrosis
HP:0001405.definition: The presence of fibrosis affecting the interlobular stroma of liver.

HP:0001406.name: Intrahepatic cholestasis
HP:0001406.definition: Impairment of bile flow due to obstruction in the small bile ducts within the liver.
HP:0001406.definition_cn: 肝内小胆管梗阻导致的胆汁流动障碍。

HP:0001408.name: Bile duct proliferation
HP:0001408.definition: Proliferative changes of the bile ducts.

HP:0001409.name: Portal hypertension
HP:0001409.definition: Increased pressure in the portal vein.

HP:0001410.name: Decreased liver function
HP:0001410.definition: Reduced ability of the liver to perform its functions.

HP:0001412.name: Enteroviral hepatitis
HP:0001412.definition: Inflammation of the liver due to infection with enterovirus.
HP:0001412.definition_cn: 肠道病毒感染引起的肝炎。

HP:0001413.name: Micronodular cirrhosis
HP:0001413.definition: A type of cirrhosis characterized by the presence of small regenerative nodules.
HP:0001413.definition_cn: 一种以存在小结节性再生为特征的肝硬化类型。

HP:0001414.name: Microvesicular hepatic steatosis
HP:0001414.definition: A form of hepatic steatosis characterized by the presence of small, lipid-laden vesicles in the affected hepatocytes.
HP:0001414.definition_cn: 一种以受累肝细胞内存在小型脂质囊泡为特征的肝脂肪变性形式。

HP:0001417.name: X-linked inheritance
HP:0001417.definition: A mode of inheritance that is observed for traits related to a gene encoded on the X chromosome.
HP:0001417.definition_cn: 一种与X染色体上编码基因相关的性状所观察到的遗传模式。

HP:0001419.name: X-linked recessive inheritance
HP:0001419.definition: A mode of inheritance that is observed for recessive traits related to a gene encoded on the X chromosome. In the context of medical genetics, X-linked recessive disorders manifest in males (who have one copy of the X chromosome and are thus hemizygotes), but generally not in female heterozygotes who have one mutant and one normal allele.
HP:0001419.definition_cn: 一种与X染色体上编码基因相关的隐性性状的遗传模式。在医学遗传学背景下，X连锁隐性遗传病在男性中表现（男性具有一条X染色体，因此为半合子），而在具有一个突变等位基因和一个正常等位基因的女性杂合子中通常不表现。

HP:0001421.name: Abnormality of the musculature of the hand

HP:0001423.name: X-linked dominant inheritance
HP:0001423.definition: A mode of inheritance that is observed for dominant traits related to a gene encoded on the X chromosome. In the context of medical genetics, X-linked dominant disorders tend to manifest very severely in affected males. The severity of manifestation in females may depend on the degree of skewed X inactivation.
HP:0001423.definition_cn: 一种与X染色体上编码基因相关的显性性状的遗传模式。在医学遗传学背景下，X连锁显性遗传病在受累男性中往往表现非常严重。女性中的表现严重程度可能取决于X染色体失活偏斜的程度。

HP:0001426.name: Non-Mendelian inheritance
HP:0001426.definition: A mode of inheritance that depends on genetic determinants in more than one gene.

HP:0001427.name: Mitochondrial inheritance
HP:0001427.definition: A mode of inheritance that is observed for traits related to a gene encoded on the mitochondrial genome. Because the mitochondrial genome is essentially always maternally inherited, a mitochondrial condition can only be transmitted by females, although the condition can affect both sexes. The proportion of mutant mitochondria can vary (heteroplasmy).
HP:0001427.definition_cn: 一种与线粒体基因组编码基因相关的性状所观察到的遗传模式。由于线粒体基因组本质上总是母系遗传，因此线粒体疾病只能由女性传递，尽管该疾病可影响两性。突变线粒体的比例可能有所不同（异质性）。

HP:0001433.name: Hepatosplenomegaly
HP:0001433.definition: Simultaneous enlargement of the liver and spleen.

HP:0001435.name: Abnormality of the shoulder girdle musculature

HP:0001436.name: Abnormality of the foot musculature
HP:0001436.definition: An anomaly of the musculature of foot.

HP:0001437.name: Abnormality of the musculature of the lower limbs

HP:0001438.name: Abnormal abdomen morphology
HP:0001438.definition: A structural abnormality of the abdomen ('belly'), that is, the part of the body between the pelvis and the thorax.
HP:0001438.definition_cn: 腹部的结构异常，即位于骨盆与胸腔之间的身体部分。

HP:0001442.name: Typified by somatic mosaicism
HP:0001442.definition: Description of conditions in which affected individuals typically display somatic mosaicism, i.e., genetically distinct populations of somatic cells in a given organism caused by DNA mutations, epigenetic alterations of DNA, chromosomal abnormalities or the spontaneous reversion of inherited mutations. In many conditions typified by somatic mosaicism, constitutive mutation is lethal and cases are exclusively or predominantly mosaic.
HP:0001442.definition_cn: 描述受影响个体通常表现出体细胞嵌合现象的情况，即由于DNA突变、DNA表观遗传改变、染色体异常或遗传突变的自发逆转，导致特定生物体内存在遗传学上不同的体细胞群。在许多以体细胞嵌合为特征的疾病中，构成性突变是致命的，因此病例完全或主要为嵌合体。

HP:0001444.name: obsolete Autosomal dominant somatic cell mutation
HP:0001444.name_cn: 过时的常染色体显性体细胞突变

HP:0001446.name: Abnormality of the musculature of the upper limbs

HP:0001450.name: Y-linked inheritance
HP:0001450.definition: A mode of inheritance that is observed for traits related to a gene encoded on the Y chromosome.
HP:0001450.definition_cn: 一种与Y染色体编码基因相关的性状所观察到的遗传模式。

HP:0001452.name: obsolete Autosomal dominant contiguous gene syndrome
HP:0001452.name_cn: 过时的常染色体显性连续基因综合征

HP:0001457.name: Abnormality of the musculature of the upper arm

HP:0001459.name: 1-3 toe syndactyly
HP:0001459.definition: Syndactyly with fusion of toes one to three.
HP:0001459.definition_cn: 并趾畸形伴第一至第三趾融合。

HP:0001460.name: Aplasia/Hypoplasia involving the skeletal musculature
HP:0001460.definition: Absence or underdevelopment of the musculature.
HP:0001460.name_cn: 骨骼肌发育不全/骨骼肌发育不良

HP:0001464.name: Aplasia/Hypoplasia involving the shoulder musculature
HP:0001464.definition: Absence or underdevelopment of the muscles of the shoulder.
HP:0001464.name_cn: 肩部肌肉发育不全/发育不良
HP:0001464.definition_cn: 肩部肌肉缺失或发育不全。

HP:0001466.name: Contiguous gene syndrome
HP:0001466.definition: A syndrome caused by the effects of abnormality (typically a deletion or duplication) of 2 or more adjacent genes
HP:0001466.definition_cn: 由两个或更多相邻基因异常（通常为缺失或重复）效应引起的综合征

HP:0001467.name: Aplasia/Hypoplasia involving the musculature of the upper limbs
HP:0001467.definition: Absence or underdevelopment of the musculature of the upper limbs.
HP:0001467.name_cn: 上肢肌肉组织发育不全/发育不良
HP:0001467.definition_cn: 上肢肌肉缺失或发育不全。

HP:0001468.name: Aplasia/Hypoplasia involving the musculature of the upper arm
HP:0001468.definition: Absence or underdevelopment of the muscles of the upper arm.
HP:0001468.name_cn: 上臂肌肉组织发育不全/发育不良
HP:0001468.definition_cn: 肱二头肌缺失或发育不全。

HP:0001469.name: Abnormal morphology of the pelvis musculature
HP:0001469.name_cn: 骨盆肌肉组织形态异常

HP:0001470.name: Sex-limited expression
HP:0001470.definition: Sex limitation is used to refer to a monogenic trait linked to an autosomal locus in which the phenotypic effects of allelic differences are expressed only in one sex.
HP:0001470.definition_cn: 性别限制是指与常染色体位点相关的单基因性状，其中等位基因差异的表型效应仅在一种性别中表达。

HP:0001471.name: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the musculature of the pelvis
HP:0001471.name_cn: 骨盆肌肉发育不全/发育不良

HP:0001474.name: Sclerotic scapulae
HP:0001474.definition: Increased density of the bony tissue of the scapula.
HP:0001474.definition_cn: 肩胛骨骨组织密度增加。

HP:0001475.name: Male-limited expression
HP:0001475.definition: Used to refer to a monogenic trait linked to an autosomal locus in which the phenotypic effects of allelic differences are expressed only in the male sex.
HP:0001475.definition_cn: 用于指代与常染色体基因座相关的单基因性状，其中等位基因差异的表型效应仅在男性中表达。

HP:0001476.name: Delayed closure of the anterior fontanelle
HP:0001476.definition: A delay in closure (ossification) of the anterior fontanelle, which generally undergoes closure around the 18th month of life.
HP:0001476.definition_cn: 前囟闭合（骨化）延迟，通常在前囟于生后第18个月左右闭合。

HP:0001477.name: Compensatory chin elevation
HP:0001477.definition: A tendency to hold the chin elevated by about 20 to 30 degrees to compensate for a limitation of eye movement.
HP:0001477.definition_cn: 为代偿眼球运动受限而倾向于将下颌抬高约20至30度的姿势。

HP:0001480.name: Freckling
HP:0001480.definition: The presence of an increased number of freckles, small circular spots on the skin that are darker than the surrounding skin because of deposits of melanin.
HP:0001480.definition_cn: 皮肤上出现数量增多的雀斑，即由于黑色素沉积而形成的比周围皮肤颜色更深的小圆形斑点。

HP:0001482.name: Subcutaneous nodule
HP:0001482.definition: Slightly elevated lesions on or in the skin with a diameter of over 5 mm.
HP:0001482.definition_cn: 皮肤表面或内部直径超过5毫米的轻微隆起性病变。

HP:0001483.name: Eye poking
HP:0001483.definition: Repetitive pressing, poking, and/or rubbing in the eyes.
HP:0001483.definition_cn: 反复性眼睑按压、戳刺和/或揉搓。

HP:0001487.name: obsolete Hypopigmented fundi
HP:0001487.name_cn: 陈旧性视网膜色素减退

HP:0001489.name: Posterior vitreous detachment
HP:0001489.definition: Separation of the vitreous humor from the retina.

HP:0001491.name: Congenital fibrosis of extraocular muscles
HP:0001491.definition: Congenital non-progressive ophthalmoplegia with multiple extraocular muscle restrictions. Typically, there is ptosis and variable degrees of restriction of horizontal and vertical eye movements.
HP:0001491.definition_cn: 先天性非进行性眼肌麻痹伴多发性眼外肌受限。通常表现为上睑下垂以及水平和垂直眼球运动不同程度受限。

HP:0001492.name: Axenfeld anomaly
HP:0001492.definition: Axenfeld's anomaly is a bilateral disorder characterized by a prominent, anteriorly displaced Schwalbe's line (posterior embryotoxon) and peripheral iris strands which span the anterior chamber angle to attach to Schwalbe's line.
HP:0001492.definition_cn: Axenfeld异常是一种双侧性病变，其特征为显著的、前移的Schwalbe线（后胚胎环）以及跨越前房角并附着于Schwalbe线的周边虹膜条索。

HP:0001493.name: Falciform retinal fold
HP:0001493.definition: An area of the retina that is buckled so that a sector-shaped sheet of retina lies in front of the normal retina. This feature is of congenital onset.
HP:0001493.definition_cn: 视网膜扇形皱襞，即视网膜局部皱褶，导致扇形视网膜片层位于正常视网膜前方。此特征为先天性发病。

HP:0001498.name: Carpal bone hypoplasia
HP:0001498.definition: Underdevelopment of one or more carpal bones.

HP:0001500.name: Broad finger
HP:0001500.definition: Increased width of a non-thumb digit of the hand.
HP:0001500.definition_cn: 手指非拇指指节宽度增加。

HP:0001508.name: Failure to thrive
HP:0001508.definition: Failure to thrive (FTT) refers to a child whose physical growth is substantially below the norm.
HP:0001508.definition_cn: 发育迟缓（Failure to Thrive, FTT）是指儿童体格发育显著低于正常标准。

HP:0001510.name: Growth delay
HP:0001510.definition: A deficiency or slowing down of growth pre- and postnatally.
HP:0001510.definition_cn: 产前和产后生长迟缓或生长缺陷。

HP:0001511.name: Intrauterine growth retardation
HP:0001511.definition: An abnormal restriction of fetal growth with fetal weight below the tenth percentile for gestational age.
HP:0001511.definition_cn: 胎儿生长受限（Fetal Growth Restriction, FGR），胎儿体重低于同孕龄第十百分位数。

HP:0001513.name: Obesity
HP:0001513.definition: Accumulation of substantial excess body fat.

HP:0001518.name: Small for gestational age
HP:0001518.definition: Smaller than normal size according to sex and gestational age related norms, defined as a weight below the 10th percentile for the gestational age.
HP:0001518.definition_cn: 根据性别和孕龄相关标准，小于正常大小，定义为体重低于孕龄的第10百分位数。

HP:0001519.name: Disproportionate tall stature
HP:0001519.definition: A tall and slim body build with increased arm span to height ratio (>1.05) and a reduced upper-to-lower segment ratio (<0.85), i.e., unusually long arms and legs. The extremities as well as the hands and feet are unusually slim.
HP:0001519.definition_cn: 身材高瘦，臂展与身高比例增加（>1.05），上段与下段比例降低（<0.85），即四肢异常延长。四肢及手足异常纤细。

HP:0001520.name: Large for gestational age
HP:0001520.definition: The term large for gestational age applies to babies whose birth weight lies above the 90th percentile for that gestational age.
HP:0001520.definition_cn: 术语“大于胎龄儿”适用于出生体重位于该胎龄第90百分位数以上的婴儿。

HP:0001522.name: Death in infancy
HP:0001522.definition: Death within the first 24 months of life.
HP:0001522.definition_cn: 生命最初24个月内的死亡。

HP:0001528.name: Hemihypertrophy
HP:0001528.definition: Overgrowth of only one side of the body.

HP:0001530.name: Mild postnatal growth retardation
HP:0001530.definition: A mild degree of slow or limited growth after birth, being between two and three standard deviations below age- and sex-related norms.
HP:0001530.definition_cn: 出生后生长速度轻度缓慢或受限，低于年龄和性别相关标准的2至3个标准差。

HP:0001533.name: Slender build
HP:0001533.definition: Asthenic habitus refers to a slender build with long limbs, an angular profile, and prominent muscles or bones.
HP:0001533.definition_cn: 虚弱体质（Asthenic habitus）是指体型纤细、四肢修长、轮廓棱角分明以及肌肉或骨骼突出的体格特征。

HP:0001537.name: Umbilical hernia
HP:0001537.definition: Protrusion of abdominal contents through a defect in the abdominal wall musculature around the umbilicus. Skin and subcutaneous tissue overlie the defect.
HP:0001537.definition_cn: 脐部腹壁肌层缺损导致腹腔内容物突出。缺损表面覆盖有皮肤及皮下组织。

HP:0001538.name: Protuberant abdomen
HP:0001538.definition: A thrusting or bulging out of the abdomen.

HP:0001539.name: Omphalocele
HP:0001539.definition: A midline anterior incomplete closure of the abdominal wall in which there is herniation of the abdominal viscera into the base of the abdominal cord.
HP:0001539.definition_cn: 腹壁中线前部不完全闭合，导致腹腔内脏器疝入脐带基底部。

HP:0001540.name: Diastasis recti
HP:0001540.definition: A separation of the rectus abdominis muscle into right and left halves (which are normally joined at the midline at the linea alba).
HP:0001540.definition_cn: 腹直肌分离，即腹直肌在正中线（白线）处分为左右两半（正常情况下在正中线处相连）。

HP:0001541.name: Ascites
HP:0001541.definition: Accumulation of fluid in the peritoneal cavity (between the layers of the peritoneum that lines the abdomen).
HP:0001541.definition_cn: 腹腔积液（腹膜层之间的液体积聚，腹膜是覆盖腹部的膜层）。

HP:0001543.name: Gastroschisis
HP:0001543.definition: A type of congenital ventral incomplete closure of the abdominal wall in which the intestines and sometimes other organs extend freely into the amniotic fluid space through a small opening in the abdomen, usually to the right of the umbilicus.
HP:0001543.definition_cn: 一种先天性腹壁不完全闭合的畸形，其中肠道有时还包括其他器官通过腹部的一个小开口（通常位于脐带右侧）自由延伸至羊膜腔。

HP:0001547.name: Abnormal rib cage morphology
HP:0001547.definition: A morphological anomaly of the rib cage.

HP:0001548.name: Overgrowth
HP:0001548.definition: Excessive postnatal growth which may comprise increased weight, increased length, and/or increased head circumference.
HP:0001548.definition_cn: 产后过度生长，可能包括体重增加、身长增加和/或头围增加。

HP:0001551.name: Abnormal umbilicus morphology
HP:0001551.definition: An abnormality of the structure or appearance of the umbilicus.

HP:0001552.name: Barrel-shaped chest
HP:0001552.definition: A rounded, bulging chest that resembles the shape of a barrel. That is, there is an increased anteroposterior diameter and usually some degree of kyphosis.
HP:0001552.definition_cn: 桶状胸。即胸廓前后径增大，通常伴有不同程度的脊柱后凸。

HP:0001555.name: Asymmetry of the thorax
HP:0001555.definition: Lack of symmetry between the left and right halves of the thorax.

HP:0001558.name: Decreased fetal movement
HP:0001558.definition: An abnormal reduction in quantity or strength of fetal movements.
HP:0001558.definition_cn: 胎儿运动数量或强度异常减少。

HP:0001560.name: Abnormality of the amniotic fluid
HP:0001560.definition: Abnormality of the amniotic fluid, which is the fluid contained in the amniotic sac surrounding the developing fetus.
HP:0001560.definition_cn: 羊水异常，即围绕发育中胎儿的羊膜囊内所含液体的异常。

HP:0001561.name: Polyhydramnios
HP:0001561.definition: The presence of excess amniotic fluid in the uterus during pregnancy.
HP:0001561.definition_cn: 妊娠期子宫内羊水过多。

HP:0001562.name: Oligohydramnios
HP:0001562.definition: Diminished amniotic fluid volume in pregnancy.

HP:0001563.name: Fetal polyuria
HP:0001563.definition: Abnormally increased production of urine by the fetus resulting in polyhydramnios.
HP:0001563.definition_cn: 胎儿尿液生成异常增多导致羊水过多。

HP:0001566.name: Widely-spaced maxillary central incisors
HP:0001566.definition: Increased distance between the maxillary central permanent incisor tooth.
HP:0001566.definition_cn: 上颌中切恒牙间距增宽。

HP:0001571.name: Multiple impacted teeth
HP:0001571.definition: The presence of multiple impacted teeth.

HP:0001572.name: Macrodontia
HP:0001572.definition: Increased size of the teeth, which can be defined as a mesiodistal tooth diameter (width) more than 2 SD above mean for age. Alternatively, an apparently increased maximum width of the tooth.
HP:0001572.definition_cn: 牙齿增大，可定义为牙齿近远中径（宽度）超过同年龄组平均值2个标准差以上。或者，牙齿最大宽度明显增加。

HP:0001574.name: Abnormality of the integument
HP:0001574.definition: An abnormality of the integument, which consists of the skin and the superficial fascia.

HP:0001579.name: Primary hypercortisolism
HP:0001579.definition: Hypercortisolemia associated with a primary defect of the adrenal gland leading to overproduction of cortisol.
HP:0001579.definition_cn: 与肾上腺原发性缺陷相关的皮质醇增多症，导致皮质醇过度分泌。

HP:0001580.name: Pigmented micronodular adrenocortical disease
HP:0001580.name_cn: 色素性微结节性肾上腺皮质病

HP:0001581.name: Recurrent skin infections
HP:0001581.definition: Infections of the skin that happen multiple times.

HP:0001582.name: Redundant skin
HP:0001582.definition: Loose and sagging skin often associated with loss of skin elasticity.
HP:0001582.definition_cn: 皮肤松弛和下垂通常与皮肤弹性丧失相关。

HP:0001583.name: Rotary nystagmus
HP:0001583.definition: A form of nystagmus in which the eyeball makes rotary motions around the axis.
HP:0001583.definition_cn: 一种眼球震颤形式，其中眼球围绕轴进行旋转运动。

HP:0001586.name: Vesicovaginal fistula
HP:0001586.definition: The presence of a fistula connecting the urinary bladder to the vagina.

HP:0001591.name: Bell-shaped thorax
HP:0001591.definition: The rib cage has the shape of a wide mouthed bell. That is, the superior portion of the rib cage is constricted, followed by a convex region, and the inferior portion of the rib cage expands again to have a large diameter.
HP:0001591.definition_cn: 胸腔呈宽口钟形。即，胸腔的上部较为狭窄，随后为凸起区域，而胸腔的下部再次扩张，形成较大直径。

HP:0001592.name: Selective tooth agenesis
HP:0001592.definition: Agenesis specifically affecting one of the classes incisor, premolar, or molar.
HP:0001592.definition_cn: 特定影响切牙、前磨牙或磨牙其中一类的牙胚缺失。

HP:0001593.name: Maxillary lateral incisor microdontia
HP:0001593.definition: Decreased size of the maxillary permanent incisor.

HP:0001596.name: Alopecia
HP:0001596.definition: A noncongenital process of hair loss, which may progress to partial or complete baldness.
HP:0001596.definition_cn: 一种非先天性的脱发过程，可能进展为部分或完全秃发。

HP:0001597.name: Abnormal nail morphology
