HP:0002083.definition_cn: 反复发作的头痛，持续时间为4至72小时，且至少符合以下两项标准：1）单侧定位，2）搏动性特征，3）中度或重度疼痛强度，4）因或导致避免常规体力活动（如爬楼梯）。头痛发作通常伴有恶心、呕吐、畏光或畏声。

HP:0002084.name: Encephalocele
HP:0002084.definition: A neural tube defect characterized by sac-like protrusions of the brain and the membranes that cover it through openings in the skull.
HP:0002084.definition_cn: 一种神经管缺陷，其特征为脑组织及其覆盖的膜通过颅骨开口形成囊状突出。

HP:0002085.name: Occipital encephalocele
HP:0002085.definition: A type of encephalocele (that is, a a protrusion of part of the cranial contents including brain tissue through a congenital opening in the cranium, typically covered with skin or mucous membrane) in the occipital region of the skull. Occipital encephalocele presents as a midline swelling over the occipital bone. It is usually covered with normal full-thickness scalp.
HP:0002085.definition_cn: 一种位于颅骨枕区的脑膨出（即部分颅内容物，包括脑组织，通过颅骨先天性缺损处突出，通常被皮肤或黏膜覆盖）。枕部脑膨出表现为枕骨中线处的肿胀，通常被正常全厚度的头皮覆盖。

HP:0002086.name: Abnormality of the respiratory system
HP:0002086.definition: An abnormality of the respiratory system, which include the airways, lungs, and the respiratory muscles.
HP:0002086.definition_cn: 呼吸系统异常，包括气道、肺部和呼吸肌。

HP:0002087.name: Abnormality of the upper respiratory tract
HP:0002087.definition: An abnormality of the upper respiratory tract.

HP:0002088.name: Abnormal lung morphology
HP:0002088.definition: Any structural anomaly of the lung.

HP:0002090.name: Pneumonia
HP:0002090.definition: Inflammation of any part of the lung parenchyma.
HP:0002090.definition_cn: 肺实质任何部位的炎症。

HP:0002091.name: Restrictive ventilatory defect
HP:0002091.definition: A functional defect characterized by reduced total lung capacity (TLC) not associated with abnormalities of expiratory airflow or airway resistance. Spirometrically, a restrictive defect is defined as FEV1 (forced expiratory volume in 1 second) and FVC (forced vital capacity) less than 80 per cent. Restrictive lung disease may be caused by alterations in lung parenchyma or because of a disease of the pleura, chest wall, or neuromuscular apparatus.
HP:0002091.definition_cn: 一种以总肺容量（TLC）减少为特征的功能性缺陷，不伴有呼气气流或气道阻力的异常。肺功能检测中，限制性缺陷定义为FEV1（1秒用力呼气量）和FVC（用力肺活量）均低于80%。限制性肺疾病可能由肺实质的改变引起，或由于胸膜、胸壁或神经肌肉装置的疾病所致。

HP:0002092.name: Pulmonary arterial hypertension
HP:0002092.definition: Pulmonary hypertension is defined mean pulmonary artery pressure of 25mmHg or more and pulmonary capillary wedge pressure of 15mmHg or less when measured by right heart catheterisation at rest and in a supine position.
HP:0002092.definition_cn: 肺动脉高压的定义为在静息平卧位下通过右心导管测量时，平均肺动脉压≥25mmHg且肺毛细血管楔压≤15mmHg。

HP:0002094.name: Dyspnea
HP:0002094.definition: Difficult or labored breathing. Dyspnea is a subjective feeling only the patient can rate, e.g., on a Borg scale.
HP:0002094.definition_cn: 呼吸困难。呼吸困难是一种仅可由患者主观评估的感觉，例如通过博格量表进行评分。

HP:0002098.name: Respiratory distress
HP:0002098.definition: Respiratory distress is objectively observable as the physical or emotional consequences from the experience of dyspnea. The physical presentation of respiratory distress is generally referred to as labored breathing, while the sensation of respiratory distress is called shortness of breath or dyspnea.
HP:0002098.definition_cn: 呼吸窘迫可客观地表现为呼吸困难体验所引发的生理或情感后果。呼吸窘迫的生理表现通常被称为呼吸费力，而呼吸窘迫的主观感受则称为气短或呼吸困难。

HP:0002099.name: Asthma
HP:0002099.definition: Asthma is characterized by increased responsiveness of the tracheobronchial tree to multiple stimuli, leading to narrowing of the air passages with resultant dyspnea, cough, and wheezing.
HP:0002099.definition_cn: 哮喘的特征是气管支气管树对多种刺激的敏感性增加，导致气道狭窄，从而引发呼吸困难、咳嗽和喘息。

HP:0002100.name: Recurrent aspiration pneumonia
HP:0002100.definition: Increased susceptibility to aspiration pneumonia, defined as pneumonia due to breathing in foreign material, as manifested by a medical history of repeated episodes of aspiration pneumonia.
HP:0002100.definition_cn: 吸入性肺炎易感性增加，定义为因吸入异物导致的肺炎，表现为反复发作的吸入性肺炎病史。

HP:0002101.name: Abnormal lung lobation
HP:0002101.definition: A developmental defect in the formation of pulmonary lobes.

HP:0002103.name: Abnormal pleura morphology
HP:0002103.definition: An abnormality of the pulmonary pleura, the thin, transparent membrane which covers the lungs and lines the inside of the chest walls.
HP:0002103.definition_cn: 肺胸膜异常，即覆盖肺部并衬于胸壁内侧的薄而透明的膜发生异常。

HP:0002104.name: Apnea
HP:0002104.definition: Lack of breathing with no movement of the respiratory muscles and no exchange of air in the lungs. This term refers to a disposition to have recurrent episodes of apnea rather than to a single event.
HP:0002104.definition_cn: 呼吸暂停伴呼吸肌无运动及肺部无气体交换。该术语指倾向于反复发生呼吸暂停的倾向，而非单一事件。

HP:0002105.name: Hemoptysis
HP:0002105.definition: Coughing up (expectoration) of blood or blood-streaked sputum from the larynx, trachea, bronchi, or lungs.
HP:0002105.definition_cn: 咯血（Hemoptysis），即从喉部、气管、支气管或肺部咳出血液或带血痰液。

HP:0002107.name: Pneumothorax
HP:0002107.definition: Accumulation of air in the pleural cavity leading to a partially or completely collapsed lung.
HP:0002107.definition_cn: 气胸（Pneumothorax）导致肺部分或完全塌陷（Collapsed Lung）。

HP:0002108.name: Spontaneous pneumothorax
HP:0002108.definition: Pneumothorax occurring without traumatic injury to the chest or lung.

HP:0002110.name: Bronchiectasis
HP:0002110.definition: Persistent abnormal dilatation of the bronchi owing to localized and irreversible destruction and widening of the large airways.
HP:0002110.definition_cn: 由于局部不可逆性破坏和大气道扩张导致的持续性支气管异常扩张。

HP:0002111.name: obsolete Restrictive deficit on pulmonary function testing
HP:0002111.name_cn: 肺功能测试中的限制性通气功能障碍

HP:0002118.name: Abnormal cerebral ventricle morphology
HP:0002118.definition: Any structural abnormality of the cerebral ventricles.

HP:0002119.name: Ventriculomegaly
HP:0002119.definition: An increase in size of the ventricular system of the brain.

HP:0002120.name: Cerebral cortical atrophy
HP:0002120.definition: Atrophy of the cortex of the cerebrum.

HP:0002121.name: Generalized non-motor (absence) seizure
HP:0002121.definition: A generalized non-motor (absence) seizure is a type of a type of dialeptic seizure that is of electrographically generalized onset. It is a generalized seizure characterized by an interruption of activities, a blank stare, and usually the person will be unresponsive when spoken to. Any ictal motor phenomena are minor in comparison to these non-motor features.
HP:0002121.name_cn: 全面性非运动性（失神）发作
HP:0002121.definition_cn: 全面性非运动性（失神）发作是一种电生理学上表现为全面性起始的失神性发作类型。其特征为活动突然中断、目光呆滞，通常对言语刺激无反应。与这些非运动性特征相比，任何发作期运动现象均较轻微。

HP:0002123.name: Generalized myoclonic seizure
HP:0002123.definition: A generalized myoclonic seizure is a type of generalized motor seizure characterized by bilateral, sudden, brief (<100 ms) involuntary single or multiple contraction of muscles or muscle groups of variable topography (axial, proximal limb, distal). Myoclonus is less regularly repetitive and less sustained than is clonus.
HP:0002123.definition_cn: 全身性肌阵挛发作是一种全身性运动性发作，其特征为双侧、突发、短暂（<100毫秒）的不自主单次或多次肌肉或肌群收缩，其分布部位可变（轴性、近端肢体、远端）。肌阵挛的重复性较阵挛更为不规则，且持续时间较短。

HP:0002126.name: Polymicrogyria
HP:0002126.definition: Polymicrogyria is a congenital malformation of the cerebral cortex characterized by abnormal cortical layering (lamination) and an excessive number of small gyri (folds).
HP:0002126.definition_cn: 多小脑回畸形是一种先天性大脑皮层发育异常，其特征为皮层分层（层状结构）异常及过多的小脑回（褶皱）。

HP:0002127.name: Abnormal upper motor neuron morphology
HP:0002127.definition: Any structural anomaly that affects the upper motor neuron.
HP:0002127.name_cn: 异常的上运动神经元形态
HP:0002127.definition_cn: 影响上运动神经元的任何结构性异常。

HP:0002131.name: Episodic ataxia
HP:0002131.definition: Periodic spells of incoordination and imbalance, that is, episodes of ataxia typically lasting from 10 minutes to several hours or days.
HP:0002131.definition_cn: 周期性发作的共济失调和平衡障碍，即共济失调发作，通常持续10分钟至数小时或数天。

HP:0002132.name: Porencephalic cyst
HP:0002132.definition: A cavity within the cerebral hemisphere, filled with cerebrospinal fluid, that communicates directly with the ventricular system.
HP:0002132.definition_cn: 大脑半球内的一个腔隙，充满脑脊液，直接与脑室系统相通。

HP:0002133.name: Status epilepticus
HP:0002133.definition: Status epilepticus is a type of prolonged seizure resulting either from the failure of the mechanisms responsible for seizure termination or from the initiation of mechanisms which lead to abnormally prolonged seizures (after time point t1). It is a condition that can have long-term consequences (after time point t2), including neuronal death, neuronal injury, and alteration of neuronal networks, depending on the type and duration of seizures.
HP:0002133.definition_cn: 癫痫持续状态是一种由于负责终止癫痫发作的机制失效或启动导致异常延长癫痫发作的机制（在时间点t1之后）而引起的持续性癫痫发作。该状况可能具有长期后果（在时间点t2之后），包括神经元死亡、神经元损伤以及神经网络改变，具体取决于癫痫发作的类型和持续时间。

HP:0002135.name: Basal ganglia calcification
HP:0002135.definition: The presence of calcium deposition affecting one or more structures of the basal ganglia.
HP:0002135.definition_cn: 基底节区一处或多处结构出现钙质沉积。

HP:0002136.name: Broad-based gait
HP:0002136.definition: An abnormal gait pattern in which persons stand and walk with their feet spaced widely apart. This is often a component of cerebellar ataxia.
HP:0002136.definition_cn: 一种异常步态模式，表现为患者站立和行走时双脚间距明显增宽。这通常是小脑性共济失调的一个组成部分。

HP:0002138.name: Subarachnoid hemorrhage
HP:0002138.definition: Hemorrhage occurring between the arachnoid mater and the pia mater.
HP:0002138.definition_cn: 蛛网膜与软脑膜之间的出血。

HP:0002139.name: Arrhinencephaly
HP:0002139.definition: A defect of development of the brain characterized by congenital absence of the part of the brain that includes the olfactory bulbs, tracts, and other structures associated with the sense of smell.
HP:0002139.definition_cn: 一种大脑发育缺陷，其特征为先天性缺失包括嗅球、嗅束及其他与嗅觉相关结构的大脑部分。

HP:0002140.name: Ischemic stroke
HP:0002140.definition: Acute ischemic stroke (AIS) is defined by the sudden loss of blood flow to an area of the brain with the resulting loss of neurologic function. It is caused by thrombosis or embolism that occludes a cerebral vessel supplying a specific area of the brain. During a vessel occlusion, there is a core area where damage to the brain is irreversible and an area of penumbra where the brain has lost function owing to decreased blood flow but is not irreversibly injured.
HP:0002140.definition_cn: 急性缺血性卒中（Acute Ischemic Stroke, AIS）是指由于脑部某一区域血流突然中断，导致神经功能丧失的疾病。其病因通常为血栓形成或栓塞，导致供应特定脑区的脑血管闭塞。在血管闭塞期间，存在一个核心区域，该区域的脑组织损伤不可逆；同时存在一个半暗带区域，该区域因血流减少而丧失功能，但尚未发生不可逆性损伤。

HP:0002143.name: Abnormal spinal cord morphology
HP:0002143.definition: A structural abnormality of the spinal cord (myelon).

HP:0002144.name: Tethered cord
HP:0002144.definition: During normal embryological development, the spinal cord first occupies the entire length of the vertebral column but goes on to assume a position at the level of L1 due to differential growth of the conus medullaris and the vertebral column. The filum terminale is a slender, threadlike structure that remains after the normal regression of the distal embryonic spinal cord and attaches the spinal cord to the coccyx. A tethered cord results if there is a thickened rope-like filum terminale which anchors the cord at the level of L2 or below, potentially causing neurologic signs owing to abnormal tension on the spinal cord.
HP:0002144.definition_cn: 在正常胚胎发育过程中，脊髓最初占据整个椎管的长度，但由于脊髓圆锥和椎管的差异性生长，最终定位于L1水平。终丝是一种细长的线状结构，由远端胚胎脊髓正常退化后残留，并将脊髓附着于尾骨。若终丝增厚呈绳索状，将脊髓固定于L2或以下水平，则可能导致脊髓栓系，由于脊髓受到异常牵拉，可能引发神经症状。

HP:0002145.name: Frontotemporal dementia
HP:0002145.definition: A dementia associated with degeneration of the frontotemporal lobe and clinically associated with personality and behavioral changes such as disinhibition, apathy, and lack of insight. The hallmark feature of frontotemporal dementia is the presentation with focal syndromes such as progressive language dysfunction, or aphasia, or behavioral changes characteristic of frontal lobe disorders.
HP:0002145.definition_cn: 一种与额颞叶变性相关的痴呆症，临床上表现为人格和行为改变，如去抑制、冷漠和缺乏自知力。额颞叶痴呆的标志性特征是局灶性综合征的表现，如进行性语言功能障碍（失语症）或额叶障碍特征的行为改变。

HP:0002148.name: Hypophosphatemia
HP:0002148.definition: An abnormally decreased phosphate concentration in the blood.

HP:0002149.name: Hyperuricemia
HP:0002149.definition: An abnormally high level of uric acid in the blood.

HP:0002151.name: Increased circulating lactate concentration
HP:0002151.definition: Abnormally increased level of blood lactate (2-hydroxypropanoic acid). Lactate is produced from pyruvate by lactate dehydrogenase during normal metabolism. The terms lactate and lactic acid are often used interchangeably but lactate (the component measured in blood) is strictly a weak base whereas lactic acid is the corresponding acid. Lactic acidosis is often used clinically to describe elevated lactate but should be reserved for cases where there is a corresponding acidosis (pH below 7.35).
HP:0002151.definition_cn: 血液乳酸（2-羟基丙酸）水平异常升高。在正常代谢过程中，乳酸脱氢酶将丙酮酸转化为乳酸。术语“乳酸”和“乳酸酸”常被互换使用，但严格来说，乳酸（血液中测量的成分）是一种弱碱，而乳酸酸是其对应的酸。临床上常用“乳酸酸中毒”来描述乳酸升高，但应仅用于存在相应酸中毒（pH值低于7.35）的情况。

HP:0002152.name: Hyperproteinemia
HP:0002152.definition: An increased concentration of proteins in the blood.

HP:0002153.name: Hyperkalemia
HP:0002153.definition: An abnormally increased potassium concentration in the blood.

HP:0002154.name: Hyperglycinemia
HP:0002154.definition: An elevated concentration of glycine in the blood.

HP:0002155.name: Hypertriglyceridemia
HP:0002155.definition: An abnormal increase in the level of triglycerides in the blood.
HP:0002155.definition_cn: 血液中甘油三酯水平的异常升高。

HP:0002156.name: Homocystinuria
HP:0002156.definition: An increased concentration of homocystine in the urine.
HP:0002156.definition_cn: 尿液中同型胱氨酸浓度升高。

HP:0002157.name: Azotemia
HP:0002157.definition: An increased concentration of nitrogen compounds in the blood.
HP:0002157.definition_cn: 血液中氮化合物浓度升高。

HP:0002159.name: Heparan sulfate excretion in urine
HP:0002159.definition: An increased concentration of heparan sulfates in the urine.
HP:0002159.name_cn: 尿液中硫酸乙酰肝素排泄
HP:0002159.definition_cn: 尿液中硫酸乙酰肝素浓度升高。

HP:0002160.name: Hyperhomocystinemia
HP:0002160.definition: An increased concentration of homocystine in the blood.
HP:0002160.definition_cn: 血液中同型胱氨酸浓度升高。

HP:0002161.name: Hyperlysinemia
HP:0002161.definition: An increased concentration of lysine in the blood.

HP:0002162.name: Low posterior hairline
HP:0002162.definition: Hair on the neck extends more inferiorly than usual.
HP:0002162.definition_cn: 颈部毛发向尾侧延伸较正常范围更远。

HP:0002164.name: Nail dysplasia
HP:0002164.definition: The presence of developmental dysplasia of the nail.

HP:0002165.name: Nail pterygium
HP:0002165.definition: Inward advance of skin over the nail plate.
HP:0002165.definition_cn: 甲板上的皮肤向内推进。

HP:0002166.name: Impaired vibration sensation in the lower limbs
HP:0002166.definition: A decrease in the ability to perceive vibration in the legs.

HP:0002167.name: Abnormal speech pattern
HP:0002167.definition: An abnormality in the sound (volume) or cadence (rate) of speech.
HP:0002167.definition_cn: 语音（音量）或韵律（速率）异常。

HP:0002168.name: Scanning speech
HP:0002168.definition: An abnormal pattern of speech in which the words are as if measured or scanned; there is a pause after every syllable, and the syllables themselves are pronounced slowly.
HP:0002168.definition_cn: 一种异常的言语模式，表现为词语仿佛被测量或扫描；每个音节后均有停顿，且音节本身发音缓慢。

HP:0002169.name: Clonus
HP:0002169.definition: A series of rhythmic and involuntary muscle contractions (at a frequency of about 5 to 7 Hz) that occur in response to an abruptly applied and sustained stretch.
HP:0002169.definition_cn: 一系列节律性且不自主的肌肉收缩（频率约为5至7赫兹），由突然施加并持续维持的牵张刺激所引发。

HP:0002171.name: Gliosis
HP:0002171.definition: Gliosis is the focal proliferation of glial cells in the central nervous system.
HP:0002171.definition_cn: 胶质增生是中枢神经系统中胶质细胞的局灶性增殖。

HP:0002172.name: Postural instability
HP:0002172.definition: A tendency to fall or the inability to keep oneself from falling; imbalance. The retropulsion test is widely regarded as the gold standard to evaluate postural instability, Use of the retropulsion test includes a rapid balance perturbation in the backward direction, and the number of balance correcting steps (or total absence thereof) is used to rate the degree of postural instability. Healthy subjects correct such perturbations with either one or two large steps, or without taking any steps, hinging rapidly at the hips while swinging the arms forward as a counterweight. In patients with balance impairment, balance correcting steps are often too small, forcing patients to take more than two steps. Taking three or more steps is generally considered to be abnormal, and taking more than five steps is regarded as being clearly abnormal. Markedly affected patients continue to step backward without ever regaining their balance and must be caught by the examiner (this would be called true retropulsion). Even more severely affected patients fail to correct entirely, and fall backward like a pushed toy soldier, without taking any corrective steps.
HP:0002172.definition_cn: 跌倒倾向或无法防止自身跌倒；平衡失调。后推试验被广泛认为是评估姿势不稳定的金标准。后推试验包括快速向后方向的平衡扰动，通过平衡纠正步数（或完全缺乏）来评定姿势不稳定的程度。健康受试者通常通过一或两大步纠正此类扰动，或不采取任何步数，迅速在髋部屈曲，同时向前摆动双臂作为平衡。在平衡受损的患者中，平衡纠正步数通常过小，迫使患者采取两步以上。采取三步或更多步数通常被视为异常，而采取五步以上则被视为明显异常。显著受影响的患者会持续向后踏步而无法恢复平衡，必须由检查者扶住（这被称为真正的后推）。更严重的患者完全无法纠正，像被推倒的玩具士兵一样向后跌倒，不采取任何纠正步数。

HP:0002174.name: Postural tremor
HP:0002174.definition: A type of tremors that is triggered by holding a limb in a fixed position.
HP:0002174.definition_cn: 一种由保持肢体固定姿势引发的震颤类型。

HP:0002176.name: Spinal cord compression
HP:0002176.definition: External mechanical compression of the spinal cord.

HP:0002180.name: Neurodegeneration
HP:0002180.definition: Progressive loss of neural cells and tissue.
HP:0002180.definition_cn: 进行性神经细胞和组织丧失。

HP:0002181.name: Cerebral edema
HP:0002181.definition: Abnormal accumulation of fluid in the brain.

HP:0002183.name: Phonophobia
HP:0002183.definition: An abnormally heightened sensitivity to loud sounds.

HP:0002185.name: Neurofibrillary tangles
HP:0002185.definition: Pathological protein aggregates formed by hyperphosphorylation of a microtubule-associated protein known as tau, causing it to aggregate in an insoluble form.
HP:0002185.definition_cn: 由一种称为tau的微管相关蛋白过度磷酸化形成的病理性蛋白聚集体，导致其以不溶性形式聚集。

HP:0002186.name: Apraxia
HP:0002186.definition: A defect in the understanding of complex motor commands and in the execution of certain learned movements, i.e., deficits in the cognitive components of learned movements.
HP:0002186.definition_cn: 复杂运动指令理解障碍及特定习得性运动执行障碍，即习得性运动认知成分缺陷。

HP:0002187.name: Intellectual disability, profound
HP:0002187.definition: Profound mental retardation is defined as an intelligence quotient (IQ) below 20.
HP:0002187.definition_cn: 重度智力障碍定义为智商（IQ）低于20。

HP:0002188.name: Delayed CNS myelination
HP:0002188.definition: Delayed myelination in the central nervous system.
HP:0002188.name_cn: 中枢神经系统髓鞘形成延迟
HP:0002188.definition_cn: 中枢神经系统髓鞘形成延迟。

HP:0002190.name: Choroid plexus cyst
HP:0002190.definition: A cyst occurring within the choroid plexus within a cerebral ventricle.

HP:0002191.name: Progressive spasticity
HP:0002191.definition: Spasticity that increases in degree with time.
HP:0002191.definition_cn: 随时间进展的痉挛程度加重。

HP:0002193.name: Pseudobulbar affect
HP:0002193.definition: Pseudobulbar affect (PBA) is characterized by uncontrolled crying or laughing which may be disproportionate or inappropriate to the social context. Thus, there is a disparity between the patient's emotional expression and his or her emotional experience.
HP:0002193.definition_cn: 假性延髓情绪（Pseudobulbar Affect, PBA）的特征为无法控制的哭泣或大笑，这些情绪表达可能与社会情境不相称或不适当。因此，患者的情感表达与其情感体验之间存在不一致性。

HP:0002194.name: Delayed gross motor development
HP:0002194.definition: A type of motor delay characterized by a delay in acquiring the ability to control the large muscles of the body for walking, running, sitting, and crawling.
HP:0002194.definition_cn: 一种运动发育迟缓，其特征为在获得控制身体大肌肉群以进行行走、跑步、坐立和爬行能力方面存在延迟。

HP:0002195.name: Dysgenesis of the cerebellar vermis
HP:0002195.definition: Defective development of the vermis of cerebellum.

HP:0002196.name: Myelopathy
HP:0002196.definition: Myelopathy is an descriptive term, referring to pathology leading to a neurologic deficit related to the spinal cord. The clinical diagnosis of myelopathy requires a detailed history and physical examination to define the clinical syndrome. Neuroimaging is indicated in most instances of new-onset myelopathy. It is indicated also when the worsening of a myelopathy is unexplained.
HP:0002196.definition_cn: 脊髓病是一个描述性术语，指导致与脊髓相关的神经功能缺损的病理状态。脊髓病的临床诊断需要详细的病史和体格检查以确定临床综合征。在大多数新发脊髓病病例中，神经影像学检查是必要的。当脊髓病恶化原因不明时，也应进行神经影像学检查。

HP:0002197.name: Generalized-onset seizure
HP:0002197.definition: A generalized-onset seizure is a type of seizure originating at some point within, and rapidly engaging, bilaterally distributed networks. The networks may include cortical and subcortical structures but not necessarily the entire cortex.
HP:0002197.definition_cn: 全面性发作是一种起源于双侧分布网络内某一点并迅速累及这些网络的癫痫发作类型。这些网络可能包括皮质和皮质下结构，但不一定涉及整个皮质。

HP:0002198.name: Dilated fourth ventricle
HP:0002198.definition: An abnormal dilatation of the fourth cerebral ventricle.

HP:0002200.name: Pseudobulbar signs
HP:0002200.definition: Pseudobulbar signs result from injury to an upper motor neuron lesion to the corticobulbar pathways in the pyramidal tract. Patients have difficulty chewing, swallowing and demonstrate slurred speech (often initial presentation) as well as abnormal behavioral symptoms such as inappropriate emotional outbursts of uncontrolled laughter or weeping etc.
HP:0002200.definition_cn: 假性延髓麻痹症状是由于锥体束中皮质延髓通路的上运动神经元损伤所致。患者表现为咀嚼困难、吞咽障碍以及构音障碍（常为首发症状），同时伴有异常行为症状，如不恰当的情感爆发，表现为无法控制的哭笑等。

HP:0002202.name: Pleural effusion
HP:0002202.definition: The presence of an excessive amount of fluid in the pleural cavity.

HP:0002203.name: Respiratory paralysis
HP:0002203.definition: Inability to move the muscles of respiration.

HP:0002204.name: Pulmonary embolism
HP:0002204.definition: An embolus (that is, an abnormal particle circulating in the blood) located in the pulmonary artery and thereby blocking blood circulation to the lung. Usually the embolus is a blood clot that has developed in an extremity (for instance, a deep venous thrombosis), detached, and traveled through the circulation before becoming trapped in the pulmonary artery.
HP:0002204.definition_cn: 位于肺动脉中的栓子（即循环于血液中的异常颗粒），从而阻断肺部的血液循环。通常，栓子是在肢体（例如，深静脉血栓形成）中形成的血凝块，脱落后通过循环系统移动，最终嵌顿在肺动脉中。

HP:0002205.name: Recurrent respiratory infections
HP:0002205.definition: An increased susceptibility to respiratory infections as manifested by a history of recurrent respiratory infections.
HP:0002205.definition_cn: 表现为反复呼吸道感染病史的呼吸道感染易感性增加。

HP:0002206.name: Pulmonary fibrosis
HP:0002206.definition: Replacement of normal lung tissues by fibroblasts and collagen.
HP:0002206.definition_cn: 正常肺组织被成纤维细胞和胶原纤维替代。

HP:0002207.name: Diffuse reticular or finely nodular infiltrations
HP:0002207.name_cn: 弥漫性网状或细结节状浸润

HP:0002208.name: Coarse hair
HP:0002208.definition: Hair shafts are rough in texture.

HP:0002209.name: Sparse scalp hair
HP:0002209.definition: Decreased number of hairs per unit area of skin of the scalp.
HP:0002209.definition_cn: 头皮单位面积毛发数量减少。

HP:0002211.name: White forelock
HP:0002211.definition: A triangular depigmented region of white hairs located in the anterior midline of the scalp.
HP:0002211.definition_cn: 位于头皮前正中线处的三角形色素脱失区域，伴有白色毛发。

HP:0002213.name: Fine hair
HP:0002213.definition: Hair that is fine or thin to the touch.
HP:0002213.definition_cn: 细软发质（Fine or thin hair texture）

HP:0002215.name: Sparse axillary hair
HP:0002215.definition: Reduced number or density of axillary hair.

HP:0002216.name: Premature graying of hair
HP:0002216.definition: Development of gray hair at a younger than normal age.

HP:0002217.name: Slow-growing hair
HP:0002217.definition: Hair whose growth is slower than normal.

HP:0002218.name: Silver-gray hair
HP:0002218.definition_cn: 低色素性毛发呈现银灰色。

HP:0002219.name: Facial hypertrichosis
HP:0002219.definition: Excessive, increased hair growth located in the facial region.

HP:0002220.name: Melanin pigment aggregation in hair shafts
HP:0002220.name_cn: 毛干中黑色素颗粒聚集

HP:0002224.name: Woolly hair
HP:0002224.definition: The term wooly hair refers to an abnormal variant of hair that is fine, with tightly coiled curls, and often hypopigmented. Optical microscopy may reveal the presence of tight spirals and a clear diameter reduction as compared with normal hair. Electron microscopy may show flat, oval hair shafts with reduced transversal diameter.
HP:0002224.definition_cn: 术语“羊毛状发”指的是一种异常毛发变异，其特征为毛发纤细、紧密卷曲且常伴有色素减退。光学显微镜下可观察到与正常毛发相比，存在紧密螺旋结构及明显的直径缩小。电子显微镜下可显示毛干扁平、呈椭圆形，且横径减小。

HP:0002225.name: Sparse pubic hair
HP:0002225.definition: Reduced number or density of pubic hair.
HP:0002225.definition_cn: 阴毛数量减少或密度降低。

HP:0002226.name: White eyebrow
HP:0002226.definition: White color (lack of pigmentation) of the eyebrow.
HP:0002226.definition_cn: 眉毛色素脱失（眉毛白化）。

HP:0002227.name: White eyelashes
HP:0002227.definition: White color (lack of pigmentation) of the eyelashes.

HP:0002230.name: Generalized hirsutism
HP:0002230.definition: Abnormally increased hair growth over much of the entire body.

HP:0002232.name: Patchy alopecia
HP:0002232.definition: Transient, non-scarring hair loss and preservation of the hair follicle located in in well-defined patches.
HP:0002232.definition_cn: 短暂性、非瘢痕性脱发，毛囊保留，呈边界清晰的斑片状分布。

HP:0002234.name: Early balding
HP:0002234.definition: Loss of scalp hair at an earlier than normal age.

HP:0002235.name: Pili canaliculi
HP:0002235.definition: A characteristic triangular, kidney- or heat-shaped diameter of hair shafts with typical longitudinal canalicular deformation as observable by scanning electron microscopy.
HP:0002235.definition_cn: 特征性的三角形、肾形或心形毛干直径，伴有典型的纵向小管状变形，可通过扫描电子显微镜观察到。

HP:0002236.name: Frontal upsweep of hair
HP:0002236.definition: Upward and/or sideward growth of anterior hair.
HP:0002236.definition_cn: 前发向上和/或侧向生长。

HP:0002240.name: Hepatomegaly
HP:0002240.definition: Abnormally increased size of the liver.

HP:0002242.name: Abnormal intestine morphology
HP:0002242.definition: An abnormality of the intestine. The closely related term enteropathy is used to refer to any disease of the intestine.
HP:0002242.definition_cn: 肠道异常。密切相关的术语“肠病”用于指代任何肠道疾病。

HP:0002243.name: Protein-losing enteropathy
HP:0002243.definition: Abnormal loss of protein from the digestive tract related to excessive leakage of plasma proteins into the lumen of the gastrointestinal tract.
HP:0002243.definition_cn: 消化系统蛋白质异常丢失，与血浆蛋白过度渗漏至胃肠道腔有关。

HP:0002244.name: Abnormal small intestine morphology
HP:0002244.definition: A structural abnormality of the small intestine.

HP:0002245.name: Meckel diverticulum
HP:0002245.definition: Meckel's diverticulum is a congenital diverticulum located in the distal ileum.
HP:0002245.definition_cn: 梅克尔憩室是一种位于回肠远端的先天性憩室。

HP:0002246.name: Abnormal duodenum morphology
HP:0002246.definition: An abnormality of the duodenum, i.e., the first section of the small intestine.
HP:0002246.definition_cn: 十二指肠异常，即小肠第一段异常。

HP:0002247.name: Duodenal atresia
HP:0002247.definition: A developmental defect resulting in complete obliteration of the duodenal lumen, that is, an abnormal closure of the duodenum.
HP:0002247.definition_cn: 十二指肠闭锁（Duodenal Atresia），即十二指肠管腔完全闭塞的发育缺陷，导致十二指肠异常闭合。

HP:0002249.name: Melena
HP:0002249.definition: The passage of blackish, tarry feces associated with gastrointestinal hemorrhage. Melena occurs if the blood remains in the colon long enough for it to be broken down by colonic bacteria. One degradation product, hematin, imbues the stool with a blackish color. Thus, melena generally occurs with bleeding from the upper gastrointestinal tract (e.g., stomach ulcers or duodenal ulcers), since the blood usually remains in the gut for a longer period of time than with lower gastrointestinal bleeding.
HP:0002249.definition_cn: 黑色柏油样粪便的排出与胃肠道出血相关。黑便的发生是由于血液在结肠内停留时间足够长，被结肠细菌分解。其中一种降解产物——血红素，使粪便呈现黑色。因此，黑便通常与上消化道出血（如胃溃疡或十二指肠溃疡）相关，因为与下消化道出血相比，血液在肠道内停留的时间通常更长。

HP:0002250.name: Abnormal large intestine morphology
HP:0002250.definition: Any abnormality of the large intestine.

HP:0002251.name: Aganglionic megacolon
HP:0002251.definition: An abnormality resulting from a lack of intestinal ganglion cells (i.e., an aganglionic section of bowel) that results in bowel obstruction with enlargement of the colon.
HP:0002251.definition_cn: 一种由于肠道神经节细胞缺乏（即肠道的无神经节细胞段）导致的异常，引起肠梗阻并伴随结肠扩张。

HP:0002253.name: Colonic diverticula
HP:0002253.definition: The presence of multiple diverticula of the colon.

HP:0002254.name: Intermittent diarrhea
HP:0002254.definition: Repeated episodes of diarrhea separated by periods without diarrhea.
HP:0002254.definition_cn: 间歇性腹泻发作（Intermittent episodes of diarrhea）。

HP:0002257.name: Chronic rhinitis
HP:0002257.definition: Chronic inflammation of the nasal mucosa.

HP:0002263.name: Exaggerated cupid's bow
HP:0002263.definition: More pronounced paramedian peaks and median notch of the Cupid's bow.
HP:0002263.definition_cn: 更明显的丘比特弓旁正中峰和正中切迹。

HP:0002266.name: Focal clonic seizure
HP:0002266.definition: A focal clonic seizure is a type of focal motor seizure characterized by sustained rhythmic jerking, that is regularly repetitive.
HP:0002266.definition_cn: 局灶性阵挛性发作是一种局灶性运动性发作，其特征为持续、节律性、规律重复的抽搐。

HP:0002267.name: Exaggerated startle response
HP:0002267.definition: An exaggerated startle reaction in response to a sudden unexpected visual or acoustic stimulus, or a quick movement near the face.
HP:0002267.definition_cn: 对突然意外的视觉或听觉刺激，或面部附近的快速运动产生过度的惊跳反应。

HP:0002268.name: Paroxysmal dystonia
HP:0002268.definition: A form of dystonia characterized by episodes of dystonia (often hemidystonia or generalized) lasting from minutes to hours. There are no dystonic symptoms between episodes.
HP:0002268.definition_cn: 一种以发作性肌张力障碍（常为偏侧肌张力障碍或全身性肌张力障碍）为特征的肌张力障碍形式，发作持续时间从数分钟至数小时不等。发作间期无肌张力障碍症状。

HP:0002269.name: Abnormality of neuronal migration
HP:0002269.definition: An abnormality resulting from an anomaly of neuronal migration, i.e., of the process by which neurons travel from their origin to their final position in the brain.
HP:0002269.definition_cn: 由神经元迁移异常导致的异常，即神经元从其起源位置迁移至大脑最终位置的过程异常。

HP:0002270.name: Abnormality of the autonomic nervous system
HP:0002270.definition: An abnormality of the autonomic nervous system.

HP:0002277.name: Horner syndrome
HP:0002277.definition: An abnormality resulting from a lesion of the sympathetic nervous system characterized by a combination of unilateral ptosis, miosis, and often ipsilateral hypohidrosis and conjunctival injection.
HP:0002277.definition_cn: 由交感神经系统病变引起的异常，其特征为单侧上睑下垂、瞳孔缩小，常伴有同侧少汗及结膜充血。

HP:0002280.name: Enlarged cisterna magna
HP:0002280.definition: Increase in size of the cisterna magna, one of three principal openings in the subarachnoid space between the arachnoid and pia mater, located between the cerebellum and the dorsal surface of the medulla oblongata.
HP:0002280.definition_cn: 小脑延髓池（cisterna magna）增大，该池为蛛网膜下腔（subarachnoid space）中三个主要开口之一，位于小脑（cerebellum）与延髓（medulla oblongata）背侧表面之间，介于蛛网膜（arachnoid mater）与软脑膜（pia mater）之间。

HP:0002282.name: Gray matter heterotopia
HP:0002282.definition: Heterotopia or neuronal heterotopia are macroscopic clusters of misplaced neurons (gray matter), most often situated along the ventricular walls or within the subcortical white matter.
HP:0002282.definition_cn: 异位症或神经元异位症是指宏观上可见的错位神经元（灰质）聚集，通常位于脑室壁或皮质下白质内。

HP:0002283.name: Global brain atrophy
HP:0002283.definition: Unlocalized atrophy of the brain with decreased total brain matter volume and increased ventricular size.
HP:0002283.definition_cn: 非局灶性脑萎缩伴全脑体积减少及脑室扩大。

HP:0002286.name: Fair hair
HP:0002286.definition: A lesser degree of hair pigmentation than would otherwise be expected.

HP:0002289.name: Alopecia universalis
HP:0002289.definition: Loss of all hair on the entire body.

HP:0002290.name: Poliosis
HP:0002290.definition: Circumscribed depigmentation of the hair of the head or the eyelashes.
HP:0002290.definition_cn: 局限性头发或睫毛色素脱失。

HP:0002292.name: Frontal balding
HP:0002292.definition: Absence of hair in the anterior midline and/or parietal areas.
HP:0002292.definition_cn: 前中线区和/或顶区毛发缺失。

HP:0002296.name: Progressive hypotrichosis
HP:0002296.definition: Progressively reduced or lacking hair growth.
HP:0002296.definition_cn: 进行性毛发减少或脱发（Progressive hair thinning or alopecia）。

HP:0002299.name: Brittle hair
HP:0002299.definition: Fragile, easily breakable hair, i.e., with reduced tensile strength.
HP:0002299.definition_cn: 脆性毛发，即抗拉强度降低的毛发。

HP:0002300.name: Mutism
HP:0002300.definition: Complete lack of speech or verbal communication in a person despite attempts to engage in conversation. Mutism as a phenomena assumes the individual has previous capacity for speech and in the pediatric population it assumes that the person is past the age of typical language development.
HP:0002300.definition_cn: 完全性失语或言语交流缺失，尽管存在尝试进行对话的行为。缄默症作为一种现象，假设个体先前具备言语能力，在儿科人群中则假设个体已超过典型语言发育年龄。

HP:0002301.name: Hemiplegia
HP:0002301.definition: Paralysis (complete loss of muscle function) in the arm, leg, and in some cases the face on one side of the body.
HP:0002301.definition_cn: 偏瘫（Hemiplegia）：身体一侧的上肢、下肢及部分面部肌肉功能完全丧失。

HP:0002304.name: Akinesia
HP:0002304.definition: Inability to initiate changes in activity or movement and to perform ordinary volitional movements rapidly and easily.
HP:0002304.definition_cn: 运动启动障碍及随意运动迟缓困难。

HP:0002305.name: Athetosis
HP:0002305.definition: A slow, continuous, involuntary writhing movement that prevents maintenance of a stable posture. Athetosis involves continuous smooth movements that appear random and are not composed of recognizable sub-movements or movement fragments. In contrast to chorea, in athetosis, the same regions of the body are repeatedly involved. Athetosis may worsen with attempts at movement of posture, but athetosis can also occur at rest.
HP:0002305.definition_cn: 缓慢、持续、不自主的扭动运动，导致无法维持稳定姿势。手足徐动症表现为连续平滑的运动，看似随机且不包含可识别的子运动或运动片段。与舞蹈症不同，手足徐动症中身体的相同区域会反复受累。手足徐动症可能在尝试运动或调整姿势时加重，但也可能在静息状态下发生。

HP:0002307.name: Drooling
HP:0002307.definition: Habitual flow of saliva out of the mouth.

HP:0002308.name: Chiari malformation
HP:0002308.definition: Chiari malformation consists of a downward displacement of the cerebellar tonsils and the medulla through the foramen magnum, sometimes causing hydrocephalus as a result of obstruction of CSF outflow.
HP:0002308.definition_cn: Chiari畸形表现为小脑扁桃体和延髓通过枕骨大孔向下移位，有时因脑脊液流出受阻而导致脑积水。

HP:0002312.name: Clumsiness
HP:0002312.definition: Lack of physical coordination resulting in an abnormal tendency to drop items or bump into objects.
HP:0002312.definition_cn: 运动协调障碍导致异常倾向性掉落物品或碰撞物体。

HP:0002314.name: Degeneration of the lateral corticospinal tracts
HP:0002314.definition: Deterioration of the tissues of the lateral corticospinal tracts.
HP:0002314.definition_cn: 外侧皮质脊髓束组织退化。

HP:0002315.name: Headache
HP:0002315.definition: Cephalgia, or pain sensed in various parts of the head, not confined to the area of distribution of any nerve.
HP:0002315.definition_cn: 头痛，或称为头部不同部位感知到的疼痛，不局限于任何神经分布区域。

HP:0002321.name: Vertigo
HP:0002321.definition: An abnormal sensation of spinning while the body is actually stationary.

HP:0002322.name: Resting tremor
HP:0002322.definition: A resting tremor occurs when muscles are at rest and becomes less noticeable or disappears when the affected muscles are moved. Resting tremors are often slow and coarse.
HP:0002322.definition_cn: 静止性震颤（Resting Tremor）在肌肉处于静止状态时发生，当受累肌肉运动时震颤减轻或消失。静止性震颤通常表现为缓慢且粗大的震颤。

HP:0002323.name: Anencephaly
HP:0002323.definition: Anencephaly is a developmental anomaly characterized by a fetus that has no calvarium, with a lack of most or all of the fetus' brain tissue. Anencephaly belongs to a collective group known as neural tube defects (NTD) and is a result of the neural tube failing to close in its rostral end during fetal development.
HP:0002323.definition_cn: 无脑畸形是一种发育异常，其特征为胎儿无颅盖，且大部分或全部脑组织缺失。无脑畸形属于神经管缺陷（NTD）的一种，是由于胎儿发育过程中神经管头端未能闭合所致。

HP:0002324.name: Hydranencephaly
HP:0002324.definition: A defect of development of the brain characterized by replacement of greater portions of the cerebral hemispheres and the corpus striatum by cerebrospinal fluid (CSF) and glial tissue.
HP:0002324.definition_cn: 一种大脑发育缺陷，其特征为大脑半球和纹状体的大部分区域被脑脊液（CSF）和胶质组织所替代。

HP:0002329.name: Drowsiness
HP:0002329.definition: Abnormal feeling of sleepiness or difficulty staying awake.
HP:0002329.definition_cn: 嗜睡或难以保持清醒的异常感觉。

HP:0002330.name: Paroxysmal drowsiness
HP:0002330.definition: A neurological disorder marked by a sudden recurrent uncontrollable compulsion to sleep

HP:0002331.name: Recurrent paroxysmal headache
HP:0002331.definition: Repeated episodes of headache with rapid onset, reaching a peak within minutes and of short duration (less than one hour) with pain that is throbbing, pulsating, or bursting in quality.
HP:0002331.definition_cn: 反复发作的头痛，具有快速起病的特点，数分钟内达到高峰，持续时间短暂（少于1小时），疼痛性质为搏动性、跳动性或爆裂样。

HP:0002332.name: Lack of peer relationships
HP:0002332.definition: The state of not having relationships with peers outside of school or organized activity appropriate to developmental level. This may be caused by behavioral or physical barriers.
HP:0002332.definition_cn: 缺乏与校外同龄人或与发育水平相适应的有组织活动中的同伴建立关系的状态。这可能由行为或生理障碍引起。

HP:0002333.name: Motor deterioration
HP:0002333.definition: Loss of previously present motor (i.e., movement) abilities.
HP:0002333.definition_cn: 先前存在的运动功能丧失。

HP:0002334.name: Abnormal cerebellar vermis morphology
HP:0002334.definition: An anomaly of the vermis of cerebellum.

HP:0002335.name: Agenesis of cerebellar vermis
HP:0002335.definition: Congenital absence of the vermis of cerebellum.

HP:0002339.name: Abnormal caudate nucleus morphology
HP:0002339.definition: Any structural abnormality of the caudate nucleus.
HP:0002339.definition_cn: 尾状核的任何结构异常。

HP:0002341.name: Cervical cord compression
HP:0002341.definition: Compression of the spinal cord in the cervical region, generally manifested by paresthesias and numbness, weakness, difficulty walking, abnormalities of coordination, and neck pain or stiffness.
HP:0002341.definition_cn: 颈椎区域脊髓受压，通常表现为感觉异常和麻木、肌力减弱、行走困难、协调性异常以及颈部疼痛或僵硬。

HP:0002342.name: Intellectual disability, moderate
HP:0002342.definition: Moderate mental retardation is defined as an intelligence quotient (IQ) in the range of 35-49.
HP:0002342.definition_cn: 中度智力障碍定义为智商（IQ）在35至49之间。

HP:0002343.name: Normal pressure hydrocephalus
HP:0002343.definition: A form of hydrocephalus characterized by enlarged cerebral ventricles and normal cerebrospinal fluid (CSF) pressure upon lumbar puncture.
HP:0002343.definition_cn: 一种脑积水类型，其特征为脑室扩大且在腰椎穿刺时脑脊液（CSF）压力正常。

HP:0002345.name: Action tremor
HP:0002345.definition: A tremor present when the limbs are active, either when outstretched in a certain position or throughout a voluntary movement.
HP:0002345.definition_cn: 动作性震颤（Action Tremor），表现为肢体在主动活动时出现震颤，包括在特定姿势下伸展或进行自主运动过程中。

HP:0002346.name: Head tremor
HP:0002346.definition: An unintentional, oscillating to-and-fro muscle movement affecting head movement.
HP:0002346.definition_cn: 一种无意识的、振荡性的来回肌肉运动，影响头部运动。

HP:0002349.name: Focal aware seizure
HP:0002349.definition: A type of focal-onset seizure in which awareness is preserved. Awareness during a seizure is defined as the patient being fully aware of themself and their environment throughout the seizure, even if immobile.
HP:0002349.name_cn: 局灶性意识保留性癫痫发作
HP:0002349.definition_cn: 一种保留意识的局灶性发作。发作期间的意识定义为患者在发作过程中完全意识到自身及其周围环境，即使无法移动。

HP:0002352.name: Leukoencephalopathy
HP:0002352.definition: This term describes abnormality of the white matter of the cerebrum resulting from damage to the myelin sheaths of nerve cells.
HP:0002352.definition_cn: 该术语描述由于神经细胞髓鞘损伤导致的大脑白质异常。

HP:0002353.name: EEG abnormality
HP:0002353.definition: Abnormality observed by electroencephalogram (EEG), which is used to record of the brain's spontaneous electrical activity from multiple electrodes placed on the scalp.
HP:0002353.definition_cn: 脑电图（EEG）异常，该检查通过置于头皮上的多个电极记录大脑自发电活动。

HP:0002354.name: Memory impairment
HP:0002354.definition: An impairment of memory as manifested by a reduced ability to remember things such as dates and names, and increased forgetfulness.
HP:0002354.definition_cn: 记忆障碍表现为对日期、姓名等事物的记忆能力下降，以及遗忘频率增加。

HP:0002356.name: Writer's cramp
HP:0002356.definition: A focal dystonia of the fingers, hand, and/or forearm that appears when the affected person attempts to do a task that requires fine motor movements such as writing or playing a musical instrument.
HP:0002356.definition_cn: 手指、手部和/或前臂的局灶性肌张力障碍，当患者尝试进行需要精细运动技能的任务（如书写或演奏乐器）时出现。

HP:0002357.name: obsolete Dysphasia
HP:0002357.name_cn: 过时术语：失语症（Dysphasia）  \n现代术语：语言障碍（Language Disorder）或失语症（Aphasia）

HP:0002360.name: Sleep abnormality
HP:0002360.definition: An abnormal pattern in the quality, quantity, or characteristics of sleep.
HP:0002360.definition_cn: 睡眠质量、数量或特征的异常模式。

HP:0002361.name: Psychomotor deterioration
HP:0002361.definition: Loss of previously present mental and motor abilities.
HP:0002361.definition_cn: 先前存在的精神和运动功能丧失。

HP:0002362.name: Shuffling gait
HP:0002362.definition: A type of gait (walking) characterized by by dragging one's feet along or without lifting the feet fully from the ground.
HP:0002362.definition_cn: 一种步态类型，其特征为拖曳脚步或未将脚完全抬离地面。

HP:0002366.name: Abnormal lower motor neuron morphology
HP:0002366.definition: Any structural anomaly of the lower motor neuron.
HP:0002366.name_cn: 异常的下运动神经元形态
HP:0002366.definition_cn: 下运动神经元的任何结构异常。

HP:0002367.name: Visual hallucination
HP:0002367.definition: Visual perception in the absence of a visual stimulus.
HP:0002367.definition_cn: 无视觉刺激下的视觉感知。

HP:0002372.name: Normal interictal EEG
HP:0002372.definition: Lack of observable abnormal electroencephalographic (EEG) patterns in an individual with a history of seizures. About half of individuals with epilepsy show interictal epileptiform discharges upon the first investigation. The yield can be increased by repeated studies, sleep studies, or by ambulatory EEG recordings over 24 hours. Normal interictal EEG is a sign that can be useful in the differential diagnosis.
HP:0002372.definition_cn: 在具有癫痫发作史的个体中，未观察到异常脑电图（EEG）模式。约半数癫痫患者在首次检查时显示发作间期癫痫样放电。通过重复检查、睡眠研究或24小时动态脑电图记录，可以提高检出率。正常的发作间期脑电图是可用于鉴别诊断的体征。

HP:0002373.name: Febrile seizure (within the age range of 3 months to 6 years)
HP:0002373.definition: A febrile seizure is any type of seizure (most often a generalized tonic-clonic seizure) occurring with fever (at least 38 degrees Celsius) but in the absence of central nervous system infection, severe metabolic disturbance or other alternative precipitant in children between the ages of 3 months and 6 years.
HP:0002373.name_cn: 热性惊厥（年龄范围：3个月至6岁）
HP:0002373.definition_cn: 热性惊厥是指在3个月至6岁儿童中，伴随发热（至少38摄氏度）但无中枢神经系统感染、严重代谢紊乱或其他明确诱因的情况下发生的任何类型的惊厥（最常见为全面性强直-阵挛发作）。

HP:0002375.name: Hypokinesia
HP:0002375.definition: Abnormally diminished motor activity. In contrast to paralysis, hypokinesia is not characterized by a lack of motor strength, but rather by a poverty of movement. The typical habitual movements (e.g., folding the arms, crossing the legs) are reduced in frequency.
HP:0002375.definition_cn: 运动活动异常减少。与瘫痪不同，运动功能减退（Hypokinesia）并非以运动力量缺乏为特征，而是表现为运动贫乏。典型的习惯性动作（如交叉双臂、交叉双腿）频率降低。

HP:0002376.name: Developmental regression
HP:0002376.definition: Loss of developmental skills, as manifested by loss of developmental milestones.
HP:0002376.definition_cn: 发育技能丧失，表现为发育里程碑的丧失。

HP:0002377.name: obsolete Paraganglioma-related cranial nerve palsy
HP:0002377.name_cn: 过时的副神经节瘤相关颅神经麻痹

HP:0002378.name: Hand tremor
HP:0002378.definition: An unintentional, oscillating to-and-fro muscle movement affecting the hand.
HP:0002378.definition_cn: 不自主性、振荡性来回肌肉运动，累及手部。

HP:0002380.name: Fasciculations
HP:0002380.definition: Fasciculations are observed as small, local, involuntary muscle contractions (twitching) visible under the skin. Fasciculations result from increased irritability of an axon (which in turn is often a manifestation of disease of a motor neuron). This leads to sporadic discharges of all the muscle fibers controlled by the axon in isolation from other motor units.
HP:0002380.definition_cn: 肌束震颤表现为皮肤下可见的小范围、局部、不自主的肌肉收缩（抽搐）。肌束震颤是由于轴突的兴奋性增加所致（这通常是运动神经元疾病的表现）。这导致由该轴突控制的所有肌纤维在与其他运动单位隔离的情况下发生散发性放电。

HP:0002381.name: Aphasia
HP:0002381.definition: An acquired language impairment of some or all of the abilities to produce or comprehend speech and to read or write.
HP:0002381.definition_cn: 获得性语言障碍，表现为部分或全部言语产生、理解、阅读或书写能力的损害。

HP:0002383.name: Infectious encephalitis
HP:0002383.definition: A disorder of the brain caused by an infectious agent that presents with fever, headache, and an altered level of consciousness. There may also be focal or multifocal neurologic deficits, and focal or generalized seizure activity.
HP:0002383.definition_cn: 由感染因子引起的脑部疾病，表现为发热、头痛和意识水平改变。可能还伴有局灶性或多灶性神经功能缺损，以及局灶性或全身性癫痫发作活动。

HP:0002384.name: Focal impaired awareness seizure
HP:0002384.definition: Focal impaired awareness seizure (or focal seizure with impaired or lost awareness) is a type of focal-onset seizure characterized by some degree (which may be partial) of impairment of the person's awareness of themselves or their surroundings at any point during the seizure.
HP:0002384.name_cn: 局灶性意识障碍性癫痫发作
HP:0002384.definition_cn: 局灶性意识障碍性发作（或伴有意识障碍或丧失的局灶性发作）是一种局灶起始性发作，其特征是在发作期间的任何时刻，患者对自身或周围环境的意识存在一定程度的（可能是部分的）损害。

HP:0002385.name: Paraparesis
HP:0002385.definition: Weakness or partial paralysis in the lower limbs.

HP:0002389.name: Cavum septum pellucidum
HP:0002389.definition: If the two laminae of the septum pellucidum are not fused then a fluid-filled space or cavum is present. The cavum septum pellucidum is present at birth but usually obliterates by the age of 3 to 6 months. It is up to 1cm in width and the walls are parallel. It is an enclosed space and is not part of the ventricular system or connected with the subarachnoid space.
HP:0002389.definition_cn: 如果透明隔的两层未融合，则存在一个充满液体的空间或腔隙。透明隔腔在出生时即存在，但通常在3至6个月大时闭合。其宽度可达1厘米，壁呈平行状。它是一个封闭的空间，不属于脑室系统，也不与蛛网膜下腔相连。

HP:0002392.name: EEG with polyspike wave complexes
HP:0002392.definition: The presence of complexes of repetitive spikes and waves in EEG.
HP:0002392.name_cn: 脑电图显示多棘慢波复合波
HP:0002392.definition_cn: 脑电图（EEG）中可见重复性棘慢波复合波。

HP:0002395.name: Lower limb hyperreflexia
HP:0002395.definition: Increased intensity of the a reflex in the leg.

HP:0002396.name: Cogwheel rigidity
HP:0002396.definition: A type of rigidity in which a muscle responds with cogwheellike jerks to the use of constant force in bending the limb (i.e., it gives way in little, repeated jerks when the muscle is passively stretched).
HP:0002396.definition_cn: 一种肌强直类型，表现为在持续用力弯曲肢体时，肌肉出现齿轮样震颤（即当肌肉被动拉伸时，以小幅、重复的震颤方式松弛）。

HP:0002401.name: Stroke-like episode
HP:0002401.definition: No consensus exists on what a stroke-like episode is, but these episodes can be functionally defined as a new neurological deficit, occurring with or without the context of seizures, which last longer than 24 hours.
HP:0002401.definition_cn: 关于卒中样发作的定义尚未达成共识，但这些发作在功能上可定义为一种新的神经功能缺损，无论是否在癫痫发作的背景下发生，且持续时间超过24小时。

HP:0002403.name: Positive Romberg sign
HP:0002403.definition: The patient stands with the feet placed together and balance and is asked to close his or her eyes. A loss of balance upon eye closure is a positive Romberg sign and is interpreted as indicating a deficit in proprioception.
HP:0002403.definition_cn: 患者双足并拢站立并保持平衡，随后被要求闭眼。闭眼后出现平衡丧失即为罗姆伯格征阳性，提示本体感觉功能障碍。

HP:0002404.name: Thickened superior cerebellar peduncle
HP:0002404.definition: Increased width of the superior cerebellar peduncle.

HP:0002406.name: Limb dysmetria
HP:0002406.definition: A type of dysmetria involving the limbs.
HP:0002406.definition_cn: 一种涉及肢体的运动失调类型。

HP:0002408.name: Cerebral arteriovenous malformation
HP:0002408.definition: An anomalous configuration of blood vessels that shunts arterial blood directly into veins without passing through the capillaries and that is located in the brain.
HP:0002408.definition_cn: 一种异常的血管构型，其将动脉血直接分流至静脉，而不经过毛细血管，且位于脑内。

HP:0002410.name: Aqueductal stenosis
HP:0002410.definition: Stenosis of the cerebral aqueduct (also known as the mesencephalic duct, aqueductus mesencephali, or aqueduct of Sylvius), which connects the third cerebral ventricle in the diencephalon to the fourth ventricle, which is between the pons and cerebellum.
HP:0002410.definition_cn: 中脑导水管狭窄（也称为中脑水管、中脑导水管或西尔维厄斯导水管），该结构连接间脑中的第三脑室与位于脑桥和小脑之间的第四脑室。

HP:0002411.name: Myokymia
HP:0002411.definition: Myokymia consists of involuntary, fine, continuous, undulating contractions that spread across the affected striated muscle.
HP:0002411.definition_cn: 肌纤维颤搐（Myokymia）表现为不自主的、细微的、连续的、波浪状的收缩，并扩散至受累的横纹肌。

HP:0002414.name: Spina bifida
HP:0002414.definition: Incomplete closure of the embryonic neural tube, whereby some vertebral arches remain unfused and open. The mildest form is spina bifida occulta, followed by meningocele and meningomyelocele.
HP:0002414.definition_cn: 胚胎神经管闭合不全，导致部分椎弓未融合并保持开放。最轻微的形式为隐性脊柱裂，其次是脊膜膨出和脊髓脊膜膨出。

HP:0002415.name: Leukodystrophy
HP:0002415.definition: Leukodystrophy refers to deterioration of white matter of the brain resulting from degeneration of myelin sheaths in the CNS. Their basic defect is directly related to the synthesis and maintenance of myelin membranes. Symmetric white matter involvement at MRI is a typical finding in patients with leukodystrophies.
HP:0002415.definition_cn: 脑白质营养不良是指由于中枢神经系统髓鞘退化导致的脑白质退化。其基本缺陷直接与髓鞘膜的合成和维持相关。在磁共振成像中，对称性白质受累是脑白质营养不良患者的典型表现。

HP:0002416.name: Subependymal cysts
HP:0002416.definition: Cerebral cysts, usually located in the wall of the caudate nucleus or in the caudothalamic groove. They are found in up to 5.2% of all neonates, using transfontanellar ultrasound in the first days of life.
HP:0002416.definition_cn: 脑囊肿，通常位于尾状核壁或尾状核丘脑沟内。通过生后数日内经囟门超声检查，在所有新生儿中的发现率高达5.2%。

HP:0002418.name: Abnormal midbrain morphology
HP:0002418.definition: An abnormality of the midbrain, which has as its parts the tectum, cerebral peduncle, midbrain tegmentum and cerebral aqueduct.
HP:0002418.definition_cn: 中脑异常，其组成部分包括顶盖、大脑脚、中脑被盖和大脑导水管。

HP:0002419.name: Molar tooth sign on MRI
HP:0002419.definition: An abnormal appearance of the midbrain in axial magnetic resonance imaging in which the elongated superior cerebellar peduncles give the midbrain an appearance reminiscent of a molar or wisdom tooth.
HP:0002419.name_cn: 磁共振成像中的磨牙征
HP:0002419.definition_cn: 中脑在轴向磁共振成像中的异常表现，其中延长的上小脑脚使中脑呈现出类似于磨牙或智齿的外观。

HP:0002421.name: Poor head control
HP:0002421.definition: Difficulty to maintain correct position of the head while standing or sitting. Infant head lag is observed when the head seems to flop around or lags posteriorly behind the trunk. Several articles have maintained that head lag should be absent by age 3 to 4 months.
HP:0002421.definition_cn: 在站立或坐位时难以维持头部正确位置。婴儿头部滞后表现为头部似乎松软无力或滞后于躯干后方。多篇文献指出，头部滞后现象应在3至4月龄时消失。

HP:0002423.name: Long-tract sign
HP:0002423.definition: Long-tract signs refer to symptoms that are attributable to the involvement of the long fiber tracts in the spinal cord, which connect the spinal cord to the brain and mediate spinal and motor functions. These include spasticity, hyperreflexia, and abnormal reflexes such as Babinski or Hoffman's sign. If possible, it is preferable to use the precise HPO terms for these abnormalities.
HP:0002423.definition_cn: 长束征（Long-tract signs）是指由于脊髓中长纤维束受累而引发的症状，这些纤维束连接脊髓与大脑，并介导感觉和运动功能。这些症状包括痉挛（spasticity）、反射亢进（hyperreflexia）以及异常反射，如巴宾斯基征（Babinski sign）或霍夫曼征（Hoffman's sign）。如有可能，建议使用精确的人类表型本体（HPO）术语来描述这些异常。

HP:0002425.name: Anarthria
HP:0002425.definition: A defect in the motor ability that enables speech.
HP:0002425.definition_cn: 运动性言语障碍（Motor Speech Disorder）

HP:0002427.name: Expressive aphasia
HP:0002427.definition: Impairment of expressive language and relative preservation of receptive language abilities. That is, the patient understands language (speech, writing) but cannot express it.
HP:0002427.definition_cn: 表达性语言障碍及相对保留的接受性语言能力。即患者理解语言（言语、书写）但无法表达。

HP:0002435.name: Meningocele
HP:0002435.definition: Protrusion of the meninges through a defect of the skull or vertebral column.
HP:0002435.definition_cn: 脑膜通过颅骨或脊柱缺损处突出。

HP:0002436.name: Occipital meningocele
HP:0002436.definition: A herniation of meninges through a congenital bone defect in the skull in the occipital region.
HP:0002436.definition_cn: 枕骨区先天性颅骨缺损导致的脑膜膨出。

HP:0002442.name: Dyscalculia
HP:0002442.definition: A specific learning disability involving mathematics and arithmetic.
HP:0002442.definition_cn: 特定学习障碍中的数学障碍（Dyscalculia）。

HP:0002444.name: Hypothalamic hamartoma
HP:0002444.definition: The presence of a hamartoma of the hypothalamus.

HP:0002445.name: Tetraplegia
HP:0002445.definition: Paralysis of all four limbs, and trunk of the body below the level of an associated injury to the spinal cord. The etiology of quadriplegia is similar to that of paraplegia except that the lesion is in the cervical spinal cord rather than in the thoracic or lumbar segments of the spinal cord.
HP:0002445.definition_cn: 四肢及躯干在脊髓损伤平面以下的完全瘫痪。四肢瘫痪的病因与截瘫相似，但病变位于颈段脊髓而非胸段或腰段脊髓。

HP:0002446.name: Astrocytosis
HP:0002446.definition: Proliferation of astrocytes in the area of a lesion of the central nervous system.
HP:0002446.definition_cn: 中枢神经系统病变区域的星形胶质细胞增殖。

HP:0002450.name: Abnormal motor neuron morphology
HP:0002450.definition: Any structural anomaly that affects the motor neuron.
HP:0002450.name_cn: 异常运动神经元形态学
HP:0002450.definition_cn: 影响运动神经元的任何结构性异常。

HP:0002451.name: Limb dystonia
HP:0002451.definition: A type of dystonia (abnormally increased muscular tone causing fixed abnormal postures) that affects muscles of the limbs.
HP:0002451.definition_cn: 一种影响肢体肌肉的肌张力障碍（异常增高的肌张力导致固定的异常姿势）。

HP:0002453.name: Abnormal globus pallidus morphology
HP:0002453.definition: An abnormality of the globus pallidus.

HP:0002454.name: Eye of the tiger anomaly of globus pallidus
HP:0002454.definition: The presence, on T2-weighted magnetic resonance imaging, of markedly low signal intensity of the globus pallidus that surrounds a central region of high signal intensity in the anteromedial globus pallidus, producing an eye-of-the-tiger appearance. The sign is thought to represent iron accumulation in the globus pallidus.
HP:0002454.definition_cn: 在T2加权磁共振成像中，苍白球呈现显著低信号强度，其中心区域在苍白球前内侧呈现高信号强度，形成“虎眼征”。该征象被认为代表苍白球内铁质沉积。

HP:0002459.name: obsolete Dysautonomia
HP:0002459.name_cn: 过时的自主神经功能障碍

HP:0002460.name: Distal muscle weakness
HP:0002460.definition: Reduced strength of the musculature of the distal extremities.

HP:0002461.name: Cerebellar dentate nucleus calcification
HP:0002461.definition: Pathological deposition of calcium salts in the dentate nucleus of the cerebellum.
HP:0002461.definition_cn: 小脑齿状核内钙盐的病理性沉积。

HP:0002463.name: Language impairment
HP:0002463.definition: Language impairment is a deficit in comprehension or production of language that includes reduced vocabulary, limited sentence structure, or impairments in written or spoken communication. Language abilities are substantially and quantifiably below age expectations.
HP:0002463.definition_cn: 语言障碍是指在语言理解或表达方面存在缺陷，包括词汇量减少、句子结构受限或书面及口头交流能力受损。语言能力显著且可量化地低于年龄预期水平。

HP:0002464.name: Spastic dysarthria
HP:0002464.definition: A type of dysarthria related to bilateral damage of the upper motor neuron tracts of the pyramidal and extra- pyramidal tracts. Speech of affected individuals is slow, effortful, and has a harsh vocal quality.
HP:0002464.definition_cn: 一种与双侧上运动神经元束（包括锥体束和锥体外束）损伤相关的构音障碍。患者的言语表现为缓慢、费力，且伴有粗糙的嗓音质量。

HP:0002470.name: Nonprogressive cerebellar ataxia
HP:0002470.name_cn: 非进行性小脑性共济失调

HP:0002472.name: Small cerebral cortex
HP:0002472.definition: Reduced size of the cerebral cortex.

HP:0002474.name: Expressive language delay
HP:0002474.definition: A delay in the acquisition of the ability to use language to communicate needs, wishes, or thoughts.
HP:0002474.definition_cn: 语言交流能力发育迟缓

HP:0002475.name: Myelomeningocele
HP:0002475.definition: Protrusion of the meninges and portions of the spinal cord through a defect of the vertebral column.
HP:0002475.definition_cn: 脑膜和部分脊髓通过脊柱缺损处突出。

HP:0002476.name: Primitive reflex
HP:0002476.definition: The primitive reflexes are a group of behavioral motor responses which are found in normal early development, are subsequently inhibited, but may be released from inhibition by cerebral, usually frontal, damage. They are thus part of a broader group of reflexes which reflect release phenomena, such as exaggerated stretch reflexes and extensor plantars. They do however involve more complex motor responses than such simple stretch reflexes, and are often a normal feature in the neonate or infant.
HP:0002476.definition_cn: 原始反射是一组在正常早期发育中出现的行为性运动反应，随后被抑制，但可能因大脑（通常为额叶）损伤而解除抑制。因此，它们属于反映释放现象的更广泛反射群的一部分，例如夸大的牵张反射和伸肌跖反射。然而，与这些简单的牵张反射相比，原始反射涉及更复杂的运动反应，并且通常是新生儿或婴儿的正常特征。

HP:0002478.name: Progressive spastic quadriplegia
HP:0002478.name_cn: 进行性痉挛性四肢瘫痪

HP:0002480.name: Hepatic encephalopathy
HP:0002480.definition: Central nervous system dysfunction in association with liver failure and characterized clinically (depending on degree of severity) by lethargy, confusion, nystagmus, decorticate posturing, spasticity, and bilateral Babinski reflexes.
HP:0002480.definition_cn: 与肝功能衰竭相关的中枢神经系统功能障碍，临床特征（根据严重程度）表现为嗜睡、意识模糊、眼球震颤、去皮质强直、痉挛状态及双侧巴宾斯基征阳性。

HP:0002486.name: Myotonia
HP:0002486.definition: An involuntary and painless delay in the relaxation of skeletal muscle following contraction or electrical stimulation.
HP:0002486.definition_cn: 骨骼肌在收缩或电刺激后出现无意识且无痛性的松弛延迟。

HP:0002487.name: Hyperkinetic movements
HP:0002487.definition: Motor hyperactivity with excessive movement of muscles of the body as a whole.
HP:0002487.definition_cn: 全身性肌肉运动过度的运动性多动症。

HP:0002488.name: Acute leukemia
HP:0002488.definition: A clonal (malignant) hematopoietic disorder with an acute onset, affecting the bone marrow and the peripheral blood. The malignant cells show minimal differentiation and are called blasts, either myeloid blasts (myeloblasts) or lymphoid blasts (lymphoblasts).
HP:0002488.definition_cn: 一种克隆性（恶性）造血系统疾病，呈急性起病，累及骨髓和外周血。恶性细胞显示极低分化，称为原始细胞，包括髓系原始细胞（原始粒细胞）或淋巴系原始细胞（原始淋巴细胞）。

HP:0002490.name: Increased CSF lactate
HP:0002490.definition: Increased concentration of lactate in the cerebrospinal fluid.
HP:0002490.definition_cn: 脑脊液中乳酸浓度升高。

HP:0002491.name: Spasticity of facial muscles
HP:0002491.definition: Spasticity of one or more muscles innervated by the facial nerve.
HP:0002491.definition_cn: 由面神经支配的一块或多块肌肉的痉挛。

HP:0002492.name: Abnormal corticospinal tract morphology
HP:0002492.definition: Abnormality of the corticospinal tract, which is the chief element of the pyramidal system (the principle motor tract) and is the only direct connection between the cerebrum and the spinal cord.
HP:0002492.definition_cn: 皮质脊髓束异常，其为锥体系（主要运动传导通路）的主要组成部分，并且是大脑与脊髓之间唯一的直接连接。

HP:0002493.name: Upper motor neuron dysfunction
HP:0002493.definition: A functional anomaly of the upper motor neuron. The upper motor neurons are neurons of the primary motor cortex which project to the brainstem and spinal chord via the corticonuclear, corticobulbar and corticospinal (pyramidal) tracts. They are involved in control of voluntary movements. Dysfunction leads to weakness, impairment of fine motor movements, spasticity, hyperreflexia and abnormal pyramidal signs.
HP:0002493.name_cn: 上运动神经元功能障碍
HP:0002493.definition_cn: 上运动神经元功能异常。上运动神经元是位于初级运动皮层的神经元，通过皮质核束、皮质延髓束和皮质脊髓束（锥体束）投射至脑干和脊髓。它们参与调控随意运动。功能障碍可导致肌力减弱、精细运动受损、痉挛、反射亢进以及锥体束征异常。

HP:0002494.name: Abnormal rapid eye movement sleep
HP:0002494.definition: Abnormality of REM Sleep are phases of REM sleep are characterized by desynchronized EEG patterns, increases in heart rate and blood pressure, sympathetic activation, and a profound loss of muscle tone except for the eye and middle-ear muscles. There are also phases of rapid eye movements.
HP:0002494.definition_cn: 快速眼动睡眠异常表现为脑电图去同步化模式、心率和血压升高、交感神经激活，以及除眼肌和中耳肌外全身肌肉张力显著降低。同时伴有快速眼球运动阶段。

HP:0002495.name: Impaired vibratory sensation
HP:0002495.definition: A decrease in the ability to perceive vibration. Clinically, this is usually tested with a tuning fork which vibrates at 128 Hz and is applied to bony prominences such as the malleoli at the ankles or the metacarpal-phalangeal joints. There is a slow decay of vibration from the tuning fork. The degree of vibratory sense loss can be crudely estimated by counting the number of seconds that the examiner can perceive the vibration longer than the patient.
HP:0002495.definition_cn: 振动感知能力下降。临床上，通常使用频率为128赫兹的音叉进行测试，将其置于骨性突起处，如踝部的内踝或掌指关节。音叉的振动会缓慢衰减。通过计算检查者比患者感知振动时间长的秒数，可以粗略估计振动觉丧失的程度。

HP:0002500.name: Abnormal cerebral white matter morphology
HP:0002500.definition: An abnormality of the cerebral white matter.

HP:0002504.name: Calcification of the small brain vessels
HP:0002504.definition: Deposition of calcium salts within small blood vessels of the brain.

HP:0002505.name: Loss of ambulation
HP:0002505.definition: Inability to walk in a person who previous had the ability to walk.
HP:0002505.definition_cn: 既往具备行走能力的患者出现行走功能障碍。

HP:0002506.name: Diffuse cerebral atrophy
HP:0002506.definition: Diffuse unlocalised atrophy affecting the cerebrum.
HP:0002506.definition_cn: 弥漫性非局限性大脑萎缩。

HP:0002507.name: Semilobar holoprosencephaly
HP:0002507.definition: A type of holoprosencephaly in which the left and right frontal and parietal lobes are fused and the interhemispheric fissure is only present posteriorly.
HP:0002507.definition_cn: 一种全前脑畸形，其中左右额叶和顶叶融合，半球间裂仅在后部存在。

HP:0002508.name: Brainstem dysplasia
HP:0002508.definition: A developmental structural anomaly of the stalk-like part of the brain that comprises the midbrain (aka mesencephalon), the pons (aka pons Varolii), and the medulla oblongata, and connects the cerebral hemispheres with the cervical spinal cord.
HP:0002508.definition_cn: 脑干发育性结构异常，包括中脑（即mesencephalon）、脑桥（即pons Varolii）和延髓（即medulla oblongata），并连接大脑半球与颈段脊髓。

HP:0002510.name: Spastic tetraplegia
HP:0002510.definition: Spastic paralysis affecting all four limbs.

HP:0002511.name: Alzheimer disease
HP:0002511.definition: A degenerative disease of the brain characterized by the insidious onset of dementia. Impairment of memory, judgment, attention span, and problem solving skills are followed by severe apraxia and a global loss of cognitive abilities. The condition primarily occurs after age 60, and is marked pathologically by severe cortical atrophy and the triad of senile plaques, neurofibrillary tangles, and neuropil threads.
HP:0002511.definition_cn: 一种以隐匿性起病的痴呆为特征的脑部退行性疾病。表现为记忆力、判断力、注意力及问题解决能力受损，随后出现严重的失用症及全面的认知功能丧失。该病主要发生于60岁以后，病理学特征为严重的皮质萎缩及老年斑、神经原纤维缠结和神经毡细丝三联征。

HP:0002514.name: Cerebral calcification
HP:0002514.definition: The presence of calcium deposition within the cerebrum.

HP:0002515.name: Waddling gait
HP:0002515.definition: Weakness of the hip girdle and upper thigh muscles, for instance in myopathies, leads to an instability of the pelvis on standing and walking. If the muscles extending the hip joint are affected, the posture in that joint becomes flexed and lumbar lordosis increases. The patients usually have difficulties standing up from a sitting position. Due to weakness in the gluteus medius muscle, the hip on the side of the swinging leg drops with each step (referred to as Trendelenburg sign). The gait appears waddling. The patients frequently attempt to counteract the dropping of the hip on the swinging side by bending the trunk towards the side which is in the stance phase (in the German language literature this is referred to as Duchenne sign). Similar gait patterns can be caused by orthopedic conditions when the origin and the insertion site of the gluteus medius muscle are closer to each other than normal, for instance due to a posttraumatic elevation of the trochanter or pseudarthrosis of the femoral neck.
HP:0002515.definition_cn: 髋带及大腿上部肌群无力，例如在肌病中，会导致站立和行走时骨盆不稳定。如果髋关节伸肌受累，该关节的姿势会呈现屈曲状态，腰椎前凸增加。患者通常难以从坐位站起。由于臀中肌无力，摆动腿侧的髋部在每一步中都会下垂（称为Trendelenburg征）。步态呈现蹒跚状。患者常试图通过将躯干向支撑腿侧弯曲来对抗摆动侧的髋部下垂（在德语文献中称为Duchenne征）。类似的步态模式也可能由骨科疾病引起，当臀中肌的起点和止点比正常情况更接近时，例如由于创伤后大转子抬高或股骨颈假关节形成。

HP:0002516.name: Increased intracranial pressure
HP:0002516.definition: An increase of the pressure inside the cranium (skull) and thereby in the brain tissue and cerebrospinal fluid.
HP:0002516.definition_cn: 颅内压增高，进而导致脑组织及脑脊液压力的升高。

HP:0002518.name: Abnormal periventricular white matter morphology
HP:0002518.definition: A structural abnormality of the myelinated axons (white matter) located near the cerebral ventricles.
HP:0002518.name_cn: 脑室周围白质形态异常
HP:0002518.definition_cn: 脑室周围髓鞘化轴突（白质）的结构异常。

HP:0002519.name: Hypnagogic hallucination
HP:0002519.definition: Hypnagogic hallucinations are brief hallucinations that occur as you are falling asleep.
HP:0002519.definition_cn: 入睡前幻觉是指在入睡过程中出现的短暂幻觉。

HP:0002521.name: Hypsarrhythmia
HP:0002521.definition: Hypsarrhythmia is abnormal interictal high amplitude waves and a background of irregular spikes. There is continuous (during wakefulness), high-amplitude (>200 Hz), generalized polymorphic slowing with no organized background and multifocal spikes demonstrated by electroencephalography (EEG).
HP:0002521.definition_cn: 高峰节律紊乱（Hypsarrhythmia）是一种异常发作间期高振幅波，背景为不规则尖波。在清醒状态下，脑电图（EEG）显示为持续性的高振幅（>200 Hz）、广泛性多形性慢波，背景无组织性，并伴有多个病灶的尖波。

HP:0002522.name: Areflexia of lower limbs
HP:0002522.definition: Inability to elicit tendon reflexes in the lower limbs.

HP:0002524.name: Cataplexy
HP:0002524.definition: A sudden and transient episode of bilateral loss of muscle tone, often triggered by emotions.
HP:0002524.definition_cn: 突发性短暂性双侧肌张力丧失，常由情绪诱发。

HP:0002526.name: Deficit in nonword repetition
HP:0002526.definition: Impaired ability to repeat non-word sounds. Nonword repetition (NWR) is a measure of short-term phonological memory.
HP:0002526.definition_cn: 非词语重复能力受损。非词语重复（Nonword Repetition, NWR）是评估短期语音记忆的一项指标。

HP:0002528.name: Granulovacuolar degeneration
HP:0002528.definition: Electron-dense granules within double membrane-bound cytoplasmic vacuoles.
HP:0002528.definition_cn: 双膜包被的胞质空泡内的电子致密颗粒。

HP:0002529.name: Neuronal loss in central nervous system
HP:0002529.name_cn: 中枢神经系统神经元丧失

HP:0002530.name: Axial dystonia
HP:0002530.definition: A type of dystonia that affects the midline muscles, i.e., the chest, abdominal, and back muscles.
HP:0002530.definition_cn: 一种影响中线肌肉（即胸部、腹部和背部肌肉）的肌张力障碍类型。

HP:0002533.name: Abnormal posturing
HP:0002533.definition: Involuntary flexion or extension of the arms and legs.
HP:0002533.definition_cn: 不自主性上肢及下肢屈曲或伸展。

HP:0002536.name: Abnormal cortical gyration
HP:0002536.definition: An abnormality of the gyri (i.e., the ridges) of the cerebral cortex of the brain.
HP:0002536.definition_cn: 大脑皮层脑回（即脑沟）异常。

HP:0002538.name: Abnormal cerebral cortex morphology
HP:0002538.definition: Any structural abnormality of the cerebral cortex.

HP:0002539.name: Cortical dysplasia
HP:0002539.definition: The presence of developmental dysplasia of the cerebral cortex.
HP:0002539.definition_cn: 大脑皮质发育不良的存在。

HP:0002542.name: Olivopontocerebellar atrophy
HP:0002542.definition: Neuronal degeneration in the cerebellum, pontine nuclei, and inferior olivary nucleus.
HP:0002542.definition_cn: 小脑、脑桥核和下橄榄核的神经元变性。

HP:0002544.name: Retrocollis
HP:0002544.definition: A form of torticollis in which the head is drawn back, either due to a permanent contractures of neck extensor muscles, or to a spasmodic contracture.
HP:0002544.definition_cn: 一种斜颈形式，表现为头部后仰，可能是由于颈部伸肌的永久性挛缩或痉挛性挛缩所致。

HP:0002545.name: Patchy demyelination of subcortical white matter
HP:0002545.definition: Patchy loss of myelin from nerve fibers in the central nervous system.
HP:0002545.name_cn: 皮质下白质斑片状脱髓鞘
HP:0002545.definition_cn: 中枢神经系统神经纤维的斑片状脱髓鞘。

HP:0002548.name: Parkinsonism with favorable response to dopaminergic medication
HP:0002548.definition: Parkinsonism is a clinical syndrome that is a feature of a number of different diseases, including Parkinson disease itself, other neurodegenerative diseases such as progressive supranuclear palsy, and as a side-effect of some neuroleptic medications. Some but not all individuals with Parkinsonism show responsiveness to dopaminergic medication defined as a substantial reduction of amelioration of the component signs of Parkinsonism (including mainly tremor, bradykinesia, rigidity, and postural instability) upon administration of dopaminergic medication.
HP:0002548.name_cn: 对多巴胺能药物反应良好的帕金森综合征
HP:0002548.definition_cn: 帕金森综合征是一种临床综合征，是多种不同疾病的特征，包括帕金森病本身、其他神经退行性疾病（如进行性核上性麻痹）以及某些抗精神病药物的副作用。并非所有帕金森综合征患者对多巴胺能药物均表现出反应性，反应性定义为在多巴胺能药物给药后，帕金森综合征的主要症状（主要包括震颤、运动迟缓、肌强直和姿势不稳）显著减轻或改善。

HP:0002549.name: Deficit in phonologic short-term memory
HP:0002549.definition: Impaired ability to repeat non-word sounds. The test for nonword repetition involves the repetition of nonsensical words of increasing length and complexity and is regarded as a measure of phonological (speech sound) processing and short-term memory
HP:0002549.definition_cn: 非词重复能力受损。非词重复测试涉及对长度和复杂性逐渐增加的无意义词汇进行重复，该测试被视为语音（语音）处理和短期记忆的评估指标。

HP:0002553.name: Highly arched eyebrow
HP:0002553.definition: Increased height of the central portion of the eyebrow, forming a crescent, semicircular, or inverted U shape.
HP:0002553.definition_cn: 眉弓中央部分高度增加，形成新月形、半圆形或倒U形。

HP:0002557.name: Hypoplastic nipples
HP:0002557.definition_cn: 乳头发育不全（Hypoplasia of the nipple）。

HP:0002558.name: Supernumerary nipple
HP:0002558.definition: Presence of more than two nipples.

HP:0002561.name: Absent nipple
HP:0002561.definition: Congenital failure to develop, and absence of, the nipple.
HP:0002561.definition_cn: 先天性乳头发育不全及缺失。

HP:0002562.name: Low-set nipples
HP:0002562.definition: Placement of the nipples at a lower than normal location.

HP:0002563.name: Constrictive pericarditis
HP:0002563.definition: Presence of a thickened, fibrotic pericardium that forms a non-compliant shell around the heart, and resulting from chronic inflammation of the pericardium.
HP:0002563.definition_cn: 存在增厚、纤维化的心包，形成围绕心脏的非顺应性外壳，由心包慢性炎症所致。

HP:0002564.name: obsolete Malformation of the heart and great vessels
HP:0002564.name_cn: 先天性心脏及大血管畸形

HP:0002566.name: Intestinal malrotation
HP:0002566.definition: An abnormality of the intestinal rotation and fixation that normally occurs during the development of the gut. This can lead to volvulus, or twisting of the intestine that causes obstruction and necrosis.
HP:0002566.definition_cn: 肠道旋转和固定异常，通常发生在肠道发育过程中。这可能导致肠扭转，即肠道扭转引起梗阻和坏死。

HP:0002570.name: Steatorrhea
HP:0002570.definition: Greater than normal amounts of fat in the feces. This is a result of malabsorption of lipids in the small intestine and results in frothy foul-smelling fecal matter that floats.
HP:0002570.definition_cn: 粪便中脂肪含量高于正常水平。这是由于小肠对脂质吸收不良所致，导致粪便呈泡沫状、恶臭且漂浮。

HP:0002571.name: Achalasia
HP:0002571.definition: A disorder of esophageal motility characterized by the inability of the lower esophageal sphincter to relax during swallowing and by inadequate or lacking peristalsis in the lower half of the body of the esophagus.
HP:0002571.definition_cn: 一种食管动力障碍，其特征为吞咽时下食管括约肌无法松弛，且食管体部下半段蠕动不足或缺失。

HP:0002572.name: Episodic vomiting
HP:0002572.definition_cn: 阵发性、复发性呕吐发作。

HP:0002573.name: Hematochezia
HP:0002573.definition: The passage of fresh (red) blood per anus, usually in or with stools. Most rectal bleeding comes from the colon, rectum, or anus.
HP:0002573.definition_cn: 经肛门排出新鲜（红色）血液，通常与粪便混合或伴随粪便排出。大多数直肠出血源自结肠、直肠或肛门。

HP:0002574.name: Episodic abdominal pain
HP:0002574.definition: An intermittent form of abdominal pain.

HP:0002575.name: Tracheoesophageal fistula
HP:0002575.definition: An abnormal connection (fistula) between the esophagus and the trachea.

HP:0002576.name: Intussusception
HP:0002576.definition: An abnormality of the intestine in which part of the intestine invaginates (telescopes) into another part of the intestine.
HP:0002576.definition_cn: 一种肠道异常，其中部分肠段套叠（如望远镜般）进入另一部分肠段。

HP:0002578.name: Gastroparesis
HP:0002578.definition: Decreased strength of the muscle layer of stomach, which leads to a decreased ability to empty the contents of the stomach despite the absence of obstruction.
HP:0002578.definition_cn: 胃肌层收缩力减弱，导致胃排空能力下降，但无梗阻存在。

HP:0002579.name: Gastrointestinal dysmotility
HP:0002579.definition: Abnormal intestinal contractions, such as spasms and intestinal paralysis, related to the loss of the ability of the gut to coordinate muscular activity because of endogenous or exogenous causes.
HP:0002579.definition_cn: 肠道运动功能障碍，如痉挛性肠梗阻和麻痹性肠梗阻，与因内源性或外源性因素导致的肠道肌肉活动协调能力丧失相关。

HP:0002580.name: Volvulus
HP:0002580.definition: Abnormal twisting of a portion of intestine around itself or around a stalk of mesentery tissue.
HP:0002580.definition_cn: 肠段自身或围绕肠系膜组织蒂的异常扭转。

HP:0002582.name: Atrophic gastritis
HP:0002582.definition: Atrophic gastritis (AG) is a histopathological entity that is characterized by chronic inflammation of the gastric mucosa with loss of gastric glandular cells and replacement by intestinal-type epithelium, pyloric-type glands, and fibrous tissue.
HP:0002582.definition_cn: 萎缩性胃炎（Atrophic Gastritis, AG）是一种组织病理学实体，其特征为胃黏膜的慢性炎症伴随胃腺细胞的丧失，并被肠型上皮、幽门型腺体及纤维组织所替代。

HP:0002583.name: Colitis
HP:0002583.definition: Colitis refers to an inflammation of the colon and is often used to describe an inflammation of the large intestine (colon, cecum and rectum). Colitides may be acute and self-limited or chronic, and broadly fit into the category of digestive diseases.
HP:0002583.definition_cn: 结肠炎（Colitis）是指结肠的炎症，通常用于描述大肠（包括结肠、盲肠和直肠）的炎症。结肠炎可分为急性自限性和慢性两种，广泛归类于消化系统疾病范畴。

HP:0002587.name: Projectile vomiting
HP:0002587.definition: Vomiting that ejects the gastric contents with great force.

HP:0002588.name: Duodenal ulcer
HP:0002588.definition: An erosion of the mucous membrane in a portion of the duodenum.
HP:0002588.definition_cn: 十二指肠部分黏膜糜烂。

HP:0002591.name: Polyphagia
HP:0002591.definition: A neurological anomaly with gross overeating associated with an abnormally strong desire or need to eat.
HP:0002591.definition_cn: 一种神经性异常，表现为极度暴食，伴随异常强烈的进食欲望或需求。

HP:0002592.name: Gastric ulcer
HP:0002592.definition: An ulcer, that is, an erosion of an area of the gastric mucous membrane.
HP:0002592.definition_cn: 溃疡，即胃黏膜区域糜烂。

HP:0002593.name: Intestinal lymphangiectasia
HP:0002593.definition: Angiectasia of lymph vessels (i.e., dilatation of lymphatic vessels) in the intestines.
HP:0002593.definition_cn: 肠道淋巴管扩张症（即淋巴管扩张）。

HP:0002595.name: Ileus
HP:0002595.definition: Acute obstruction of the intestines preventing passage of the contents of the intestines.
HP:0002595.definition_cn: 急性肠梗阻导致肠内容物通过受阻。

HP:0002599.name: Head titubation
HP:0002599.definition: A head tremor of moderate speed (3 to 4 Hz) in the anterior-posterior direction.
HP:0002599.definition_cn: 中等速度（3至4赫兹）的前后方向头部震颤。

HP:0002600.name: Hyporeflexia of lower limbs
HP:0002600.definition: Reduced intensity of muscle tendon reflexes in the lower limbs. Reflexes are elicited by stretching the tendon of a muscle, e.g., by tapping.
HP:0002600.definition_cn: 下肢肌腱反射强度减弱。反射通过拉伸肌肉肌腱（例如叩击）引出。

HP:0002601.name: Paresis of extensor muscles of the big toe

HP:0002604.name: Gastrointestinal telangiectasia
HP:0002604.name_cn: 胃肠道毛细血管扩张症
HP:0002604.definition_cn: 胃肠道毛细血管扩张症。

HP:0002605.name: Hepatic necrosis
HP:0002605.definition: The presence of cell death (necrosis) affecting the liver.

HP:0002607.name: Bowel incontinence
HP:0002607.definition: Involuntary fecal soiling in adults and children who have usually already been toilet trained.
HP:0002607.definition_cn: 成人及已接受如厕训练的儿童出现的不自主性粪便失禁。

HP:0002608.name: Celiac disease
HP:0002608.definition: Celiac disease (CD) is an autoimmune condition affecting the small intestine, triggered by the ingestion of gluten, the protein fraction of wheat, barley, and rye. Clinical manifestations of CD are highly variable and include both gastrointestinal and non-gastrointestinal features. The hallmark of CD is an immune-mediated enteropathy. This term is included because the occurrence of CD is seen as a feature of a number of other diseases.
HP:0002608.definition_cn: 乳糜泻（Celiac Disease, CD）是一种影响小肠的自身免疫性疾病，由摄入麸质（小麦、大麦和黑麦中的蛋白质成分）引发。乳糜泻的临床表现具有高度变异性，包括胃肠道和非胃肠道特征。乳糜泻的标志是免疫介导的肠病。该术语被纳入是因为乳糜泻的发生被视为多种其他疾病的特征之一。

HP:0002612.name: Congenital hepatic fibrosis
HP:0002612.definition: The presence of fibrosis of that part of the liver with congenital onset.

HP:0002613.name: Biliary cirrhosis
HP:0002613.definition: Progressive destruction of the small-to-medium bile ducts of the intrahepatic biliary tree, which leads to progressive cholestasis and often end-stage liver disease.
HP:0002613.definition_cn: 进行性肝内胆管树中小胆管的破坏，导致进行性胆汁淤积，并常发展为终末期肝病。

HP:0002614.name: Hepatic periportal necrosis
HP:0002614.definition: A type of hepatic necrosis that is concentrated around the necrosis of hepatocytes localized around the intrahepatic branch of portal vein.
HP:0002614.definition_cn: 一种以门静脉肝内分支周围肝细胞坏死为特征的局灶性肝坏死。

HP:0002616.name: Aortic root aneurysm
HP:0002616.definition: An abnormal localized widening (dilatation) of the aortic root.
HP:0002616.definition_cn: 主动脉根部异常局部扩张（扩张）。

HP:0002617.name: Vascular dilatation
HP:0002617.definition: Abnormal outpouching or sac-like dilatation in the wall of an atery, vein or the heart.
HP:0002617.definition_cn: 动脉、静脉或心脏壁的异常外凸或囊状扩张。

HP:0002621.name: Atherosclerosis
HP:0002621.definition: A condition characterized by patchy atheromas or atherosclerotic plaques which develop in the walls of medium-sized and large arteries and can lead to arterial stenosis with reduced or blocked blood flow.
HP:0002621.definition_cn: 一种以斑块状动脉粥样硬化或动脉粥样硬化斑块为特征的疾病，这些斑块在中型和大动脉壁内形成，可能导致动脉狭窄，进而引起血流减少或阻塞。

HP:0002622.name: obsolete Dissecting aortic dilatation
HP:0002622.name_cn: 过时的术语：夹层主动脉扩张\n现代医学术语：主动脉夹层（Aortic Dissection）

HP:0002623.name: Overriding aorta
HP:0002623.definition: An overriding aorta is a congenital heart defect where the aorta is positioned directly over a ventricular septal defect, instead of over the left ventricle. The result is that the aorta receives some blood from the right ventricle, which reduces the amount of oxygen in the blood. It is one of the four conditions of the Tetralogy of Fallot. The aortic root can be displaced toward the front (anteriorly) or directly above the septal defect, but it is always abnormally located to the right of the root of the pulmonary artery. The degree of override is quite variable, with 5-95% of the valve being connected to the right ventricle.
HP:0002623.definition_cn: 主动脉骑跨是一种先天性心脏缺陷，其中主动脉直接位于室间隔缺损上方，而非左心室上方。其结果是主动脉接收来自右心室的部分血液，导致血液中的氧含量降低。这是法洛四联症的四种病理表现之一。主动脉根部可向前（前向）移位或直接位于室间隔缺损上方，但其位置始终异常地位于肺动脉根部的右侧。骑跨程度差异较大，主动脉瓣与右心室的连接比例在5%至95%之间。

HP:0002625.name: Deep venous thrombosis
HP:0002625.definition: Formation of a blot clot in a deep vein. The clot often blocks blood flow, causing swelling and pain. The deep veins of the leg are most often affected.
HP:0002625.definition_cn: 深静脉血栓形成。血栓常阻塞血流，导致肿胀和疼痛。下肢深静脉最常受累。
